utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , you wanna see a movie tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds like a good plan . What do you want to see ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about Legally Blonde .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ah , my girlfriend wanted to see that movie . I have to take her later so I don't want to watch it ahead of time . How about The Cube ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Isn't that a scary movie ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How scary can it be ? Come on , it'll be fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . I'll give it a try .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's the spirit . I'll see you tomorrow after class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . See you tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ann , it's terrible !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , this is a pimple !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I think it is .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How come ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think it's because of your bad habits !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have no bad habit . I sleep eight hours a day , never eat spicy food , clean the face twice a day and so on . I have done a lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know you have done a lot , but you always sleep very late . Sleeping eight hours a day doesn't mean it is healthy . Sleeping after 12 is hurtful to our body , and I think this is your problem .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wasn't aware of that !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You should do better later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a great weekend that was !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My feelings exactly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really enjoy the beach in the summer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I couldn't agree with you more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We should come here more often .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are absolutely right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'd like to come back next weekend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's exactly the way I feel .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , it's getting late . I've got to run . It was nice talking to you , karren .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , Tim . Nice meeting you , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess we'll see each other around .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I hope so . Well , take it easy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Haven't seen you for a long time

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've been away on a vacation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I bet you had a wonderful time

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , beautiful sunshine , pleasant scenery and many new friends

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds great

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: how was school today , Dominic ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hate school !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: why ? What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I messed up my mid-term exam so badly today !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it's just one exam . Can you re-take the exam ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes , but it's so humiliating ! I don't want my friends to know I failed !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: why didn't you do a good job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know . I sat down in my seat , looked at my paper , and then my mind just went totally blank .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: do you think you studied enough for the exam ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: no ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: what did you do last night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I watched TV .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: did you study at all last night for your exam ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: no , not really .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am sure if you had studied , you would have done well . When can you re-take your exam ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: alright . Get out your books and I'll help you prepare .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My goodness ! She is thirty seconds faster than the world record in 5000 metres race .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excuse me , what did you say ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A Chinese girl has broken the world record in the Olympic Games .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's incredible . I can't believe it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You have to . It is sure .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How amazing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You look like a basket case .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not surprised .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's the problem ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My brother in-law just dropped in from the states .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , and ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I decided to put him up while he's here , big mistake !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's lazy . I tried being a good host , but if you give him an inch , he'll take a mile .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess you think twice next time he comes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You can say that again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So how long has he here for ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Two weeks . If he thinks I'll put up with his attitude that long he's got another thing coming .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I know you do the right thing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What am I doing ? What am I doing ? Don ' t you know what day it is ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mumm . no .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s only the day when the world ' s biggest sporting event is kicking off .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The World Cup ! The first match is today ! It ' s Mexico vs . South Africa ! It ' s going to be a really good match ! Both teams have a very strong offense and have skilled players . I think that South Africa

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have no idea what you ' re talking about . The only sporting event we watch at home is the Super Bowl .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is bigger than the Super Bowl , man ! Teams from 32 countries compete against each other every four years and fight to win that trophy . They first start in a group stage with bigger groups , each g

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds interesting , but soccer doesn ' t really appeal to me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? Over seven hundred million people watched the final match of the World Cup ! It ' s a very exciting and nerve wracking sport ! Each nation is cheering on their team , hoping they will bec

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All I know about soccer is that you can ' t use your hands and that players are always falling down , trying to get a free kick or penalty kick . It seems like a sissy sport to me !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Whatever , I ' m going to go watch the opening match .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: do you remember where you were for the terrorist attacks on 9-11 ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes , I was in my apartment in Beijing . Where were you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was at home with my parents in New York City .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: really ? Did you see the hijacked planes crash into and destroy the twin towers ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn't see the crash itself , but I did see the smoke and everything afterwards from my parents ' apartment building .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that must have been horrible . Did you go out at all that day to see what was going on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: no , we decided to stay in our apartment . With all the buses out of service and the underground trains at a halt , many people had no choice but to walk home . It was utter chaos .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: did you know anyone who worked in the World Trade Center ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: yes , my uncle's firm had an office in one of the towers .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: did he survive ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: unfortunately , he wasn't able to evacuate in time . He ended up dying in the tower .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sorry . That must have really been a nightmarish day for you and your family .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it was . The hijackers didn't have any respect for human life not even their own .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: terrorist acts are deliberate and deadly and can affect every walk of life .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope so . I'm looking for some material for a paper I'm writing , and I'm not quite sure where to look .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll certainly try to help you . What topic is your paper on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My paper is on the influence of television on children .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There are several possible sources you might use for that topic . I suggest you use the computer and the computer will give you a list of every scientific journal that talks about children and television .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for you help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you seen that house ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it looks interesting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right . I love it very much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It must be old .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: At least more than 100 years old .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's enter it !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't open the door .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It must be locked .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me ask the old woman in that reception office .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She can't answer you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She must be deaf .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It must be a haunted house . Are you frightened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Frightened ? You must be joking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where are you going this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have no idea . Maybe I will sleep for the whole day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So boring ! Shall we go out for a picnic with my friends ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds interesting . Who are the other people ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fred and David , my college class mates and Rachel .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Gorgeous ! What should I bring on that day ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your tent and enough food and water .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean , we can do many other things after the picnic , right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We can go fishing , chatting and camping .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are we waiting for ? Come on !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't hurry . Wait for my call .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a fine day today , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it is . It ' s wonderful after the downpour .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How nice seeing the sun back again ! The air is so fresh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope it stays nice like this for a long period of time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , the weather is so unpredictable this time of year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're right . We don't know what is going to be like tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look ! It looks as if it is going to rain .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The weatherman predicts a fine day today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The weather is often quite different from the weather forecast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you hear what happened to Mike in Accounts ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . What ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He got arrested on Friday night and spent the night in jail .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . Really , what happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , it was all a big mistake , actually . He got home on Friday night really late , and apparently he'd been out drinking with some clients , so he was really drunk .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Was he out with the guys from the bank ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I think so .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yeah , they always get really drunk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , anyway , he'd somehow lost his wallet and his house keys , so he couldn't get in . He lives alone , you know .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really . I thought he lived with his wife .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , she left him last year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ? Do you know why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hang on , let me finish telling you what happened . Where was I ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He lost his wallet and keys .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh yes , well , he tried to climb in through the bathroom window , but apparently he slipped and broke the glass with his foot . The neighbors heard him and thought a robbery was in progress , so they called the police .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , no .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . So when the cops arrived , they didn't believe his story

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So then what happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , when he sobered up , he called someone from work to come and bail him out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , that's a bit of a tricky situation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I know .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you ready to go the concert ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Should we go there by bus so we aren't late ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actually , why don't we go there by bike ? We could get stuck in traffic if we travel by bus in rush hour .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true . Cycling is good for our environment , too . Let me just get my helmet then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is your helmet comfortable ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really , but I liked the design , so I got it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe you should think about getting a round helmet ; they're better .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll think about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that your new bicycle ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , my father gave it to me for my birthday . Do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's the newest 10 speed cycling mountain bike . These are really expensive !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nothing but the best from my dad . I like everything about it except for the brakes . They are a bit sticky .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can fix those for you . Is there anything else wrong with it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , my saddle is too low for me . Do you know how to change the height ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's easy . It's important to have the saddle high enough so that your legs can extend fully when you are on your bicycle .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is that why my knees have felt sore after every time I've ridden my bike ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's possible . Give me a minute and I can fix these for you and then we can go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , Mary , can you cut that out ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cut what out I ' m not doing anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The tapping of your pen on your desk . It ' s driving me crazy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine ! By the way would you mind not slurping your coffee every time you have a cup !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don ' t slurp my coffee . And plus , how can you hear it when you ' re shouting into your phone all the time ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' Ve got to be kidding me ! You ' re complaining about me talking on the phone when you go out for a cigarette break ten times a day to shoot the breeze ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , we have a lot of accumulated anger from working in these conditions , and it ' s probably okay to let off steam once in a while . But , it ' s probably not a good idea to keep it up I ' m willing to forgive and forget and if you are .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine . Let's call a truce . I'll try to more considerate and to keep the noise down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I ' ll try to do the same . So , I was wondering you wanna go out to dinner Friday night ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your thesis going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't mention it . The thesis due date is coming , but my thesis isn't even close to being done .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've finished the first draft , but the professor said it's poorly written . I have to rewrite it . it's so depressing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry . Anyway , you are better than me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Doris , I'm glad you're home . I'm terrified . I don't know what to do !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ? What happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think someone is stalking me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , it can't be . Really ? Who ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I saw him the first time Tuesday . He was at the cafe . I noticed he was looking at me a lot . Not just the usual looking , but staring . He just kept staring at me . He didn't stop .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn't do anything . Finally , he left . But then I saw him again today . Outside the shoe store . Near the cafe . I went into a CD store and pretended I was looking at CD's . But then he came in too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did he leave when you left ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . Then I noticed he was on the sidewalk behind me . He was following me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He followed me all the way home !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's about five blocks . And around corners too . So he was definitely following you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , he was . I'm not imagining it . Finally , just when I got home , I turned around and looked at him . He was just standing there . He didn't smile . He just stood there . It was so obvious . What should I do ? I'm so scared . Can I call the police ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , I don't think you can call the police . Not yet at least . He hasn't done anything . And probably the police will just ignore it . But if anything happens again , then maybe you should call .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why can't I call the police now ? He was definitely following me !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course you can call the police if you want . That's not what I mean . I'm just saying that they probably won't do anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I suppose . What can they do ? I don't even know who he is .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen , Carol . Don't let this bother you too much . Probably it's nothing . Just keep your eyes open when you go out . If you see him a third time , and if he follows you again , then I think we should go to the police . But for now , just try not to worry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . And I won't go to that cafe for awhile .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jim , I heard you ' Ve bought a new computer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Look , it is on my desk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your office looks different with a computer . By the way , is it difficult to use a computer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not at all . It ' s a piece of cake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A piece of cake ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . It ' s easy and convenient to use a computer . But it takes a long time to really master it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Could you help me prepare for my presentation on Friday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I would love to help you prepare for your presentation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hate to ask you to do something like that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This will not interfere with my work . I promise you that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When could we get together ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I could easily give you some time tomorrow night .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to meet me at the coffee house next door ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , and could you write down anything you might be having trouble with ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll come prepared .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Goodbye until then . I promise you that you'll do well after we meet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , Emily , how was your day ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think you really want to hear about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It can't have been that bad . Go on and tell me about it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To be honest , it was horrible ! My manager is such a pain in the neck !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ? What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them , my manager blamed them on me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's not very fair . What did you do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There wasn't really anything that I could do . There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself . If I had said anything , he would have fired me for sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Does he treat everyone in your department like this ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He treats everyone pretty badly , but the way he treats me really takes the cake !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really have no idea . All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at your company ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really . I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's very sensible . It sounds like you have a good head on your shoulders .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I try to be sensible about it , but it's not very easy . Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's so true . When you have a taste for success , you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then I'll take them . How much ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: $ 120 . The small gift box is complementary .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here is $ 150 . Keep the change .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you ! Have a nice day !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You too . Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Helen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Steven .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m very well , Thank you . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m fine , thanks . How is Tony ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He ' s fine , Thanks . How ' s Emma ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She ' s very well , too , Helen . Goodbye , Helen . Nice to see you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nice to see you , too , Steven . Goodbye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have an idea for Christmas this year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's not exchange any gifts at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You big scrooge !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hear me out . We can pool the money and give it to a family who could really use it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you may have some trouble convincing the kids .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actual 1y , it was their idea first .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now we know that they realize the real meaning of Christmas .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , daddy is on again . Don't you think he is handsome ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To some extent , he is . And what do you think we move to a better place ? I can't see him clearly from here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The seats in the middle of this stadium are great , but they're already occupied by somebody else .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , thank you for pointing that out . By the way , have you been following NBA for this season ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course , tomorrow evening there will be a most exciting game .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Who plays who ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Rockets vs Lakers . Yao Ming , my idol , will appear in front of several hundred million of the worldwide audience .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's amazing . And when did he begin to play in the NBA ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: In 2002 . And since then he has attracted more attention than ever .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't consider you as a little kid any more . I know he is very tall .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you know something . He is 2 . 26 meters tall . But he is also nimble and skillful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I also heard if a player has committed 5 fouls then he must be out of the game .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , what's worse is he can't take any further part in the game .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's really terrible . Oh , God , we forgot to cheer for Daddy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind . After all he is not so attractive as Yao Ming , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are always so naughty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that you , Dave ? Oh , my gosh ! The backstabber who left us to work for the evil WebTracker !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , yeah , yeah . Hi , Mary . How are you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm filthy rich ! Haven't you heard about the MicroPower deal ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I guess I did . They're going to buy invoking ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's right . For seventy-five million . So how are you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm getting by OK . I heard MicroPower was going to make Zina president of their new invoking Internet division .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What should I get Uncle Teddy ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You could get him a tie .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? That's the stupidest gift one can buy . I don't want to get a tie .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Everybody gets men ties for Christmas . It's too boring . Everybody buys either ties or sweaters . I want a more unique gift .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , you can buy him a pet iguana then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a cool idea . At least it would be a surprise . But I'm afraid he wouldn't take care of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He would think you were crazy , Caroline .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . An iguana is too strange for a gift , and a tie is too normal . So I have to find something halfway between .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How much do you want to spend ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , he was very good to me . He helped me edit my essay for the scholarship contest . So I want to spend at least 75 dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright , I have an idea . You know he carries that conservative-looking briefcase every day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , he isn't a lawyer , so I don't think he needs to have a briefcase like that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What should he have then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think he would appreciate having a very fine leather bag . But more like a workbag or shoulder bag . You know , not so hard and square like a briefcase .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think that's a great idea . Men look great with that kind of bag . Where can we buy one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think this mall has a leather goods store . So we have to go to State Street .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . We can go later then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We can buy something for Mom and Dad here , and then go buy Uncle Teddy's gift on State Street .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good plan . What should we get for Mom though ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She said she wants one of those automatic foot massagers . I think they sell them at Sears .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . We can go check at Sears and see if they have them . And what about Dad ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about the iguana ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it would be a great joke . But I know we'd have to take the iguana back . And the pet store might not let us . So why don't we get him something else ? Some clothes maybe .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A tie ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , shut up about ties ! Forget about ties , why not ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was just kidding .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I decided to give it a go !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good for you . What items did you bid on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A DENY shirt and one of Serena Williams ' used tennis rackets !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your idol ! Wow ! You're even better at finding stuff than me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yep . I placed a bid for the shirt . The minimum was ten so I bet fifty !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's not how this game works .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , there was a sign that said " Buy now for seventy . "

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How many bids had been placed before you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hear you are moving to Dalian .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . I found a very good job down here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , we'll certainly miss you here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am going to miss you , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's keep in touch .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . I will write to you as soon as I get there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think your speech was excellent .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Was it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure it was .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . It was really a challenge to speak before such a large audience , you know .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But you did it and did it well !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! I've been cheated !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? What did you buy ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a brick ! I can't believe how stupid I was . Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ? Why did you buy a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There was a guy on the sidewalk . He had three new boxes , Panasonic video camera boxes . He said he had to get rid of them quick .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So he said he'd sell me one for twenty dollars . A four-hundred-dollar camera for twenty bucks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it's a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't believe how stupid you are . Why didn't you open the box ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wanted to . But he said , no , the box is still in its plastic wrap from the store . If it's opened , other people won't believe it's new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So he had the boxes wrapped in plastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it was the kind of perfect plastic wrap that comes with new products . Look , it even had a bar-code price sticker on it ! It looked brand new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But why would a guy be selling new video cameras for twenty dollars ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He said he had to get rid of them . They were stolen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aha ! Now I understand . You were trying to buy stolen goods on the sidewalk . So , what I think is , you deserve to get cheated !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: C'mon , don't blame me ! I thought it was a new camera . We could use it . We were even thinking about buying a camera . I don't understand how he could have such a perfect-looking box .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's no problem . He just has a friend who works in a shop that can do plastic wrap . That's easy . And probably it's the same shop he got the boxes from . Maybe his friend works in an electronics store . They sell video cameras there . Probably they had a couple video camera boxes lying around . So they get the idea of wrapping bricks to sell to fools like you . Twenty dollars a brick . That's a good profit if they can sell enough bricks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right , Sarah . I was a fool . I can't believe it . How could I fall for such a trick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , the view from the peak is so grand !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look , most of the maple leaves have turned red .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you ever see this kind of beautiful scene ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , my father used to take me to Kiang Shan or somewhere like that as a child .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But my father did not . He didn't have much time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Honey , I'm sorry . I promise you , this summer vacation , I will take you to Huang-Shan Mountains . It is more beautiful and magnificent .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? It's a deal . Have you ever been there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I went there five years ago . You were still a baby at that time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It really gets me interested . Is it higher than Kiang Shan ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Surely . You can enjoy the beauty of numerous streams and waterfalls . The sea of clouds has a fairy tale beauty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I see the rainbow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That depends . If you are lucky , you can see a vivid rainbow across over two peaks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why don ' t you sit down and relax , darling ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t want to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , come and talk to me then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Certainly not .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I turn on the radio then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Turn on the radio ? What for ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So that we can sit down together and listen to some music .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen to some music ? And who ' ll cook dinner ? Will you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , I will . But let ' s go to a disco after dinner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To a disco ? Oh , no . You know I hate pop .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you been to Shanghai before ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes I have . I ' Ve been there three times in the past year .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds great . Have you been to the top of the Pearl Tower ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No I haven ' t . I haven ' t visited the Bund either . I ' Ve always had too much work to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So you haven ' t done much then , in Shanghai ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , I ' Ve eaten soup dumplings in a lovely restaurant on Nanjing Lu . They were delicious !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you do in your free time , Nancy ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I like playing the violin .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? How long have you been playing the violin ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: About ten years so far . I started learning when I was in middle school .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's really interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . So what about you ? Do you have any hobbies ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I like collecting matchbox ! I'm not sure if that counts , though .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course it does . Everybody has his own hobby .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm very grateful for what you have done to my son , doctor .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's all tight , Mr . Smith . That ' s my job . I'm very glad he recovered so soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know he has brought great trouble to you . A million thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No trouble at all . He's very cute and brave . By the way , do remember to keep him away from sea food for at least two weeks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will . It's most thoughtful of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's in the box ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sandy , I think we made a mistake ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a cute little teddy bear !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How sweet ! Maybe he was just a shy guy who had a crush on you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And look what we did to him ! Hey ... he left me his business card .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! Call him tonight ! You guys will really have an interesting love story to tell everyone !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Diana , do you like the perfume I gave you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s good . But to tell you the truth , I don ' t wear perfume .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sorry . I didn ' t know that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s all right . Thank you all the same .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jane , I was wondering if you you had any plans for saturday afternoon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A friend and I are planing to go out , why ? what's up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There is a special exhibition of french sculptures at the museum , I was hoping you ' d like to come with me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am afraid I can't I am going to be out all day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about sunday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wish I could , but it's my mums birthday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe next week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Much as I ' d like to , I am afraid i wont be free next week , I have a lot of work .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry to hear that , I was really looking forward to spending some more time with you , I really enjoyed our last chat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am really sorry too , maybe I can give you a call sometime .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid it's a bad news for you . There are some problems in your supervised goods .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , no ! How did this happen . Are you sure ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I overheard this information when I passed Arden's office . We got some complaints from consumers yesterday . I am terribly sorry for that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My God ! I actually checked them one by one . How could this be ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Calm down ! It is useless to act like that . Can we find some solutions ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What kind of solution can I have now ? I nearly go crazy now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But we still have to find one . Can we find Arden to check whether this is true or not ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It seems that I have nothing to do , except this .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Face the reality . Maybe we can find the way to make up the loss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s very kind of you to invite me to dinner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Please sit down and make yourself at home . Please don ' t stand on ceremony .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This dish is really delicious .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m glad that you like it . This is only the first time that I made it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re great . Could you say it in Chinese ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , we call it doubt .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Welcome , Ron , come on in !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Malia ! What a nice home !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We enjoy it too !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How long have you lived here ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: About four years now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it is very beautiful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ron , have a seat and I'll get us something to drink .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good ! I am really thirsty . You know it really is hot outside !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have lemonade , iced tea , and mango juice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Mango juice would be perfect . Thank you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We are through .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ? Isn't it obvious ? First you impose way too much on me , and I'm tired away . Second , you stood me up on the Valentine's Day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm very sorry for that , but I sent you several messages to explain , my mom was seriously ill , and I had to look afer her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I ended up with finding out lady that night , that you were with other girl at cafe near your home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That girl was my cousin .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You've got so many cousins . I called you later that night . But you didn't have the guts to answer the phone .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't take my cellphone with me at that time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't buy a story .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know you don't hear me right know , please calm down . Anyway , I don't wanna part . I'll drop by tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , don't , I don't want to see you anymore . Don't ever call me again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The dinner was really good . It knocked my socks off .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's very kind of you to say so . Let's try some after-dinner wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . Sweet wines are my favorite . They always make a great finish to a decisions meal .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you prefer brandy or ports .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Port , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excellent choice . I love its smooth flavor .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The port is quite exquisite . It must have spent years aging in barrels . Am I right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . You always have a good nose for wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Next time we are about to dinner we should try some Canadian ice wine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , what's that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's made from naturally frozen grapes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ? It sounds great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , here's to your health .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . Cheers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Cheers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's brilliant ! We can name the grades of motor oil by where they come from .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Mr . Mechanic , I'd like a nice Venezuelan blend this morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think the Saudi Arabian will hit the spot today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But really , maybe this can work . Everyone loves coffee , and everyone needs motor oil .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A match made in heaven .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Tony . You look unhappy . What's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Steven , I made a big mistake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really wish I hadn ' t done it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What on earth are you talking about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I got caught cheating . I feel so ashamed . The teacher saw me and told me I failed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What were you thinking ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know my father . If I fail , he'll kill me . I have to do well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But what you should do is study hard .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know ... I know ... it's all my fault . I feel awful that I didn ' t study , and I cheated , and I got caught .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So long as you learn from your mistakes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy New Year , Jim !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , same to you ! Lee , have you got any plans ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I'm going to the Temple Fair with my family .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How nice ! Have fun !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , Emily , how was your day ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think you really want to hear about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It can't have been that bad . Go on and tell me about it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To be honest , it was horrible ! My manager is such a pain in the neck !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ? What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them , my manager blamed them on me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's not very fair . What did you do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There wasn't really anything that I could do . There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself . If I had said anything , he would have fired for me for sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Does he treat everyone in your department like this ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He treats everyone pretty poorly , but the way he treats me really takes the cake !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really have no idea . All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at you company ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really . I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's very sensible . It sounds like you have a good head on you shoulders .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I try to be sensible about it , but it's not very easy . Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's so true . When you have a taste for success , you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you feel like going to see Paul and Claire tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like that very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How does 7:30 sound ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine . See you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's the problem , Nada ? You look down in the dumps .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know . My life is a big mess . Everything is so complicated .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , nothing can be that bad .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But promise me , you'll keep it a secret .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , I promise . So what's troubling you so much ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've fallen in love with my boss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Is he married ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bo , of course not . He is still single .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then what's your problem ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I try to keep it to myself . But there is a lot of gossip about us .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I see . Office romance tends to be the subject of gossip .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Worse still , he is trying to avoid me these days .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Office romance is very tricky .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It gives me a lot of pressure and I feel depressed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Cheer up , Nada . You'll be fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Listen to this . Mary got married .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is she really ? I can ' t believe it !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . Yesterday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good gracious . That ' s incredible !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She married Jerrod .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re kidding .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She ' s going to live in Paris .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I ' m surprised .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is the end , Jane . I don't want a girlfriend who goes out with other guys all the time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I won't do it again . Please forgive me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No way . I've given you too many chances already .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like this dress ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's nice . But what kind of dress are you looking for ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Something attractive and dressy . Maybe a little sexy too . New Year's Eve is a special occasion and it only happens once a year , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course . It's common too that we wear something special for our Chinese New Year .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: People here always wear the best clothes they have . Many people go out and buy clothes especially for New Year's Eve .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Any other common customs of your New Year ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Before the New Year , we always send greeting cards to our relatives and friends to wish them a happy year . On the street and in stores people usually greet others with a ' Happy New Year ' . It's also common for people to make a New Year's resolution .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's when people quit a bad habit or do something they find hard to do . Many people resolve to quit smoking , lose weight , or stop nagging their wife , etc . However , it usually lasts only for a few days !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: By the way , where are you going on New Year's Eve ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We're going to a night club for dinner and dancing , then we'll go down to the city square for the big celebration . There's always a fireworks display put on by the local government . We all want you to come too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks a lot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , let me introduce myself . I'm your new neighbor . My name is Andy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Andy . I'm Judy . It's nice meeting you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice meeting you , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come over and visit when you have time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks for the invitation . I will !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , George , what a beautiful day it is today ! The sun is hot and there are just a few clouds scattered here and there ! What a perfect day to be at the beach ! The kids are going to have so much fun ! And we ' ll be able to relax in the sun while they ' re playing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It does seem like the perfect day ! I ' m glad we chose to get out of the city and enjoy the nice weather ! This looks like the perfect spot ! Ok kids , put on your sunscreen while your mom and I set up camp . Here , Mary , help me lay down these beach towels .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There we go . Can you help me with the umbrella ? Perfect .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok kids , here ' sa beach ball and a Frisbee , a pail and a shovel . I want to see an impressive sandcastle by the time we leave . Don ' t stray too far . Wait ! Leave your sandals here or put on your wet shoes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And stay in the shallow area . I don ' t want to see you go any farther than that sandbar ! It ' s too deep out there and we didn ' t bring your floatier .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re back already ? The water was too cold , huh ? I ' ll tell you a secret . Do you see that small pool of water over there ? It ' ll be warmer in there . Go see if you can find some seashells or catch some minnows .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is that ? A jellyfish ? Jeremy , put that down right now ! It could sting you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ah ! Not on me ! Ow !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mike's going to have a self-driving traveling across the country .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? He is so great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You don't want to join him ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Surely I want . It's quite popular nowadays .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , and I want to have a try .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have a park in the city ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , there is a lake in the park . It is very beautiful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s great . We can go boating on the lake in the afternoon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s a good idea . But I am afraid it ' s too cold . It is very windy on the lake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then we can take a walk and enjoy the scenery in the park .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Everything ' s fine with me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What can I do for you today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it possible for me to view the apartment today ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Unfortunately , you will not be able to view it today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why can ' t I view it today ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' ll need to make an appointment to view the apartment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I understand . May I make an appointment then ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How does this Friday sound ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Friday at 6 pm . would be perfect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That will be fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for your help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m so excited , mother . Oh , a new baby !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My first grandchild .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And my first nephew . He looks a lot like you , mum . He does .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you think so ? Well , I guess . He does look a lot like me . Oh , he ' s got Richard ' s eyes though .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , he does have Richard ' s eyes . The baby even looks like you than Richard does .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , children usually resemble their parents .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s true . Michelle is a lot like Henry in so many ways . And she is shy with new people just like he is .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You often like comparing children with their parents .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey ! I have a surprise for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Open this card and read .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A trip to China for summer vacation . Wow ! What a wonderful surprise ! Thank you . This is the best surprise I've ever had .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The Blacks got divorced .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mr . Black has been getting a little on the side .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I am surprised . He doesn't look like a guy who'd ever cheat on his wife , does he ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , he doesn't . Anyway , his wife found out that he has been two-timing for a long time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I am really surprised . By the way , have you done anything behind my back ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No . The only thing I've ever done behind your back is zipping you up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like that joke , but I hope it's true .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This website offers very convenient air tickets booking service . It is quick and accurate .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I once booked there . They give the immediate confirm information and flight information to both your mobile phone and e-mail . You can conveniently pay by credit card , so the whole transaction only takes a couple of minutes . They also provide e-tickets , meaning you don ' t need to go to any office to pick an air ticket . You go to the airport directly and check in with your ID card .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So it has attracted more and more customers these days .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , therefore they are expanding the scope of their service . For example , hotels can be booked through the same site as well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why is the long face ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm getting sick of work man . I can't take the political bull in the company any more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you just get your review or something ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , but that's not why I am upset . I just found out another guy got a promotion . He doesn't know how to do anything . He sits there and kisses the managers butt all day long .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sucks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm just pissed that management can't see behind his smooth talking lies .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look on the bright side . At least you have a job .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . I shouldn't stress about this anymore . It's not like I can do anything about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly . Instead , we should have some drinks tonight .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about a cold bottle of beer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now you're talking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: your daughter will be back soon . I'm going to start making dinner . You can just watch some TV in TV room if you like . We just bought a new TV with a LCD screen . The remote control is on the coffee ta

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: would you mind if I helped out in the kitchen instead ? I do enjoy cooking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: this is supposed to be your vacation ; we'd like you to just relax .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: cooking makes me feel relaxed . So , what are we cooking ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ok , well , we're going to make a pan of lasagne , a salad , and some garlic bread . Here's the recipe . Do you want to get the ingredients we need out of the cupboard ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: sure . We should probably pre-heat the oven right away , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that's a good idea . Can you set the oven to 200 degrees Celsius ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that's a bit high for lasagne . I'll just set it at 180 degree and we can take it from there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: fine . I'll just get out the casserole dish , the saucepan , the salad bowl , and the baking sheet .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: you know , I could do this myself . Why don't you go get the screwdriver and the pliers and go fix the vacuum cleaner so it works better ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think it's broken .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: well , if it's not broken , then you need to learn how to vacuum better , because it doesn't look like you've vacuumed for ages !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: fine . I'll go vacuum . Let me know if you need any other help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like skiing , Pat ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love it . All my life I wanted to learn to ski . Finally I took lessons last year .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I suppose skiing is easy for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , quite the opposite . I thought I'd never stop falling down . Then all of a sudden I started skiing much better .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Do you ski often ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Every chance I get . On weekends I ski all day long . Sometimes I even ski at night .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yes . The ski slopes are well lit . It's really nice to ski at night . Why don't you learn to ski ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not on your life ! I know I'd break my leg

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't be so frightened . It's just a skill .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Going to the gym tonight , Mary ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , Sally . I want to do some sit-ups and perhaps get in a game of singsong .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds like fun . Would you mind some company ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd love it . Working out is more fun with a friend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll get my things and meet you there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . If you happen to see Jim and Bob on the way see if they would like a game of singsong .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice and warm again , isn ' t it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it ' s lovely . Think of the nasty weather we had last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you these days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine , thank you . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine today , though a bit under the weather last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , I'm Lucas , I just moved in next door .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , hi Lucas , come on in . I'm Barbara . Nice to meet you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice to meet you too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Would you like something to drink ? I've got tea and some grape juice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . Some tea would be nice . Chinese tea is great . I really like your tea set . Where did you get it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , there is a supermarket not far from here . But there is also a tea house around the corner , where you can get tea , taste tea and get a tea set as well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh yeah , I saw the tea house the other day . I think I might go and have a look sometime . It's a nice neighborhood here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are right about that . It's quiet and very convenient . You can get to the bus and the subway stations within ten minutes ' walk . There's a grocery store , a book store , a gym , and many restaurants along the street .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's a gym nearby ? That's exciting ! I really want to start to go to gym as soon as possible . I've been lazy this summer holiday and have put on some weight .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , if you want we can go together sometime . Actually I was thinking of going this afternoon , if you like , you can join me and I can show you the neighborhood along the way .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That would be wonderful . Thanks !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really enjoyed that film ! What about you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So did I . At first , I thought it was going to be boring , but then it turned to be good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What part of the film do you like best ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , the scene of the hero's struggle with enemies impressed me the most .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I loved it , too . To tell you the truth , I even dropped tears .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , tears also came to my eyes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It has got this year's Oscar Award .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It deserves it . The film gave us a lot of inspiration .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What case do you have against the police ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want to take them to court for arresting me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don ' t understand .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There was no reason for them to arrest me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They let you go , didn ' t they ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They released me the next morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They detained you at the station ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s exactly what they did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why did they arrest you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They said I matched the description of a robber .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I get it now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m definitely taking them to court .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My friend Jane is very beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's her figure ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Perfect . And I like her charming eyes , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's the color of her eyes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Dark blue .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: how old is she ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Twenty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hear Jean married a business tycoon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true . Her husband is a fat cat .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I don't think she really loves him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is only after his money .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If I were her , I wouldn't marry a man I don't really love .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But many girls nowaday do want to marry a man filthy with dough .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , do you think which team will get the champion tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is hard to guess now . Both of the teams chose the excellent players this time . I guess the game will end in a tie . They are equally matched .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am so nervous now . What a terrific game !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Which side are you on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's hard to say , because each team has my idols .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow ! AC wins . It is a close shave , you know .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will never forget this match . The angle is so terrible and so correct .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What a good goal !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so glad that the Spring Festival is near at hand .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too . I like the festival best of all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Think of the big face down the eve , hmm .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And special TV programs , fire crackers and the games to play .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , do you know any mystery belief serve the festival ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Such as ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know why fire crackers are set off in festival .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ? To welcome the new year of course ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And also to frighten away evil spirits .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And my parents say the whole year will be as good or as bad as new year day itself and bad or rude words on the day will bring a bad year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that's why my parents never scold me that day . They always try to avoid tears and quarrels .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny , you look terrible . What's eating you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't brother me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , chill out , I'm just trying to help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , Sally , it's not your fault .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , what's the problem ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I drew a blank on the algebra test .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No kidding ! Didn't you study for it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , but nothing was clear during the test .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's too bad , anyway , I'm sure things will turn around next semester .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm thinking of dropping out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can't do that , Jenny !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm dead serious about this , Sally .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , let's talk about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi . Ed , what's up ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nothing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Doesn't look like it to me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just get out of my face !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Woo , easy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Leave me alone !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you so ticked off about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't want to talk about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe I could help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I blew the finally exam .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You've got be joking .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I'm not .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , don't get bend on a ship about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think that the company retreat should be in the mountains this year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What a great idea !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: January would be a good month for a mountain retreat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like the mountain idea , but I am not so sure about the month of January .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know , now that I think about it , you might be right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: April might be nice . It is far enough away to make the necessary arrangements .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That is a good suggestion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We could ask everyone what would be the best time for them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , that would let us know what would work best .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll put the survey online this afternoon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really like the book you lent me the other day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And thank you very much for letting me keep it so long .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Everyone in our class enjoyed it too . It ' s very interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I'm glad .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you mind me keeping it for another three days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Joanna . You are looking very charming in the new dress .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . Does it suit me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it suits you very well . It certainly is unique . I don ' t think I ' Ve seen anything like it before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . That ' s why I bought it . I hate wearing the same styles like everybody else is wearing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And the necklace , it matches your dress marvelously .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s very nice of you to say so . I should say you are glamorous yourself , as a matter of fact .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for saying so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a beautiful view .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It sure is . The Grand Canyon is truly a masterpiece . No man could ever make anything like this .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is that below ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is the Colorado River . You can go down the river in a boat if you wish .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No . Thank you . It looks a bit too dangerous for me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There is a beautiful state park here . I can see why so many people come out here to camp .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , there is beautiful view . You can go fishing , camping and also enjoy this beautiful clean air .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It definitely is a nice change from the polluted and crowded city .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's true .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mom , I just finished my paper . Can you proofread it before I hand it in ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , let ' s take a look . Sweetie , this is terrific . Your ideas are so original .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can tell you worked hard on it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really did ! I started thinking about what I wanted to say three weeks ago .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it was definitely worth all the time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let ' s just hope my teacher agrees .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you be joining Billy and I at the Bar ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Which one will you be going to ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We are going to try the new one that opened up on 17th Street .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , I've been meaning to visit that place myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I want to stop off at my apartment to get changed so I should be there by 9 pm .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , can I bring a date with me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Certainly . But if there are going to be four of us , I had better make reservations .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . that is a very good idea . It would be a shame if we could not find a place to sit .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then I'II make reservations for 9 pm for a party of four .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll be there . Oh , is there a cover charge at the bar ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not that I know of . Why do you ask ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want to make sure I bring enough money for my date and I .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hear the drinks and food there are moderately priced . You should be fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: One last question . Is there a dress code there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , its very casual there . Leave your jacket and tie at home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect . I wanted to have a casual evening tonight .

utterances.speaker: A
