utterances.text: I'll see you there at 9pm .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay . See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I help you , sir ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , please . I'm picking out some presents for my children and wife .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of presents do you want ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , I don't know exactly . Do you have anything recommended ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . How about some very cool sneakers for your children ? Anyway , it won't cost you much . It's only around $ 59 . 95 for each pair . It might be cheaper than that in America .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , How did you know I came from America ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just a hunch , sir .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How much again ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's really cheap for shoes like those . OK , I'll take 5 pairs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , sir .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Because in this duty-free shop , your total expenditure cannot be over $ 300 and you also have one more present to buy for your wife .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my God . I've totally forgotten about that . Anyway , I think she would like a bottle of perfume .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's good . And I can also recommend you a good one . It's the brand of DENY .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: DENY ? That's very expensive in America . It costs nearly $ 70 for only 50ml . DKNY ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's $ 60 here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's very unbelievable . Is it fake ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course not , sir .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , I'll take one .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy anniversary , sweetheart !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . to our first anniversary and many more to come . Cheers !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll drink to that . Thanks for making this a night worth remembering .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it's a special day . They say if you survive the first year , the rest is smooth sailing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's good to know . Oh , listen ! The band's playing our song .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I requested it . What do you say ? Do you have your dancing shoes on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Always .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Kevin . I hate to do this , but I have to cancel our appointment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , no ! Why ? I was looking forward to seeing you at my new place .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I really wanted to come , too . But something unexpected in Shanghai have come up . I have to fly out for a few days , but I'll be back soon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem . Call me when you get back .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I should have some free time next week . Say , next Wednesday evening ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's good for me , but do you think you'll be back by then ? I'd really like to see you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I'm expecting to come back on Tuesday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! That's settled then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you doing , Andrew ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not well . I ' Ve been feeling pretty lonely lately .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But you have so many friends ! How could you be lonely ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know what they say'a friend to all is a friend to none ' . I don ' t feel like I really know any of my friends . In fact , I should probably call them acquaintances , not friends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about me ? I ' m your friend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know you are , you are my girlfriend . I wish I had a guy friend to hang out with sometimes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know what you mean . I find it difficult to make new friends , too . It ' s not as easy as it was when we were young , is it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' Ve made a lot of new friends since I started learning English . Maybe you could join a club or take a class to make some new friends .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s a good idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of qualities do you look for in a friend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m not sure . I guess I ' d like to meet some people who have a positive attitude and want to have a good time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: People who play ultimate Frisbee have a positive attitude ; maybe you should join the ultimate Frisbee club .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s a possibility . Thanks !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is how a holiday should be . Relaxing on the beach with a nice cool drink .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Isn ' t it wonderful here ? The kids are enjoying themselves in the swimming pool . I hope it ' s safe .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don ' t worry about them . They ' re very responsible . Besides , there are many people there and there ' s lifeguard employed by the hotel . Waiter ! Could I have another drink pleas ? Thank you . So , what shall we do this evening ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The kids said that they wanted to go to a party at the hotel . There ' s a special one just for kids .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , we could try that restaurant that was recommended in the guidebook . Then we could go to a club . We haven ' t been to one for ages .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s a great idea . We can really enjoy ourselves without worrying about the kids .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now , how about going for a swim in the sea ? We shouldn ' t sunbathe all day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Joanne . What are you up to ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm just watching some television .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so bored . I don't know what I'm going to do today and it is only ten in the morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too . Do you think we are boring people ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think we are boring . It's just that we don't have any hobbies .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's right . What do you think we should do as a hobby ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That all depends on what you like to do . For example , I like to doodle on the notepad , so I'm thinking about doing some real drawings .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like to play the piano for fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . That can be a good hobby .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hobbies are great . I'm going to make a list of all the things I like to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a great idea . I'm going to do the same .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice weather , honey !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The days are getting longer !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May and Daniel often like this kind of weather .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , they can enjoy themselves in the day time and it is not so hot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Honey , how about taking them to the beach this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Since last time we've climbed the mountain , we haven't gone out for a long time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And this kind of weather is rare for the season either .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I remember last year this time , the weather is so hot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So we must seize this chance to go the beach .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Daniel loves the beach very much !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He will enjoy himself this weekend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello Bill , what's new ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bob and Mary are back together .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad to hear it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too , they're such a nice couple .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How happy you are ! Next Monday is your wedding day . Congratulations !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fred is really a good guy . And he loves you so much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . I'm lucky to be his wife .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He's after your own heart , it is important .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So he will make a perfect husband . Make sure you will be here next Monday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I promise !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Recently , there prevails ' Net Love ' !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's Net Love ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Two people chat on the Net and step by step fall into love ! It's Net Love .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ridiculous ! They haven't met ! Maybe they're the same sex !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe yesterday you've received a man's woos . He's called ' Beast ' ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How could you know ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I watched the screen display !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you know ' He ' is Ms . Rebecca !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's typical Net Love , and a typical lesbians ' homosex ! HA !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Impossible !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to have dinner with me tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that sounds great !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' ll pick you up at ... say , 7,30 ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , that would be perfect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: See you tonight then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Thank you for inviting me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so glad we decided to go on a cruise for our vacation .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you even glad that we get to buy new clothes too ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah , that's all part of the fun . What do you think of these shorts ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They look really good on you . They look comfortable too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They are . I think I'm going to get a hat too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay . I chose this swimming suit . Do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow . You look great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great and white ! Which reminds me , let's pick up some heavy duty sunscreen !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks for lunch . It was delicious .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Next time lunch is on me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't be silly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm serious .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right . Next time you will treat .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a deal .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s freezing in here ! Can I turn up the heat ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t touch that thermostat ! You don ' t pay the bills around here !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Dad ! Are you serious ? What ' s the point of having central heating if we can ' t use it ! Look , I can see my breath !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Put on a sweater ! I ' m not gonna let you run up my heating bill just because it ' s a bit chilly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Dad ! I ' m gonna catch a cold !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When I was your age , my parents didn ' t have central heating like you do ! We had a furnace in the center of the living room and that was it . We used it to cook , heat the house and even dry our clothes ! We never caught a cold . You should be grateful !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think that show biz stars have a really easy life . They have lots of money , so they can buy almost anything they want . They ' re famous , so everyone loves them .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think they must have horrible lives . All the paparazzi take photos of them wherever they go and whatever they do . They must get sick of it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I bet they love it really . Sure , they complain about it , but that just gets them more publicity , doesn ' t it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think that few of the show biz stars want any publicity for themselves . They only want it for their films .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No way ! They want publicity for themselves , so that they get invited to make more films , go to lots of cocktail parties , and even make albums ! They have such an easy life . They don ' t even pay for Drin

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Show biz stars have plenty of expenses . That ' s why they need so much money . They need million of dollars to buy big , seclude houses and wonderful dresses . I bet most show biz stars would prefer to Wea

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don ' t understand how you can have any sympathy for show biz stars . They ' re overpaid , over-ambitious , and over-adored .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think you should give them some credit . They ' re very talented people and they deserve all the money they earn . They even donate money to charity to help people who are less fortunate than themselves

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on ! They only do that to get even more publicity for their films and themselves .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think that ' s settled .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm tired of your cut-and-dried opinions . Who do you think you are !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How dare you speak to me like this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , Jack , where's your car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I got rid of that clunker . This is my new one .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that right ? This sure beats the old one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hop in , I'll give you a ride .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . Boy , this looks expensive .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , it costed a bundle , alright ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , this thing can haul .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , this sucker is the fastest thing I've ever owned .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe it . Hoo , this car corners like it's on rails .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We are on the high way . Find the pound shade ..

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , this car can really burn rubber .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a great feeling .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You made a perfect choice , Jack .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , Daisy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You look like being on cloud nine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What has made you so happy ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think I'm in love .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you ? Who's the lucky girl ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Her name is Jenny .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did you meet her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We are in the same math class . Our teacher sat us next to each other .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you like best about her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She's very funny . She makes me laugh all the time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess it was fate working to bring you together .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Whatever brought us together , I'm happy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Joanne . What are you up to ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm just watching some television .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so bored . I don't know what I'm going to do today and it is only ten in the morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too . Do you think we are boring people ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think we are boring . It's just that we don't have any hobbies .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's right . What do you think we should do as a hobby ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That all depends on what you like to do . For example , I like to doodle on the notepad , so I'm thinking about doing some real drawings .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like to play the piano for fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . That can be a good hobby .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hobbies are great . I'm going to make a list of all the things I like to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a great idea . I'm going to do the same .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Veronica ! Veronica ! Veronica ! Are you OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Steven ! What ' s going on ! Who were those guys ? I didn ' t know you have a gun ! What ' s going on !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will come clean as soon as we get to safety , OK ? For now , you have to trust me , please ! I would never do anything to hurt you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Steven , I ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I haven ' t been completely honest with you Veronica , I ' m sorry . I ' m not a fireman . I ' m not even from the United States . I ' m a spy for the Indian government .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Why didn ' t you tell me before ? What are you doing here ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When I was a young boy , I used to play cricket my father back in my hometown of Hyderabad . It was a peaceful town , and my father was a renowned chemist . One day , he was approached by members of the CIA , claiming that my father had made the discovery of the millennium in his small lab back at the university where he taught bio-chemistry . I never saw him again . I vowed to discover the whereabouts of my father and consequently joined the Indian Intelligence Bureau .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What does that have to do with those men shooting at us ? Most importantly , why did you lie to me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sorry , I wasn ' t supposed to meet you . I wasn ' t supposed to fall in love with you , but you have to believe me when I tell you that what I feel for you is real .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can ' t believe this ! Why are all these things happening to me ! I can ' t take it anymore ! Let me out of the car !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Veronica , wait !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Larry , how was your weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not bad . We had a get-together with friends from college . I haven't seen many of them since graduation . How about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . I hung out with Jo all day shopping , and the went out for dinner together .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds a good weekend . You know it always amazes me that two people as different as you and Jo can become such close friends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I never thought we could be good friends either . We have our differences . She's more outgoing and active while I am more quiet and reversed , but we still get along extremely well . We can talk for hours about anything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great . I know people who can't stand each other for even five minutes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When Jo and I are together , we argue a lot , but that's also part of the fun . Besides , I know she will always be there for me when I need her , and she knows I'll be there for her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It seems you two bring out the best of one another .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly . Having Jo as my friend is one of the best things that's ever happened to me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , you are so lucky to have found each other .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks , I think so too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Donna , you really shocked everyone at the party last night !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean with my performance ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes ! We have all assumed that you were the quiet , shy type .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess everyone has a few secrets up their sleeve .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where did you learn to sing like that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was part of a band in school .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ? Wow . And why don't you ever dress like that at work ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come on ! This is work . Don't you think that would be a little weird ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The Great Wall is a great attraction for visitors .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a man-made wonder . I've seen it many times in textbooks and it's part of my dream to visit it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Someone claimed it was one of the two man-made wonders that could be seen on the moon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Shut up ... Billy ... BILLY !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! What's that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my new radio earphone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's so small that I didn't notice it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What were you screaming at me for ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Becky , what's up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not much , except that my mother-in-law is driving me up the wall .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's the problem ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She loves to nit-pick and criticizes everything that I do . I can never do anything right when she's around .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For example ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , last week I invited her over to dinner . My husband and I had no problem with the food , but if you listened to her , then it would seem like I fed her old meat and rotten vegetables . There's just nothing can please her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I can't see that happening . I know you're a good cook and nothing like that would ever happen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not just that . She also criticizes how we raise the kids .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My mother-in-law used to do the same thing to us . If it wasn't disciplining them enough , then we were disciplining them too much . She also complained about the food we fed them , the schools we sent them too , and everything else under the sun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You said she used to ? How did you stop her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We basically sat her down and told her how we felt about her constant criticizing , and how we welcomed her advice but hoped she'd let us do our things . She understood , and now everything is a lot more peaceful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds like a good idea . I'll have to try that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like traveling ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I've just come back from Scotland .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where did you visit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I only had time to visit Edinburgh .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did you like it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's fantastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why did you go there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I went there on business .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And do you have friends there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , a lot of friends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You must have enjoyed yourself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , and I took many pictures .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It smells like an ashtray in here !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi honey ! What ' s wrong ? Why do you have that look on your face ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ' s wrong ? I thought we agreed that you were gonna quit smoking .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No ! I said I was going to cut down which is very different . You can ' t just expect me to go cold turkey overnight !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , there are other ways to quit . You can try the nicotine patch , or nicotine chewing gum . We spend a fortune on cigarettes every month and now laws are cracking down and not allowing smoking in any public place . It ' s not like you can just light up like before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know , I know . I am trying but , I don ' t have the willpower to just quit . I can ' t fight with the urge to reach for my pack of smokes in the morning with coffee or after lunch ! Please understand ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine ! I want a divorce !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If ever you ' re in Chicago , please do look me up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , yes , I ' d like to , if it ' s not too much trouble .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No trouble at all . I think maybe you will meet some of my friends here as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' d be fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We're having a tailgate party I before the game . Would you like to join us ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay . But what is a tailgate party ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Someone brings a truck to the game and we have a barbecue right there in the parking lot out of the back of the truck !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How fun ! Can I bring something ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't worry about it ! Just come at five .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I make a mean potato salad !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , if you insist , you are welcome to bring a potato salad !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I'll see you in the parking lot at five ! Thank you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello there ! Come on in ! Don ' t just stand there ! Come and take a seat !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um , okay . Well , I just want a trim . Nothing too fancy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh my gosh ! Your hair is amazing ! So silky , so shiny ! I am going to work my magic on your hair ! You hear me ? You are going to look like a million bucks !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay . Um ... can you make sure my sideburns are even and you just take a little off the top .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don ' t you worry , I ' ll take care of everything ! Oh my god ! I just love your curly hair ! It ' s so fluffy and cute ! You should totally let it grow out . An afro would look great on you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um ... no .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , but you are going to be my masterpiece !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , what do you think ? How do you like New York ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm having a great time . I love it . I'm glad we came .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . I really like the stores and the shopping .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love the museums , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But the traffic is pretty bad .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . I hate all this traffic . It's really noisy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Listen , it's almost dinnertime . There are lots of restaurant around here . What do you want to try ? Italian ? Greek ? Japanese ? Thai ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't stand making decisions . You choose !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . Let's go American . Where's the nearest McDonald's ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , I'm Jake . I'm new to the choir . What's your name ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello , there , my name is Tonia .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you sing alto ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , I can do both soprano and alto but the director asked me to sing alto for the next perforate . What about you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Looks like we both float back and forth . I'm baritone .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Our bass section is really good . You're going to love singing with them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I heard them warming up earlier . You're right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's good to have you in the group . We can always use a good baritone !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Guess who I saw yesterday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know . Who ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Avril Lavigen !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The Canadian rock singer ? But I heard you had a part-time job yesterday . How did you see her ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I worked as temporary staff in her concert . Look , her poster , a CD ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So you're a big fan , eh ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not really . But I like some of her songs . She's actually very talented . She's a song writer and fashion designer , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And she was in a movie once again , right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , though I don't think her acting skills are that great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What was your impression of her when you saw her in person ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She looked sweeter than her pictures .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you take a photo with her ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , there were too many people . When she got out of the car , her fans were all screaming , trying to give her flowers and to get her autographs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Crazy !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! I've been cheated !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? What did you buy ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a brick ! I can't believe how stupid I was . Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ? Why did you buy a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There was a guy on the sidewalk . He had three new boxes , Panasonic video camera boxes . He said he had to get rid of them quick .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So he said he'd sell me one for twenty dollars . A four-hundred-dollar camera for twenty bucks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it's a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't believe how stupid you are . Why didn't you open the box ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wanted to . But he said , no , the box is still in its plastic wrap from the store . If it's opened , other people won't believe it's new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So he had the boxes wrapped in plastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it was the kind of perfect plastic wrap that comes with new products . Look , it even had a bar-code price sticker on it ! It looked brand new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But why would a guy be selling new video cameras for twenty dollars ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He said he had to get rid of them . They were stolen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aha ! Now I understand . You were trying to buy stolen goods on the sidewalk . So , what I think is , you deserve to get cheated !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: C'mon , don't blame me ! I thought it was a new camera . We could use it . We were even thinking about buying a camera . I don't understand how he could have such a perfect-looking box .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's no problem . He just has a friend who works in a shop that can do plastic wrap . That's easy . And probably it's the same shop he got the boxes from . Maybe his friend works in an electronics store . They sell video cameras there . Probably they had a couple video camera boxes lying around . So they get the idea of wrapping bricks to sell to fools like you . Twenty dollars a brick . That's a good profit if they can sell enough bricks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right , Sarah . I was a fool . I can't believe it . How could I fall for such a trick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look what you've done !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm very sorry , sir . I'll bring you a cloth immediately .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , and hurry up !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to apologize for my carelessness . May I clean it up for you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I'll do it myself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here is my card , sir . Could you send me the cleaning bill and I will refund the cost to you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I should think so , too !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm very sorry to have caused you this trouble .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , and please be more careful in the future !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will , sir . I'm really very sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You have made a poor meal . Let me get you some more fish .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , thanks . I have had enough .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about some drink ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Please bring me a cup of coffee .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , I ' m going to China .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How do you get the chance ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know . I took part in the Chinese contest . I was the best and they gave me this reward . I don ' t have to pay for my trip .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Congratulations . How lucky you are !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . I ' m leaving tomorrow morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sure you ' ll enjoy the trip . China is such a beautiful country .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sure I will .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have a nice journey , Lily .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you , David .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've been thinking of taking I've been thinking of taking a Crazy English course . Do you think it's a good idea

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure ! You should do anything you can to improve your English .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Do you think English is that important ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course it is . In fact , I'll even take the course with you if you want .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great ! It's always better to do things with a friend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have the phone number ? I need to call for registration .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I left it at home . Sorry !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's OK . I can get it from you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , do you want to go somewhere for dinner and practice our English together tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right . I know a great restaurant near here . But , it's a little expensive and I don't have much money with me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No problem . I just got paid . It ' s my treat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you ! I'll be sure to return the favor after our first class , OK ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Forget it ! That's what friends are for ! Besides , I have a VIP card for a discount .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good job ! This is going to be a great night !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think so too . Let ' s go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s a beautiful day here in New Zealand at the Men ' s Volleyball world championship . My name is Rick Fields and I ' m joined by the man with the plan , Bob Copeland .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Rick . We ' Ve got a very exciting encounter ahead of us today as two powerhouse teams , Brazil and China , face off against each other and try to qualify for the next round . Without a doubt , both teams are in top shape and this will prove to be a competitive match .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The ref signals the start of the game and here we go . Ribero serves and China quickly receives the ball . Chen bumps it to the setter , and ... a very nice set by Chen !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Xu spikes it ! Wow , what a great hit ! The Brazilian blockers anticipated the play and tried to block him but he managed to get the ball in ! Great play .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s China ' s service now . What a superb jump serve by Li , oh , and we have a let serve . The ball was coming in fast and almost made it over the net .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Brazil calls for a time out and we ' ll be right back , after a short commercial break .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You don't look too well . What's going on ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just lost my job . I'm just worried about how I'm going to pay the bills .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry to hear that . Have you been looking for another job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just started , but the job market is very bad right now . I'm not optimistic about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's tough . What does your wife think about this ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She's trying to be supportive , but I can tell she is very worried about our financial situation as well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have some friends who might be able to help you find a job . I'll see what they can do .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really appreciate your help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No problem . In the meantime , don't try to worry so much . You'll get through this .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Egg , this bathroom is a pigsty !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Helen , why do you keep flushing the toilet ? What's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I just can't stand it . It's really gross in here ! There ' s a stain on the toilet seat , and the floor was wet and slippery . So I cleaned it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You did what ? Helen , I know it's gross , but I ' Ve seen many public washrooms that are much worse . Why are you cleaning the counter top ? are you out of your mind ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't help myself ; it's just so disgusting in here !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Helen , this is not like your own bathroom . Just leave it to the cleaners , okay ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hang on . I'm just gonna quickly wipe the sink and sweep the floor .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're such a neat freak ! I'm outta here !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you hear about Joe ? She hasn't eaten for days .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ? What's eating her ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Love sick . You know who she's in love with ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't have the slightest idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Someone you're living with .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Not my Dad , I hope ! ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , Mary , it's your brother , Jack .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No kidding ! Jack is such a log ! He's never dated a girl .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The problem with Joe is that she's too shy to tell him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And the problem with Jack is that he seems to have no interest in girls . He's putting his heart into his stamp collection .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , if you want to help your friend , you should do something about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Simon , may I introduce you to Linda ? You don ' t know each other , do you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . I ' Ve not had the pleasure of meeting her yet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you do ? I ' m pleased to meet you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do you do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please sit down . Help yourself just like you are at home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What would you like to drink ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A cup of coffee , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a lovely day , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , the weather sure is nice today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love it when the weather is like this . Why don't we sit down outside and have our lunch ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds like a good idea . The sky is clear , the sun is shining and there's a nice cool breeze , so it is not too hot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really miss the change of seasons like we have in Colorado ; but I must admit , this sure is a nice spring day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , this spot in the shade looks really comfortable .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay . Hey , is that a dark cloud over there ? Do you think it will rain after all ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think so . I say the weather report last night , and it said the weather should be fine all day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If the weather stays nice perhaps we can go to the beach this weekend . It ' s been a while since I've not really gotten some sun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Karen , do you have a minute ? I'd like to ask you about something .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . What is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think you can give me some advice . You have worked here longer , and I just want to know what you think .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad to help you . But what is it you want to ask about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am worried about the meeting this morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ? I think the meeting went well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . But what are you worried about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid I was too rude .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Rude ? You weren't rude at all , Annie . Why do you think you were rude ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I maybe talked to Mr . Drummond too directly . I thought I maybe said too much . I don't want him to be angry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I understand . But really you weren't rude at all . You said what you thought . I think he appreciates that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I am new here , and I'm not sure he is used to that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean because you are a woman ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . And he is the president of the company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen , Annie . You shouldn't worry about Mr . Drummond . He is a very good man to work for . He is not sexist at all . He appreciates people for their ideas . And he is willing to take suggestions from men or women .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am very happy to hear that , Karen . It ' s good to know I'm working in such a company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I agree with you on that , Annie . I've worked for Derek Drummond for nine years now . I feel he appreciates his employees for their work , not their gender . I would never change jobs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good . Thank you for telling me this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Any time . If you have a good idea , don't be afraid to speak up . This is a company that appreciates initiative .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like music ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it depends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you think the music is well-matched ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I think the music is too fast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about the words of the song ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It sounds nice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like it . Naturally it can arouse your feelings .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I think so . It's very emotional .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course , and I also like the rhythms .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Full of energy and hope .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really . It's worth listening to and enjoying .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Certainly it is . It's worth an Academy Award .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My Goodness ! What a busy line so early in the morning ! Hello .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ruth ? Basil .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Basil .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Want a ride to the office ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , by all means . I was just about to leave .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hold on . Just 5 minutes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll wait on the sidewalk . It's very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my pleasure . See you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Basil .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Ruth . Hop in .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you mind if I take some notes while we drive ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course I don't mind . For your report ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I finally have an inspiration .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good for you . No problem , I'll listen to the car radio

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jimmy , I ' d like to wear this robe for tonight cocktail party . What do you think of it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t dress like that . You ' ll make fool yourself . You look stupid in that robe .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ? But it is my favorite piece of clothing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe it is . But it ' s out of fashion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What am I going to do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let ' s go downtown and pick up some fashionable clothes for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's get together this weekend , is that all right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds good , when ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When is it convenient for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Any time is fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Could you and your wife be ready at nine o'clock ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Please wait for us even if we're a little late .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind . I'll be waiting for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . Bye !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't stand the stupid guy any longer . It ' s unbelievable !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my dear lady . Take it easy . You should forgive a green hand like him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He does everything so mindlessly that he is going to drive me crazy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I suggest you talk with him and teach him how to deal with the problems .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have told him how to do it several times , but he's never listened to me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe you should communicate with him like a friend and not a boss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I always have difficulty in getting along with the staff .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just take them for your good friends and have a talk with them as we do , make sure you don't lose your temper .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think that's a bad idea . I'd hate anyone here to think of me as a friend . How would they ever respect me as they can do whatever they want ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I disagree . All you have to do is respect the staff and their opinions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bob !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Anne ! I haven't seen you for ages . How've you been ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine , just fine . And you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not bad . It really is great to see you again . W here have you been ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Guangzhou . I've got a cousin there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Kathy ! How are you ? It's been ages ! What are you doing these days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just opened my own restaurant . I'm also head chef .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're kidding ! You've always hated cooking !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I used to hate cooking , but now I love it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When did you change your mind ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: After I tried French food . Before that , I used to cook really boring things for my family .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I still can't believe it ! So , did you go to cooking school or something ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . I went to California to study .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? How long did you stay there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was there between 88 and 90 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And what did you do after that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I came back here . I worked for about three years to get some experience .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm going on a guided tour in the mountain .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You'll see the world-famous magnificent waterfall .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like the sight and the sound . It worked on me like a magic when I was a child

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your dream will come true . It's really breathtaking

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , thanks for calling 123 Tech Help , I ' m Todd . How can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello ? Can you help me ? My computer ! Oh man ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s okay sir , calm down . What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I turned on my laptop and it broke ! I mean , the monitor went black !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , sir , it sounds like you might have a virus .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t feel sick , ... let me check ... Nope ! No fever , I ' m fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , your computer might have a virus , I mean , it has a bad program on it . Maybe that ' s why it crashed . I recommend that you run an antivirus program in order to safely remove any unwanted spyware or Trojans .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Phew ! . . . Wait a minute , CRASH ? ? ! ! Spyware ? Trojans ! What ? where ? when ? !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did you spend the weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I went to a movie with my boyfriend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? How was it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was great . The director took a lot of care while framing . They say be has good chance at winning the Oscar for best director . Also I like the actors , some really great new young actors .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , yeah ? What's it about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it's the classic love story between two people from conflicting backgrounds . But besides a beautiful story , the cinematography is great . There is some really dramatic footage . It's really quite a visual feast . And the soundtrack is moving .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds pretty good . Is it a tragedy ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The ending is a bit of a surprise . I don't want to ruin it for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I like movies with surprise endings , although , sometimes they can be frustrating . Maybe I should invite my girlfriend to go next weekend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It would be a really good choice . The movie is very suitable for lovers to see together . I'm sure you won't regret it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come in , come in !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Gary , what happened ? I was waiting for you at the theater . Why didn ' t you meet me there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I thought we were supposed to meet HERE .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t you know our movie starts at seven ? And we were going to meet at the theater at five to seven . Then it doesn ' t make sense to meet at the apartment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sorry . We must have misunderstood each other .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why don ' t you try to be clearer about your intentions ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re right . I am sorry . Let ' s go and watch the movie .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s okay . I don ' t want to go now . We ' Ve already missed ten minutes of the movie . I don ' t want to see a movie without watching the beginning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , Jeff , that was a very productive meeting , I thought . You had some really great ideas in there !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Well , thanks for saying so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I mean it . Look , are you hungry ? Shall we go get something to eat ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , well , let me just get my coat and we'll go to the diner around the corner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is great , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's the most fun I've had in years .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We should do this more often .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , we should .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi Isabel ! You wanted to see me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes Anthony , come on in . Have a seat .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is everything okay ? You seem a bit preoccupied .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , Anthony , this is not going to be an easy conversation . The company has made some decisions which will have a direct impact on your employment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t want to beat around the bush so I ' m just gonna come out with it . We are going to have to let you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ? Why ? I mean ... just like that ? I ' m fired ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sorry but , to be honest , you are a terrible employee !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ! I resent that !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Anthony , you were caught making international calls from the office phone , you called in sick in eight times this month and you smell like alcohol !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me . Is there any body here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've finished up all my water . I would kill for a sip of water .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , come on in .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you very much . Are you here alone ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My father and sister are out to photographing . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm a back-packer from America .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is a back-packer ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It means a hiker who loves traveling around the world .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cool . You must have been to a lot of places .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , actually almost half of all the countries over the world . I love traveling places .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So cool . I want to be a back-packer when I grow up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can do it . But do work hard on your English to make it easier .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll try my best .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , Monica , what do you feel like doing this afternoon ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , I had a perfect plan for this afternoon , but it is totally ruined by the sand storm . I woke up this morning and found it was sunny . So I called Lucy and asked her to go shopping with me . We were going to look for a new purse . Now it turned out to be like this . Neither of us wants to go to outside anymore .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s too bad . I hate sand storms too . It can be worse than any kind of bad weather .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ' s wrong with climate ? Anyway , I think the sand storm happens more frequently these days than the years before . Can ' t people do something to stop it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It is not an easy job . The government is working on it . Lots of trees have been planted in the north of the capital . Also , methods of generating rain are being used by the government to fight against the drought . But of course , it will not work overnight . So , have you come out with a new plan for today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My new plan is to wait for the end of the sand storm and clean my apartment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey John , nice skates . Are they new ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I just got them . I started playing ice hockey in a community league . So , I finally got myself new skates .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What position do you play ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m a defender . It ' s a lot of fun . You don ' t have to be able to skate as fast on defense .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , you ' re a pretty big guy . I play goalie , myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , yeah ? Which team ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The Rockets .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I think we play you guys next week . Well , I have to go to practice . See you later .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right , see you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you think the weather will be good this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I heard it might rain .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh . That ' s a pity . I thought that we might go hiking in the hills .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Mmm ... Well we could go to that new art gallery instead .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes that might be a better idea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe we ' ll meet some of the artists too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok - let ' s do that then !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'd like a half-day package .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We offer many different sea water treatments .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How many can we choose ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The aquamedic pool is included . You can choose three .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'll do the seaweed wrap , the jet bath , and the foot massage .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Here are your robes . You can go shower first .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tomorrow is Halloween , I know I'm ready . I bought two pumpkins and a big bags of candy . Do you want to help me a jack-o-lantern ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd love to . I heard about Halloween when I was in Beijing . It's kind of a children's day . Small kids get dressed up , then walk around with paper bags or baskets , knocking on the neighbor's

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They are supposed to say trick or treat ? Then the neighbors are supposed to hand up the candy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's kind of cool . But what's the trick mean ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Usually it's the older kids going around playing Halloween , like punching the pumpkins left outside people's doors or - - someone's tree . They usually do it late at night after little kids go

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds kind of fun , maybe I can get tighter with my friends that night .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Usually be adults , you don't have kids have a big party in get dressed up too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That does sound a lot of fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I usually bowl with an eight ball . I like the control of a light ball . I can spin it more , so that the ball hooks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well . I like them a little heavier . I don't have as much control , usually bowling straight , but the extra momentum compensates for that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , let's see which technique is better . I think I'll go up first ... Yes ! I hit a strike . I knocked them all down on my first bowl .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well done . You got them all . You get 10 points and your next two bowls are added to this frame's score . I'II dry my ball off and try to knock them all down as well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good start . You knocked eight pins down . But you are left with a 7,10 split . Unless you can bowl a UFO-ball on this bowl , it is going to be impossible .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I certainly can try ... No ! It went straight through the wickets .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , May . How about getting together for a movie tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . What's playing ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , Let me check the newspaper . What about The Terminal ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , it stars Catherine Zeta-Jones , my favorite actress .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , birds of a feather flock together . I like her too . She was in a lot of dramas .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is so beautiful and elegant . And she is famous for her fine acting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's more , she doesn't have scandals . And she likes to take part in the charitable activities .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Who is the director ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Steven Spielberg . Another superstar .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , a legend , also . I still remember , his movies , Jurassic Park and Schindler's List got him nine Oscar awards in 1994 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you introduce the story of The Terminal briefly ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It tells a romantic and humorous love story .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is really exciting movie . Lets go to this one .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , it hasn't . It's very dirty .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Someone ought to clean it today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mark should clean it . It's his turn .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , he cleaned it last time . It's your turn .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , it isn't . You always clean it after Mark .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh dear , is it really my turn ? In that case , I'll clean tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Clean it now . Only lazy people say they'll work tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I'll clean it the day after tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are lazy . You ought to be ashamed ? You should enjoy working .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good afternoon , madam . May I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have some new perfume ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am sorry , madam . I didn't hear you . It's too noisy here . Could you please say it again ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I wanna buy some new perfume .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you please wait a minute ? I will get one for you at once .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's all right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here you are .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can I open it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , certainly , madam .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It smells sweet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is . This perfume just arrived yesterday , and it's the latest products of Chanel .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How much is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: 55 dollars , madam .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , I will take two bottles .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Do you need something else ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . Sometimes talking with a friend is a great way to get over something . Do you mind if I vent a little bit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course not . If you're feeling bad and want to let your emotions out , you can just say whatever you want to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great , because I am really mad at William . I mean , what kind of an idiot wouldn't be able to appreciate a smart , beautiful woman like me ? Anybody who would be friends with that guy has to be really dumb .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Uh , A ... you know I'm friends with William .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh right ... present company excluded , of course !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't cover up your sadness . Let it go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It isn't your fault . No one will blame you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are so thoughtful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's a new play tonight .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's its name ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ' Romeo and Juliet ' .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's about their great love .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds interesting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course . Do you want to see it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , do you have tickets ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I don't .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's go to the theater and buy two tickets now , shall we ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea . Let's goa

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Let's go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can ' t believe my English teacher is making me read pride and prejudice !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ! It ' s a classic ; in fact , it ' s one of my favorite novels .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But it ' s so old .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t judge a book by its cover . Do you Kwon what it ' s about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , not at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: First of all , it ' s a romance novel , set in the early 19th century .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn ' t realize it was a romance novel . What ' s the main storyline ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s basically about a father who tried to marry off one of his five girls .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why does he want to do that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Since he doesn ' t have a son , he hopes that one of the girls will marry a wealthy man . That way , all of his daughters will be cared for .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Won ' t they get his inheritance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , that ' s the problem . Though they are well-off , once he dies , his house will go to his cousin . So , when he dies , the girls will have nothing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . This sounds interesting ! Maybe my teacher isn ' t so horrible after all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So , are you going to read the novel or watch the movie ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There ' s movie ? My teacher didn ' t tell me that !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s probably because she wants you to read the book first .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It would take a lot less time ..

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about this . When you finish the book . I ' ll get the movie and watch it with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . That sounds like a deal .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ' s wrong with you ? Why are you scratching so much ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I feel itchy ! I can ' t stand it anymore ! I think I may be coming down with something . I feel lightheaded and weak .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me have a look . Whoa ! Get away from me !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ' s wrong ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think you have chicken pox ! You are contagious ! Get away ! Don ' t breathe on me !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe it ' s just a rash or an allergy ! We can ' t be sure until I see a doctor .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well in the meantime you are a biohazard ! I didn ' t get it when I was a kid and I ' Ve heard that you can even die if you get it as an adult !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you serious ? You always blow things out of proportion . In any case , I think I ' ll go take an oatmeal bath .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's time to leave the office for the night . Firstly I log off my computer , then I set the electronic security system .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's pretty advanced .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now I'll quickly send a short message to my wife and take the elevator down to the basement .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is that where you park ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , the car park is under constant video surveillance , so my car is quite safe . Please get in .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Where is your key ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's no need , I have keyless entry , and the steering wheel recognizes my finger prints before starting the car . Now , we can look at the navigation system to find the best route home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's amazing , it even shows all the roads that are congested at the moment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Using GPS I can rely on this to direct me home . Now I just need to find my E-Card to automatically open the gate and we can drive out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Pretty soon cars will be driving themselves .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe , but in the meantime why not help me find the remote control for my garage door ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here it is , and here we are .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When I turn off my home alarm , the house will automatically tum on the lights and set the climate to a comfortable level .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have to get home , but I don't need all of this fancy technology , I think I'll just walk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How is your new car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect . Couldn't be better .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why do you say so ? Can I see your new car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course you can . ( Lead Carl to his garage . )

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , this new car is dynamite ! It is a shiny , beautiful car .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My car is simply a daisy . It drives smoothly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The car has very sleek lines . I love it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am glad to hear that . I'm really pleased with it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You made a good choice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you help me pick out a gift for my niece ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Most normal little girls go wild over Barbie dolls .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds good . Let me see one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here's the latest model -- Digital Barbie .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , she's nice . How much is she ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why , she's only $ 29 . 95 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , that's reasonable . I'll take it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excellent . Would you like anything else ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The total will be $ 32 . 42 . Will that be cash ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , cash will be fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here's your change . Thank you for shopping with us .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your knowledge of English is really surprising .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's nothing to speak of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , seriously . I am impressed .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I appreciate the compliment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your knowledge of English is really surprising .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's nothing to speak of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , seriously . I am impressed .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I appreciate the compliment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy Birthday , Mary !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here is a gift for you . I hope you like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What a lovely dog ! How did you know I love things like this ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I had my own ways of finding out . It ' s a secret . You look so beautiful today . Your new shirt goes well with your skirt .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe you won't believe this , but it was made by my grandmother .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? It looks so nice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Please have a cup of tea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about some fish ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , thanks . I've had enough . Now , Mary , before you blow out the birthday candles , you have to make a wish . After that , you may cut the cake .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Let me make a wish ... Do you want a big piece of cake ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , just a small one . Next Let's sing " Happy Birthday " to Mary .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is so very kind of you . I'm so moved by you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , Mary , come in , please . I'm so happy to see you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Happy birthday , George . Many happy returns of the day . Here's a present for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , thank you , Mary . You're so nice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope you like it . Oh , have the other guys arrived ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They're all waiting for you . Let's join them . I'm going to cut the cake soon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please come in !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi . Steven . I just drop in and want to have a chat with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , so nice of you to come here . Have a seat . Please make yourself at home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . ( Sit on the sofa ) Wow ! Your house was decorated so beautiful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . My wife would be very happy to hear this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She must have done a lot of work on it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You bet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you want to go shopping with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a good idea . What time is good for you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about Saturday morning ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a fine day today , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it is . It ' s wonderful after the downpour .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How nice seeing the sun back again ! The air is so fresh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope it stays nice like this for a long period of time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , the weather is so unpredictable this time of year .

utterances.speaker: B
