utterances.text: You're right . We don't know what is going to be like tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look ! It looks as if it is going to rain .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The weatherman predicts a fine day today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The weather is often quite different from the weather forecast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you set your clock forward for daylight savings time ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Why do we have to do that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , at the start of the spring we usually have more daylight in the mornings and less in the afternoon . This is basically due to our position on the planet and the rotation of the earth . In any case , to take better advantage of the daylight available , we compensate by moving our clocks forward one hour .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I see . That ' s convenient ! I never understood things like this , such as GMT . I never know what time zone we are in or when to change my clock !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That just stands for Greenwich Mean Time . Here in California , we are in Pacific Standard Time , that is eight time zones west of Greenwich . Remember when we were in Beijing ? Well , then we were in China Standard Time , and that ' s eight time zones east of Greenwich !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s why it was so weird traveling from Beijing to LA ! Because of the huge time difference , even though we left Beijing at noon and flew for more than eight hours , we still arrived in LA the same day at noon ! It ' s like we went back in time !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't stand being with you any more . I'm sick of your drinking .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I swear I never drink again . Just give me another chance , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How many chances have I given you , I've given up on you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know how hard I try to quit , I've lost without you . I am mot let you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not just for your drinking . But you are lacking sense of responsibility .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have to make money to support the family , so I have little time left to share with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Even if I was seriously ill you couldn't spare a moment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I told you I happened to be more important meeting at that time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I just don't trust you any more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: hey , Maris , are you a part-timer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: part-timer ? Is that a new buzzword ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , it ' s pretty popular among my classmates these days . So are you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: sure , I have a part-time job as a bartender .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: cool ! It must be amazing to work at a bar !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yeah , but I ' m not there for fun . I have to remain professional and if I get distracted , the manager would be pretty upset .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that ' s true . I ' m wondering did you learn anything from the job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: of course . There ' s always much to learn . I got to know more about the real world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: you mean you got working experience , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: not just working experience . I would say the biggest lesson I learned is how to deal with people from all walks of life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it must be very demanding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: sometimes it is . But after working for a few weeks , it ' s easy to figure out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: really ? It sounds interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: maybe you can come to the bar one day and I ' ll show you around .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: great . I ' m looking forward to it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The summers are so great here ! Not hot at all . I love the cooling breezes , the clear air , all the greenery .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This really has been a wonderful holiday for us . Shall we take a walk around the pond or into those woods for a while ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's do both ! Are we in a rush or anything

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , not really . I had thought we'd stay in Hamburg tonight , but we can't unless we rush it . Let's stay in Bremen instead . Tomorrow we can have lunch in Hamburg , then check into a hostel in Copenhagen and have dinner there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds fine to me . Whatever , let's enjoy this pond first .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . We can walk around to that path that leads into the woods there . Hey , look ! There are some wild ducks over there in the reeds .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see them ! Wow ! How do you know they're wild ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I used to go hunting with my uncle , that's how .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They're neat . Now Let's take that path into the woods and see what we can see ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's almost Christmas . What are you doing this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nothing special , just working . Why do you ask ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I still haven't finished my Christmas shopping . Do you want to go shopping with me this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to , but I'm not sure if I can . Work has been really busy lately . Why don't we go on Friday instead ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Friday's not good . I think the stores will be very crowded and I have to work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , then let's try to go this weekend . I should know if I can go by Friday . Is it OK if I call you then ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , that's fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's your number ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: 233-331-8828 . Let me give you my email address too . It's Tom861@gmail . com

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , I'll talk to you soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Jane . How are you doing these days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi Martha . Everything is perfect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you enjoying married life ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It couldn't be better . My husband is so supportive with my work and he helps around the house so much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're so lucky . I hope to get married to a guy like that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm so happy . Even though we are both working , we get to spend a lot of time with each other in the evening and on the weekends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you guys do anything special ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: In the evening , we just sit and talk over dinner . But on the weekend , we try to go out to the beach or hit a nice restaurant , or go to a nice cafe .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sound like everything is great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you so much for coming tonight . Everybody really enjoyed your performance .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad I could help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here's the check . I included a little extra for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You didn't have to do that !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know , but you deserve it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good evening . Welcome to our program .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Good evening , Mr . Dean .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you tell us your name , please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm Helen Baker .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Glad to meet you , Ms . Baker .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Glad to meet you , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where are you from , Ms . Baker ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm from New Zealand .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you do for a living ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm a teacher .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for coming , Ms . baker .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Paul , what kind of music do you like to listen to ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All kinds , but mostly Pop , rock and classical . Why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have tickets to a show . Do you want to go with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What kind of music is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Pop . It's Maria Carey .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: At 8P M tomorrow night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I'd like to go . Do you think we should have dinner first ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that's a good idea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's eat at the restaurant across the street from my apartment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I think I know the place you mean . We ate there last month , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , that's right . You have a good memory .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I passed history test .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? That ' s marvelous !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And then you ' re old man won ' t be beaten this time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' Ve made up my mind not to be beaten again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'd like to invite you over for dinner this Friday evening . Can you come ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This Friday evening ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . We hope you'll be able to join us .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for the invitation . I'll be very happy to go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What time should I arrive ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about 6:00 ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine . See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is a nice set of wheels . How much did the dealer charge you for this ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A lot . I probably got to moonlight for the rest of my life , but so what , it ' s worth it . Come on , get in . Let ' s take a drive .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay then , let ' s go fast ! Whoa ! This thing can really accelerate fast .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Check out what happens when I put on the brakes suddenly . It can stop quickly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , just watch out for cops or you ' re gonna end up in the slammer . You know you tend to go fast ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I know it . I went through my last set of tires fast . I even had three flat tires in two weeks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now watch ... some guys probably run a light and hit your car .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cut out , would you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' d like to take this opportunity to thank you for everything you did for me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s my pleasure . I enjoyed working with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wouldn ' t be able to make it without your help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then keep up the good work .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I want to say goodbye to everyone .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re leaving so soon . When are you off ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m catching the nine fifteen train tomorrow morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: how about I come and see you off ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You really don ' t need to .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . I ' ll miss you . I hope we can see each other again soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope so , too . Thank you , Lily . Thank you for everything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re welcome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please say goodbye to the rest of the family for me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . Take care . I hope you have a good journey .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Remember to look me up if you ' re ever in Washington .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course . I will .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Goodbye , then . Thanks again for everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Jenny . You look like you are in a hurry to somewhere . Where are you going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am going to the bank . I need to cash some checks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great . We can go to the bank together .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why are you going there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will go to Japan on business for 5 days next Tuesday . I want to exchange some Japanese yen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I see . Will you bring a lot of money with you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not really . I plan to bring some cash and withdraw money at the ATM in Japan .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have the bank card in Japan ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nope . You can use the credit card to withdraw the money in foreign countries .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds really convenient . Do you pay extra money to enjoy this service ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No . It is free of charge .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! I will apply for a credit card when I go to the bank later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think we are running out of time . The bank is going to close soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , why didn ' t you clean the room ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m not in the mood .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why are you feeling depressed ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was told my girlfriend was speaking ill of me . That ' s a real let-down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don ' t think she will do such a thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she did and made me disappointed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , cheer up . A girlfriend is not everything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she means a lot to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then forgive her mistake .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh . I just can ' t forget it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are going to be really jealous when you find out where I ' m headed for the holidays !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t tell me ! I ' m sure it ' s someplace warm and sunny with great beaches !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You got it ! I ' m going to spend two fabulous weeks in Hawaii !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are so lucky ! Send me a postcard !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy New Year !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you ! The same to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you got any plans ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've been invited over to a friend's . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My roommate's having a party .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your new car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect . Couldn't be better !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You made a good choice , then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's just what I wanted .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No regrets ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm really pleased with it . Thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad you're so happy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's super .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can you do push-ups ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course I can . It's a piece of cake ! Believe it or not , I can do 30 push-ups a minute .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I think that's impossible !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You mean 30 push-ups ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's easy . If you do exercise everyday , you can make it , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , John . How are you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm fine , thanks . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very well , thanks . Nice to see you again . I haven't seen you for a long time . What have you been doing lately ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , nothing much really . And how is everything with you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine , thanks . I've been busy lately .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What have you been doing ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've been studying for my exams . My school exams will begin next month .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Good luck for them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . And how are your parents ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They're both very well , thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where are you going now ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm going to do some shopping . Why don't you come with me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't . I have to meet someone .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's been nice talking to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good-bye . See you again sometime .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , this is 5735647 5 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello , this is John . I wanna speak to Linda , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is Linda .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Linda . I want to invite you to a dinner tomorrow evening .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? What time and which restaurant ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: At seven thirty pm , Longing Chinese restaurant . And I'll go to your home and pick you up at 7 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , I'll wait for you at 7pm at home . Anything else ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , have a nice day !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Bye .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: See you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , my name is Lean , and I'm from Russia .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice to meet you , Lean . My name is Alike . I'm from Japan .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To me English is a difficult language .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A second language is always difficult .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: True , but English is harder than most . It's a crazy language .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A crazy language ? Why do you say that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: One letter can have several pronunciations and one word can have several meanings .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No wonder you say English is a crazy language .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on in . I am so glad you are here . We have been expecting you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Am I late for the party ? Looks everyone is already here . Hope I didn ' t miss something interesting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , you are just on time . We haven ' t really started yet .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great , here are some flowers for you . I hope you like them . I was not sure if the color will suit your new apartment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you , they ' re beautiful . You can hang your coat over there . Try this new couch , it is so comfortable . You will love it . Want something to drink , tea , coffee , juice or Cola ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t bother . I will help myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Make yourself at home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is such a nice place .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I don ' t mean to boast but all the designs are done by myself and some colleagues are already trying to copy some of them for their new apartments . Look , they are making photos now of my designed kitchen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , why don't you clean your room ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am not in the mood .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why are you feeling depress ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was told my girlfriend was speaking ill of me . It's a real letdown .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think she would do such a thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she did and it made me disappointed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , cheer up ! A girlfriend is not everything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she means a lot to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then forgive her mistake .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I just can't forget it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do I need a visa ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I shouldn ' t think so . But you must take your passport of course .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I know . I must get my traveler ' s check and some foreign currency .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , you need the traveler ' s check but you needn ' t get any foreign currency . You can have my US Dollars , I don ' t need them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? That ' s very good of you , Helen . But I must get a new suitcase , my old one needs repairing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You needn ' t buy one . You can have mine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s very kind of you , Helen . I hope you don ' t mind my leaving you like this . I need a holiday . It won ' t be long .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t be silly , John . I ' m going with you . It ' s necessary for me to have a holiday too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Linda ? Is that you ? I haven't seen you in ages !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi George ! It's good to see you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What have you been up to ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just opened up my own business not long ago .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good for you ! What are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm a professional party planner here in the city . I do catering and all that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I knew some day I would be able to profit from your love of fun !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I don't know about the profit part yet . But I am really having fun !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Trina , will you marry me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes ! Yes ! And yes ! Jared , of course I ' ll marry you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , Babe , I can ' t wait to spend the rest of my life with you ! I can ' t wait for all the adventures we ' re going to have , for all the fights and the laughter . I can ' t wait to grow old and wrinkly with you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Jared ! I can ' t wait for our wedding ! I hope you don ' t mind , but I ' Ve already chosen a date ! Six months from now in the summer ! Melissa saw you buying the ring last month so I ' Ve had plenty of time to start planning !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She what ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh don ' t worry , sweetie , I didn ' t know when you were going to propose . It was still a nice surprise ! As I was saying , I ' Ve got it all planned out . There ' s almost nothing left to do ! I wrote up our guest list and we will have roughly four hundred guests attending .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Four hundred ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No need to sweat it . My parents agreed to pay for most of the wedding , which is going to be low-budget anyway . So roughly four hundred people , which means that the hall at Northwoods Heights will be our reception venue . I thought it would be nice if we had the wedding at your parents ' church and my uncle of course would be officiating . We ' ll meet with him soon for some pre-wedding counseling . The music for the wedding ceremony was a no-brainer . My step-sister and her string quartet will take care of that . My cousin will be the official photographer . I thought it would also be nice if his daughter could sing a solo . Did you know that she ' s going to be a professional opera singer ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And then of course the ladies at the church would love to be our caterers for the banquet and we ' ll get the Youth Group to serve us . I was thinking that your friend ' s band could be our entertainment for the night . though they might have to tone it down a bit . Or we could hire a DJ . Your sister ' s husband could get us a discount with that company that does the decor at weddings . what ' s their name again ? I was thinking that we could have an island paradise-themed wedding and our theme color would be a soothing blue like Aquamarine . And there will be a huge seashell on the wall behind the podium where we ' ll make our toasts ! What do you think of small packages of drink mixes for our wedding favors ? Who else am I missing ? Oh , your uncle could be our florist and his wife could make our wedding cake !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: See ? It ' s going to be wonderful ! Oh this wedding is going to be everything I ever dreamed of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If I survive the next six months .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Belinda , I ' m going to a party tonight . What shall I wear ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it formal or informal ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess it ' s formal .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then , you should dress well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think a white shirt with a blue tie looks nice on you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are smart .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , the sports shoes don ' t go with the formal occasions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are right . What kind of shoes should I wear ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The brown leather shoes go well with your trousers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea . Oh , by the way , would you please pick me up after the party , honey ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' ll be too late ; you ' d better take a taxi .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like Tom ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like him very much . He ' s a gay dog .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you ready to welcome him ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am all set . He can come anytime .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good evening , Mr . Wu .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good evening , Mr . Smith .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you met my wife , Mary ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . I haven ' t had the pleasure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mary , this is Mr . Wu , my new Chinese friend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do you do , Mr . Wu ? Welcome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have a glass of wine , Mr . Wu ? And let me introduce you to some of my guests .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you bought War Craft 2 yet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah ! I bought it the day it was released .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a great game . There are a lot of new characters .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did it cost very much

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It cost about thirty . Most games cost about that much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mechwarrior is such a good game . The graphics are awesome !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I know what you mean . I'm addicted to that game .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My roommate always wants to play it . But I told her to buy her own game .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , my roommate likes to watch me play . He says it's like watching a movie .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've never seen such good graphics .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And I've never heard such good sound in a game .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you followed the value of dollar lately ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How could I help but follow it ? The fluctuation of dollar is killing my company ! The exchange rates are eating into our profits , and we can't do anything about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's really frustrating , isn't it ? I have the same problem . I would feel a lot better if the currency was a little more stable . With the way the dollar plummeting lately , my securities have gone up in smoke .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Every day I have less money ! I haven't spent anything , it is just melting away because of the shifts in exchange rate .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What we really should be making investment in is the Euro . I've followed the Euro's progress over the last quarter , I think it's about time to buy in .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What about the Yen ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? The Yen is in worse shape than the Dollar !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Next is a ballet performance , but who is the dancer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd swear that's Eddy from circulation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Since when did Eddy start doing ballet ? !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not very long from the looks of it !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look ! He has a partner !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's dancing with Jack !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Gross !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The wei-ya is the one time a year you can make fun of the boss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I think Eddy is going too far !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're right . They are spinning pretty fast . Aren't they getting dizzy ? What if they fall ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh ! Ouch ! That must've hurt !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How embarrassing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We're lucky today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , there aren't any clouds in the sky and we've got such a beautiful view here . Look ! This is St James Park . And there's Buckingham Palace

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where's Hyde Park ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's on the other side of the Palace .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's the place where people make speeches on Sundays , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , you're right . Politicians of all kinds , religious people , and one or two madmen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , are we going there today ? I want to take shots there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . I can see you're enjoying your trip today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course . Everything's so striking and fascinating .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tom ! How are you ? We missed you at the party last night . Are you OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t know . I didn ' t really feel like going out . I guess I ' m feeling a little homesick .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on . We ' Ve been through this already ! Look , I know the adjustment was hard when you first got here , but we agreed that you were gonna try and deal with it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was . It ' s just that the holidays are coming up and I won ' t be able to home because I can ' t afford the airfare . I ' m just longing for some of the comforts of home , like my mom ' s cooking and being around my family .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , it can get pretty lonely over the holidays . When I first got here , I ' d get depressed and nostalgic for anything that reminded me of home . I almost let it get to me , but then I started going out , keeping myself busy and before I knew it , I was used to to it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I see what you mean , but I ' m still bummed out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . how does this sound . let ' s get you suited up and hit the dance club tonight . I hear that an awesome DJ is playing and there will be a lot of pretty single girls there !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know , I could really go for that . You don ' t mind being my wingman for tonight ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not at all ! It be fun ! It will be like a boys ' night out ... well kinda ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! I must warn you though , whatever happens , don ' t let me go on a drinking binge . Trust me , it ' s not a pretty picture !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I found out when Jim's birthday is . It's this Friday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's plan a surprise party for him !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you spread the word and ask everyone to bring some kind of snack food ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's easy . Anything else ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you call his wife and let her know so that if she is available , she can come too ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Won't he be surprised !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know how old he is though .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's O . K . Maybe his wife will spill the beans !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Mary . Nice day , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , what a wonderful day ! The sky has cleared up in the end .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I do feel like an outdoor exercise . After all , we haven't had such a beautiful day for a long time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about taking a walk in the park ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . It's delightful to have a walk in the park with the air so fresh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( After they entering the park ) Great , it's so quiet here . We have the park to ourselves , only you and me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? Don't you see many people over there ? Just on your right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I see them . Beautiful weather should be shared by all the people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah , you changed so fast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Mary , long time no see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I heard through the grapevine that your getting married .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , next March .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Congratulations , I hope everything works out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Jack . What's going on ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey Matt . I'm going to ask Martha to marry me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? When did you decide this ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I always knew she was the one , but I decided to pop the big question about 2 weeks ago . I'm just debating on how to do it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's exciting , man .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So how did you propose ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You shouldn't use my example . It wasn't special . I kind of wish I made it more special but it's too late now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you think I should do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are a lot of options . You can surprise her over dinner , or ask her in a public area , or if you have the balls , ask her father in front of her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I never thought about that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thought about what ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Asking her father in front of her . How do you think she will react ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . You should know how she's going to react . She is your girlfriend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think that's the idea I was looking for . Thanks , man .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't mention it . Good luck . You're going to need it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's go see pandas ! The news said that two pandas arrived at the zoo last week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! I would like to see cute pandas , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How can we get there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We can take the MET and get off at the Zoo Station .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK ! Let's go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( At the zoo ) Wow ! This zoo is really huge .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , you can find hundreds of various animals here . It is the biggest zoo in Taiwan .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look at the map . It has different areas , such as marine lives , mammals , polar animals and insects .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where can find the pandas ? I think we are here to see the pandas .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We have to go to the mammal area . We are at the gate right now . We need to go straight from here and turn left and go along to the end and make anotherleft turn .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It should take at least 20 minutes to get there . Are there any shuttle buses running place to place around the whole zoo ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really like the record you lent me the other day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And thank you very much for letting me keep it so long .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm most grateful . Everyone in our class enjoyed it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you mind my keeping it for another week ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi Amanda , how are you ? I've missed working with you and the whole gang since my transfer last week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We've missed you too . The office just isn't the same without you . How is your new job ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's great . I really get to focus on what I like to do and everyone has been very nice and welcoming . However , I'm having a small problem with my new colleagues .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , three people are celebrating their birthdays this month and the policy here is for everyone to contribute ten dollars to a card and cake for each person .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , so you'll be out thirty dollars on your first week at work !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know . It is a lot of money and I haven't gotten to know any of the people celebrating their birthdays well enough yet . At our old department , it was only three dollars for each birthday and there were only ten of us .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , every department is different . You wouldn't want your new co-workers to think you're a Grinch , right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A Grinch is a person who spoils the mood at a happy occasion by being selfish or unenthusiastic . You know - a party proper .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I definitely don't want to be that ! But , I still think it's unreasonable for them to ask me for such a big sum of money when we don't know each other very well . What should I do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Martha . What's wrong ? Why are you crying ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Jake just broke up with me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry . When did this happen ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yesterday . I didn't even know it was coming . He just told me he found someone else .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a jerk . He doesn't deserve you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But it still hurts . I thought I loved him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He didn't treat you that well either . Maybe you don't want to hear this , but I think you can do better .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Better or worse , it doesn't matter . I had a lot of feelings for him . I really liked him

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It must be really painful . I remember when Josh and I broke up . I was crying for a week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . I'll get over him . My first break up was painful because I was naive .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly . You'll find someone again . You should get your mind off of this . Let's go shopping .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe tomorrow . I don't feel like it tonight .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about coffee down the street ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Welcome to our university ' s fifties anniversary , Sir . Please have a seat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Wow , your school has so many honors . Congratulations !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excuse me . I wonder see Dean Mr . Lee first . I was wondering if could you tell me where his office is ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Certainly . Mr . Lee ' s office building at the south end of the campus , just beside the library .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excuse me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me show you the way . Please follow me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you very much . It ' s very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My pleasure .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s up on the second floor . You have to use the stairs . The elevator isn ' t working .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: the dinner was really good . It knocked my socks off .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that's very kind of you to say so . Let's try some after-dinner wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: great . Sweet wines are my favorite . They always make a great finish to a decisions meal .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: do you prefer brandy or ports .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: port , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: excellent choice . I love its smooth flavor .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: the port is exquisite . It must have spent years aging in barrels . Am I right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes . You always have a good nose for wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: next time we are about to dinner we should try some Canadian ice wine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: oh , what's that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it's made from naturally frozen grapes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: why not ? It sounds great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , here's to your health .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: thanks . Cheers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: cheers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How time flies !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: May and Danny have already grown up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can still remember our first date .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look at that big tree over there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , oh my god ! It's still there . We have our first date right on there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you know that I fell in love with you at the first sight .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You were dull at that time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you agreed to go out with me at last .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't believe this for it's been 20 years since we got married .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is that the box-office ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to book two tickets for the film ' Jane Eyre ' for this evening , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just a minute please . Oh , I'm sorry , all the tickets for tonight have been sold out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What a pity ! How about tomorrow evening ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you're lucky , there are just two tickets left . Do you want to take them ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wonderful , I'll take them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , your name and telephone number please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wang Min . Telephone number is 13811658 . Can I pick the tickets this afternoon ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , of course .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Anna speaking !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , Anna , this is Jason .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jason , where have you been hiding lately ? You know it's been a long time since your last call . Have you been good ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . How are you , Anna ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am fine . What have you been doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Working . I've been really busy these days . I got a promotion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great , congratulations !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . I am feeling pretty good about myself too . You know , bigger office , a raise and even an assistant .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's good . So I guess I'll have to make an appointment to see you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are kidding .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How long have you been working there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A bit over two years . This is a fast-moving company , and seniority isn ' t the only factor in deciding promotions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like your new boss ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is very nice and open-minded .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Much better than the last one , huh ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . He was a real slave driver . He probably would have loved it if we were robots .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Forget about him . Come over to my house tonight . Let's get drunk .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . Tonight 8 o'clock .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: 8 it is . See you then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi Amy , you look very happy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I'm very pleased . I've just got two tickets to see the Olympic opening ceremony .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow . You must be very excited .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I certainly am . I would have been very disappointed if I hadn ' t got them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Shall we go to a restaurant to celebrate ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What a good idea . I'm quite hungry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too . I feel very thirsty as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let ' s go then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello ! I'm Penny , I moved here just now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Penny , I'm Leonard , glad to meet you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice to meet you , too . I thought I should come and say hello to you . I haven't known anybody .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is hard to get used to a new place , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . Would you like to come here later to have a coffee ? Bring all your family .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We'd like to . Can you tell me when we go ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: About 4 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Do you want us to bring something ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , just come here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , see you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mary , be calm .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is impossible . You cheated on me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , listen to me . I always regard you as my best friend . I admire you , and of course you've helped me so much . I should thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Shut up !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , listen to me . Perhaps it's my fault that I treat everybody so well . Maybe in other people's eyes , I want you to be my girl-friend . but ... but ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you have had lily already ? You should have told me about her , but you didn't .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK ... OK ... Anyway . I will treat you as my best friend . I hope you can do the same .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Leave me ! Go away !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Dad , I'm scared .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Take it easy , honey . It's just raining cats and dogs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But , dad , it's stormy outside .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Honey , it's just windy and raining outside .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ar ! Dad , the power went out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How'd you like to go on a bungee jump this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not sure . I promised to help my sister move Saturday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about Sunday , then ? We could start in the morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I might be able to do that . But I don't think I can do it well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't worry . It is a test of physical endurance , intelligence . Just to finish it is considered a victory for most .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . I'll talk to you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you take part in our picnic this Saturday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That would be fine . Where are you going ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We plan to go to a forest in the suburb . There is a beautiful river there . We can do some fishing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And don't forget your fishing tackle .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . I like fishing very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you think of the film ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I liked it . I thought it was great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I liked it , too . Did you like the acting ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . I thought it was excellent . Didn't you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not really . I thought it was disappointing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a nice cinema , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you think so ? I don't like it very much . I found it rather uncomfortable .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ashley , what a great dinner party !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Joe . What would you like to drink with your meal ? I can offer you wine , mango juice , or water .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just water would be fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excellent choice . Can I dish you up some chicken ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , the chicken looks wonderful !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about some salad to go with your chicken ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure , I love salad !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Would you like to have rice with your chicken ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I think that rice will go perfectly with my chicken !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good ! Julie , if you could pass this plate down to Joe , I think we are all set .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then I must go-you have said it yourself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , you must stay ! I swear it , and the oath shall be kept .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I tell you I must go !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have spoken my mind , and can go anywhere now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ask you to pass through life at my side-to be my second self and best earthly companion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll never again come to your side ; I am turn away now and can't return .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Jason , there is going to be a screening of Final Destination 3 at our campus cinema tomorrow . I plan to go to see it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it a horror movie ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I love horror movies . Would you like to go with me tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No way . I will be scared out of my wits .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's funny , I didn't know a big fellow like you could be so soft and timid on the inside .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , how would you like to taste my fist ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright , all joking aside , what kinds of moves do you like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um , let me see , romance , comedy . documentary , action , science fiction , animated and so on .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That is to say , you like all genres except for horror movies .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . It seems like we don't speak the same language as far as movies are concerned .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not quite . I also greatly enjoy romance and comedy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The Notebook is this type of movie .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I haven't heard of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well then , this could be a nice opportunity to enjoy it together . I bet you'd love it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . I can't wait to see it . Let's go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , it was nice meeting you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I hope we meet again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure , I'll give you a call .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey ! That food was terrific . I can't eat another bite . Are you sure you don't want another dish ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I'm full . My stomach isn't growling at me any more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know what you mean . I'm so full that I can burst . Shall we go then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm all set . Thank you for the dinner , Jack .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are welcome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , could you arrange a dinner for us ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , what time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Eight o'clock tomorrow evening .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For how many people ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ten .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Western food or Chinese food ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Chinese food .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you want an expensive meal ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , not too lavish .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How much would you like to spend for each person ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is the usual thing here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Forty to eighty RIB Yuan a plate .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's say sixty Yuan then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Is there anything special you'd like to have on the menu ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'd like to have typical Chinese food .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Anything you'd rather not have ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No snakes , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about drinks ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mao Tai and Qingdao Beer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well . Dinner for ten at sixty Yuan a plate , drink's extra , at 8 o'clock tomorrow evening . Is that all right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Right , thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My pleasure , see you tomorrow evening .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to stretch your legs ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's get a soft drink .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do we have enough time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a fifteen-minute intermission .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The seats are excellent . We're right in the center .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a new concert hall and the acoustics are great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't agree more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is this your first time to come to a symphony concert ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: In the United States , yes . But back in China , I went to concerts a couple of times with my parents .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have large concert halls in your city ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We have two . One is like this one . The other is a little smaller .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great . Well , we'd better get back to our seats . It's about to start .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you see Ally Mabel last night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I did . Did you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , wasn't it funny ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh yes , I loved it . Wasn't the scene with the judge great ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ha , yes , brilliant !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I am a regular member of this club .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have to pay to join ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , membership fees vary depending on the club but usually they run into tens of thousands of dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , that much ? Don't they have any public courses ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very few , unfortunately .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How was your game today ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Extremely good . I shot a 78 , including 5 birdies !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Congratulations ! What's your normal handicap ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ten . How did your game go ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My drives were terrible today . I kept slicing the ball into the roughs and sand traps .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe you can correct it by going to a driving range before you play again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about going to hear a country-and-western singer tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd enjoy that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll pick you up around 8: 00 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . I'll see you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny , are you having fun here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course . This is really a nice party with wonderful people and lovely wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m glad you ' re enjoying it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for the invitation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s my pleasure . Would you like another glass of champagne ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , please . Thank you for everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , what's up ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , nothing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What were you writing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( Laugh ) All right . You caught me in the act . I finally worked up the nerve to ask Diana out . I was just writing a note to put on her desk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You mean you're going to ask her out in a note ? You big chicken !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I admit it . I'm a wuss . I just can't do it in person .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But , you work with her everyday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's different . When I'm working , I'm in a different frame of mind . But , when I even think about asking her out , I get tongue-tied . At least in a note , I can get the words out without turning beet red .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You've dated a lot . What's so different about Diana ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , for one thing , she's gorgeous . She's so upbeat and sweet . Who doesn't like her ? Oh , I don't know . All I do know is that I think we have great chemistry together . But , what if I'm wrong . Maybe she's just been nice to me out of courtesy and doesn't think of me that way . Oh ... forget it . This was a bad idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I guess you don't want this note , then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What note ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was looking for you to deliver this note from Diana . She wants to know if you want to go to the office party with her tomorrow night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're kidding ! I can't believe you've been standing this entire time and didn't say anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry . What can I say ? Now , do you want the note or what ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I want the note .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have a great time tomorrow night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . I plan on it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , the food here really is bad . My soup was cold and meat , ur ... it was like leather .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . And they don ' t give you very much either . I ' m still hungry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sure this one is especially bad . And the word is so unpleasant .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t do this ! Don ' t do that ! You mustn ' t do this ! You can ' t do that !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I ' m going to write a letter of complaint .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And we ' ll all help you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like this waltz ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's very nice . I like it very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , then , may I invite you for the first dance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My pleasure . But I'm afraid I'm not much of a dancer , and I suppose you dance often .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me ? Oh , no . In fact , I only took up dancing quite recently .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ? But you're doing the waltz wonderfully well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad you say so . You dance beautifully too . It's lucky that I got you as a partner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for your compliments . It's just you are a good leader . Do you like the foxtrot and tango ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . And what dances do you like best ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Disco is my favorite . I like it better than any other dances because it can release one's hidden feelings , and is a healthy exercise . But I don't do the rock and roll nor break-dancing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , well , the music has stopped . Thank you for the dance .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My pleasure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning , Mei ! How are you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi Tom ! I'm fine , and you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not bad thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . See you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bye !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re going to set up your own law office , aren ' t you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . After so many years of hard work , I ' d rather I had an office of my own .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If you need help , don ' t hesitate to ask me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' ll be very glad if you would help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' d like to wish you every success in your new venture .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I wish I would .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good luck to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That was heaven !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The sea water treatments are supposed to be really good for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But the water has to be kept at 34 degrees so that the minerals can be absorbed by your body .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , whatever it does , I feel transformed !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's weekend again , I'm glad I can arrange for my personal matters .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you mean by that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that means I can do whatever I like without few interruptions .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You've been always active and versatile . It seems that you are interested in everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , really ? I just have lots of hobbies in my spare time ; such as going to the concert , painting , handwriting , reading novels and reading fashion magazines . What about yours ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have fewer hobbies than yours . That's why I find campus life a bit dull and uninteresting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you can't think like that . We young people should try our best to learn new things and accept new ideas . You like taking photos and going to photography shows , why not practise the technique and catch something unforgeable ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a good suggestion . It's fine today . Maybe I can take photos on the scenery of the lake at sunset . It must be fantastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I quite agree with you . With our hobbies , our life can be more colorful and exciting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And I can concentrate on my study after the relaxation over the weekend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it's a good habit to have a life-long hobby . Those who practise calligraphy and Qigong always live longer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you watch the finale last night ? My favorite singer won !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I love him too . He not only sings well but shows perseverance when he encounters difficulties in the contest .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , he got booted after his initial performance in the audition , but he did not give up . He then tried at another two auditions .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He had barely survived the third audition and finally got a chance to advance in the contest . Fortunately , in the third audition , he has won popularity among the audience . And that's when I started to notice him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Before he made the top three , I was so nervous . I just fear that he might be knocked out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , there're so many excellent candidates out there . Who knows which one will make it to the final ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely . That's why when he entered the finale , I was so excited .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He really did a great job in the finale , especially in the PK round . He performed so well that the majority of the audience cast their votes for him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And the host announced that he won it all !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh dear , Miss , you are soaked ! Wow , it's really raining heavily outside .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it sure is . I had to run here from work ! I need to rush as I'm on my lunch break .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well please , why don't you go ahead of me in line ? I'm in no hurry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that's so nice of you ! Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My pleasure Miss . Actually , could you recommend what to eat here ? I've never been here before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Well , the avocado sandwich is delicious , and it's the healthiest thing on the menu . Personally , I think the beef salad is the tastiest choice . I usually get that . Also , the milkshakes are the best milkshakes in town !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , thanks for the suggestions .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , don't mention it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy Valentine's Day !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's nice of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Could I treat you to dinner tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wonderful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Guess what came in the mail today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My acceptance letter to Yale !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow ! Congratulation ! When do classes start ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Freshman orientation is the last week of august , but I want to go two weeks before that to get settled in .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re so lucky ! Do you have to do many things before you leave ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . I ' ll be very busy ! I have to get a visa , buy a plane ticket , and pack my things . But first , I want to register for classes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When can you do that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , they sent me their prospectus , so I can start looking now . do you want to help me decide which classed to take ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . What can you choose from ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I have to take all the fundamental course , plus a few from my major .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is your major ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope to major in English literature , but the admissions counselor told me that many people change their major many times in their first year , so we ' ll see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are the fundamental course ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: In order to graduate , every student must take a certain amount of classes in history , math , English , philosophy , science and art .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Interesting . That ' s very different from the Chinese education system .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is . It ' s also very different from the British education system .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , sure . In British , students don ' t have to take the foundation course .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: maybe because they think they know everything already ! ha ha .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It was great meeting you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe we can meet again sometime ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , but I'll have to go now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' Ve had it ! I ' m done working for a company that is taking me nowhere !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So what are you gonna do ? Just quit ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s exactly what I am going to do ! I ' Ve decided to create my own company ! I ' m going to write up a business plan , get some investors and start working for myself !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have you ever written up a business plan before ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , no . it can ' t be that hard ! I mean , all you have to do is explain your business , how you are going to do things and that ' s it , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You couldn ' t be more wrong ! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less . Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has , history , etc .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , that seems easy enough .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wait , there ' s more ! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services . What they are and how they are different from competitors ' ? Then comes the hard part , a market analysis . You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables ! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has ! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage , where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Geez . Is that all ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Almost , the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis . Here you will calculate and estimate sales , cash flow and profits . After all , people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm . I think I ' ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've enjoyed conversing with you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is there a reason why you're trying to get off the phone so fast ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've got to go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wasn't done talking to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have to do some things , and besides , it's not polite to be nosey .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not being nosey . I'm just asking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really don't think it's any of your business .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's not nice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I apologize , but I'm getting off the phone now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who's that tall guy over there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that's George . He looks very drunk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's he like normally ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , he's really reserved , normally . But , from what I hear , he's got lots of problems .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? What kind of problems ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , off the record , of course , but I hear that he's got terrible debts . He has his own company , and it's not going very well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Well , I hate to say this , but I'm not surprised .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? What makes you say that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , he doesn't look very honest .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know , that's the problem . He can't find any customers . It's a pity , really , because his products are very good . Oh , that reminds me . Did I tell you about my new laptop ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , don't talk to me about laptops . Mine crashed on Friday and I lost everything . I hate them .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , I need another drink . Do you want one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I'll have another cocktail .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Vodka martini ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll be back in a sec .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . I'll wait here for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like your job here , Linda ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's interesting , I like being an editor .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like talking to writers , I get to meet a lot of interesting people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm happy to hear that , but publishing is more than just talking to writers . it involves a lot of work , patience and responsibility . Most of the work is boring .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't feel bored at all . I'm getting along with my colleagues . I will enjoy working with them . People are great in this industry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any complaints ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I have no complaints . I hear there are many opportunities to move up in this company . is that true ?
