utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , we're making plans for a tour .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That'll be lovely . Where are you going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well start out from Long Island this Friday . We've planned a four day drive to Salt Lake City , where we'll join my brother and his family on his fortieth birthday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , you've got to prepare a lot of food and enough sleeping bags then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , we'll spend the nights in hotels and enjoy local food as we pass by . How does it sound , David ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It sounds good . You can do a lot of sightseeing , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , we'll take our time . And we'll go to Five-lake Strict and the Wall Street .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , you're going to have a really nice vacation .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You can say that again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Welcome to our university ' s fifties anniversary , Sir . Please have a seat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Wow , your school has so many honors . Congratulations !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excuse me . I wonder see Dean Mr . Lee first . I was wondering if could you tell me where his office is ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Certainly . Mr . Lee ' s office building at the south end of the campus , just beside the library .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excuse me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me show you the way . Please follow me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you very much . It ' s very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My pleasure .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s up on the second floor . You have to use the stairs . The elevator isn ' t working .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have some good news for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny is getting married .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! Who's the bridegroom ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tom , that lucky guy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The guy always hands the girls in a line . When did he propose ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Last week , It said that he fell in love with Jenny at Mrs . Whit ' s party last Monday as soon as he saw her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My gosh ! How romantic ! When's the big day ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: July 4 , the National Holiday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Will it be a church wedding or a civil ceremony ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny plans to hold it in church .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Who is the best man ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Guess !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nobody is OK , but you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know , Tom is my best friend and he asked me to be his best man .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you promise him ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ahh ... What a fine day ! I do feel like an outdoor exercise .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about taking a walk in the park ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . It ' s delightful to have a walk in the park with the air so fresh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's so quiet here . We have the park to ourselves , only you and me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't you see many people over there ? Just on your left .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I see them . Some are doing Taijiquan , some are performing swordplay , some are practising the Chinese Wushu .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A growing keep-fit fever is sweeping over China .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That was a great dinner . I didn't know that you knew how yo cook .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you liked it . Are you ready for dessert ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I'm pretty full . What are we having ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I made strawberry shortcake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ooh , that's my favorite . Maybe I'll have a small slice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great . Would you like coffee or tea with that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll have a cup of tea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you take cream or sugar with your tea ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actually , could I have some milk with that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Definitely . Would you like skim or whole milk ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Skim , please . That'd be very nice . Thanks ... oh no . Janna , I'm so sorry , but I've got to go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I just got a message from my sister saying that she's been in a car accident . I need to go pick her up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll go with you . Where is she ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She's on the M40 , near Reading .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is she alright ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know , she didn't say . I'm so sorry about this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry . Family comes first . Come on , let's go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actually , I've only got a two-seater . I'll have to go on my own .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . Just call me if you need anything then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will . Thanks a lot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Guess , what I ' Ve bought for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh . it ' s a case flowers . It ' s very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope you like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love flowers you know . Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that ' s all right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Welcome , Li Mei . Please give me your coat and hat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Peter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , let's come in and enjoy yourself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Happy birthday , Peter , and many happy returns of the day . Here's a present for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you , Li Mei . Come into the dining room . I'm going to cut the cake soon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What wish do you make ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a secret .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Honey , why are you so angry ? Can you tell me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You don ' t love me , Roy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why do you say such words ? I love you very much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , you used to be . But not now . You are in love with someone else . You are in love with my friend , Janet . You appreciate her very much . You think she is beautiful and fun to be with and you think I ' m dumb and uninteresting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Susan , just one last week I went out to have a lunch with her . There is nothing for you to be jealous about . I like your company much better than Janet ' s .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I envy her and also I hate her at the same time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Honey , you should know that I love you so deeply .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , shut up , Roy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But honey , I think you ' re terrific . There is nothing ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , SHUT UP !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Julia , are you free tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I want to invite you to go to the movies .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you asking me for a date ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t like to go to the movies on a date . It's noisy there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where do you want to meet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's go to the coffee shop then . It's quiet there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What time should we meet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about seven ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mary , how was your date with John ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s OK . It seems we have a lot in common .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , really ? That is great news . What does he look like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He is tall and slim , fair-haired .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds like he is pretty cute . What do you think of him ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He is a nice guy and very considerate . I am impressed with how smart and humorous .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , it ' s love at first sight .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Mary . What ' s the matter with you ? You look upset .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My friend and I was argued with each other . For this , I ' m very sad . Because I don ' t want to lose this friend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I ' m sorry to hear that . I know how you feel . Please don ' t be sad .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , but I really want to relax myself . I ' m very sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . Don ' t let it get to you . Goodbye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are we going to do ? I can't get the car out of this ditch . I'm stuck !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm worried , Tom . I haven't seen any other cars for almost an hour .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know . This is terrible . What can we do ? This snow doesn't stop falling !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I told you we should have stayed in town today . The weather report said 100 percent chance of snow . Why did you want to come up here ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wanted to show you the cabin . We only had another half-hour to go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , now we're stuck . What can we do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've heard that when this happens , it's important to save energy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We're stranded here , Tom . We may be here a long time . We need to conserve the gas in the car . The car's energy is what will keep us warm .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have plenty of gas .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , but the gas and the battery both have to stay working . We can't just let the car run and run . If we do , it will die soon . Then we'll freeze .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what can we do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Turn the lights off . Then , run the car and the heater only about fifteen minutes every hour . That will conserve the heat as long as possible .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . That's a good idea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wish we hadn't come up here . Now we'll probably be here for days .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it happens . That is what happens in big snowstorms . People get stranded for days .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! It's good we have food .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Probably we'll survive . But turn the car off for about forty-five minutes . Then we'll turn it on again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , I'll follow your advice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about this floor lamp ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine , just get it ! We have been shopping for furniture for five hours ! I ' m so tired !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We still need to find an armoire and a dresser .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine ! I am going to go home and drop off this nightstand , coffee table and love seat while you look for the rest of the things .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great ! Pick me up in about an hour because I think I ' ll also get a bean bag and a dining set .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: While you are at it can you pick out a nice recliner ? I really want one so I can watch TV .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Recliner ? In my beautifully decorated living room ? I don ' t think so !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I went to Super Junior's concert last night . It was fantastic .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Their songs are very popular all round Asia now . I am also a big fan of theirs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , their new album just came out last week . It is number one on the billboard .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really love their dancing . They are all excellent dancers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The lyrics of the new song are beautiful , too . Can you sing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . I think you can hear the song everywhere you go now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's go buy their new album . Want to come with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can we have dinner together sometime this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , you name the day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about the second of March ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What day is that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's Friday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . Where shall we meet ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't wait to go skiing tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . It's going to be so much fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I always get excited the day before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I used to be like that . But I go skiing so often that I don't get excited anymore .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I only go skiing twice a year , so it's a real treat for me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That makes sense .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What things make you excited ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Whenever I go to Vegas , I get really excited .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh ... that makes me excited too !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Looks like anything fun makes you excited .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've had enough of that !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why , this is the most interesting film !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hate the hero . He ' s too cruel .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But it's only a film .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You look so tan and healthy !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . I just got back from summer camp .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How was it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . I got to try so many things for the first time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Like what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I went sailing , fishing , and horseback riding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m so jealous .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The counselors were so nice too . It was the best summer ever . Except for all those mosquitoes !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have a sweet tooth . I can not help but think about having something sweet between meals .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A new candy shop just opened around the corner last week . They have a variety of candies and it is always full of people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds really attractive . Let's go to that candy shop now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you serious ? It is always crowded with many people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: why not ? I would like to buy some candies . Since there are so many people , I think they must have delicious candy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look at the candy bar over there . It is so colorful and tasty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They have lollypops , chocolate drops , fruit candy , mints , pearbrittles and toffee . They are in different colors and flavors .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want to get a big bag and buy a little of everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too . I finally understand why a small shop like this can always befilmed with dozens of people .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To be honest , I care only about whether I can have some delicious candy eat . I couldn't care less about whether the shop is popular or not .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are a candy terminator . Be careful or you'll get a lot of cavities .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That is true . Speaking of cavities , I am starting to feel something is wrong with my teeth now . Let's get more strawberry chocolate drops before we go home .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You really can't live without candy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning Mike !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Morning Sally ! What's up ? you seem in a hurry !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am having an exam at nine , It's already eight thirty .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry , I'll drive you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you very much !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How are your cases coming along ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very well , thanks , I will probably finish next week , but this is still a lot of work , I have been worked on in for six months , and i ' m so closed to end . I can feel it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , Good for you . It sounds like a lot of work . I'm proud of you ! Is this the right building ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , It's only eight forty . Thanks so much !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're welcome . Good luck , bye !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have a nice day , bye !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ! It hurts . Don't touch it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What part hurts ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The shoulder .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , maybe you broke it . But what I'm worried about is this cut .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not a cut . It's a gash ! It's bigger than a cut ! Ah ! I need a doctor .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: C'mon . Just don't move .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm bleeding too much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We don't have a decent First Aid Kit , do we ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . My bike has one under the seat . Get it , quick !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There's some tape , iodine , and cloth bandages . I don't think the cloth bandages can stop the bleeding . What we need is a tourniquet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wrap a few loops of the bandages around my upper arm , then twist . That will work as a tourniquet . After that , you can cut more of the bandages to cover the wound .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good plan . Let me put some iodine on the cut .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , forget that ! Do the tourniquet first . I'm losing too much blood .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright , alright . How did you cut this so bad ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ran it against that fence pole as I crashed . What do you think ? Damn , it hurts !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We'll have to get you to a hospital . I can ride you on the back of my bike .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm lucky I wasn't killed . I must have been going around forty-five miles an hour . There was too much gravel on that corner . I slid out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I almost slid too . Alright . This tourniquet is tight . How does it feel ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Make it tighter . I want the blood stopped . Then wrap some bandages around the cut . Then we can go . Ouch ! I hope I can walk .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright , I'm twisting it around . You tell me when to stop .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There . Stop !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Gross ! What are you doing to yourself ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Chill ! I'm just curling my eyelashes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It looks like some kind of primitive form of torture .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're such a wimp ! You're afraid of an eyelash curler .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , you might pinch your eyelid ! Or lose an eyeball !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It just makes my eyelashes curl upwards .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What for ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re going to set up your own law office , aren ' t you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . After so many years of hard work , I ' d rather I had an office of my own .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If you need help , don ' t hesitate to ask me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' ll be very glad if you would help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' d like to wish you every success in your new venture .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I wish I would .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good luck to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi Sam , would you like to come for a curry with us next Friday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , I love curry . Who else is coming ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jane , Susan , Pete and two colleagues of mine from work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have no plans for Friday , so curry would be great . Which restaurant do you have in mind ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Susan suggested the one on Main Street . She says it is very good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Which one is that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know , the one just on the corner with Oxford Street . There is a large pharmacy next door .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh yes , I know which one you mean . I have never been there , but I looked at their menu once and it did look good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay then . I think we will all meet outside ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: At 8 o'clock . I will make the reservation .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's good . See you on Friday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May , is this the Hall of Ancient China ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Look at these historical relics here , amazing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why are they all in glass boxes ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For protection . Some relics will turn to dust if exposed to air .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So there isn't air in the glass boxes ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , there isn't . There is a vacuum in every box .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wonder how old these things are . Thousands of years ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , they all come from a very ancient time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , look at the tripod . I've seen it on TV .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was made 4,000 years ago . It's priceless !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good evening , I'm so happy you could come .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for inviting me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What would you like to drink ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A glass of white wine would be fine , thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Rachel , do you like music ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course . I can't live without it , so I always bring my CD with me no matter where I go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of music do you like best ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Light music and classic music .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I can't believe this . I am also keen on classic music . And do you know there is a concert of classic music tomorrow evening ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I didn't get the ticket . And it is said that they were sold out yesterday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I got two . We can go there together .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Amazing ! I can imagine the feeling when I hear the smooth tune around my ears .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Mary , Hi , Ken I hate to bring this up , but that new stereo , system you got ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You were playing it very late last night .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It kept me awake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I'm sorry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It kept me awake a couple of hours .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so sorry , I .. I didn't realize it was that loud .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was that loud , and it was pretty late , and check with Mary if you don't believe me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's true . It was a bit loud .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm very sorry . I didn't realize it . I promise I'll keep it down in the future .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , it's no problem . It ' s OK . You know , it only happened once .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am glad we've straightened everything out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here we are , Ryan ! This is where we're going to celebrate !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a ETV palace ! I'm glad I brought my platinum card .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You won't need it . Stanley , my best man , is going to treat everybody !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where is Stanley ? It was his idea to have the bachelor's party at a ETV , wasn't it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If it were up to Stanley , we'd have the wedding in the ETV ! He loves to sing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I bet he's really good !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , uh , I'll let you decide that for yourself . He'll be here a little later . Here's our room !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Frank ' s getting married , do you believe this ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is he really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , he is . He loves the girl very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who is he marring ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A girl he met on holiday in Spain , I think .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have they set a date for the wedding ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not yet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , God . It ' s late . I ' m afraid I have to leave .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you just got here . Can ' t you stay a little longer and have some tea ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s very kind of you . But if I don ' t go now I ' ll miss the last bus .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s too bad .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for your hospitality .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for coming .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about next time we meet at my place ? And I ' ll treat you to Chinese food . I know how much you like it . We can order in and watch video too . Anything you like , I promise .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great idea . I ' m looking forward to it . See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well . I really do have to go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good night then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: See you tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever been to Japan ? I'm going in the fall .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I've been there twice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Tell me about it . What's it like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's fantastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where did you go ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: On my first trip I went to Tokyo , and on my second trip I visited Kyoto .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you think of Tokyo ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Very big and exciting , but very crowded , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . I've seen pictures of the crowds !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And the restaurant are excellent ... but they're kind of expensive .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And how about Kyoto ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Kyoto is lovely . It's full of beautiful old temples and gardens . It ' s a very historic city .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How was the weather ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was in Tokyo in August , and it was really hot and humid . I went to Kyoto in October . It was hot and sunny , but there was no humidity .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds perfect . I can't wait !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK ... well , then how much is one jin ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ginseng comes in 6 different grades . It runs from 5,000 to 30,000 NT a jin .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: 30,000 NT for ginseng ? ! Do I have to buy a whole jin ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You can get a liang if you want . A liang is one-sixteenth of a jin . That would be 330NT .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Whew ! That sounds more like my price range . I'll take two liangs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll have my brother cut some for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This little red fruit looks good . What's it good for ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a lucky fruit called hong zat ! People say that if you eat them , you will have your first son very soon !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Uh ... , I'm not even married yet . How about this brown dried fruit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Gui yuan are lucky , too ! If you eat them , you'll have a very sweet life !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And how about these little brown chips ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that's deer horn . That helps you ... umm , how should I put it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Merry Christmas , Mr . Wang . I would like to give you the book I specially chose as my appreciation for your sincere help to me in the past few days .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , Mr . White . That's very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope it will be of some use to you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am sure it will . It'll be of great help in carrying on the work I have done so far .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That will be great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When she told me that she would marry no man but Dick , my heart was almost in my mouth .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You were scared , too ? I dared not tell you my feeling when I heard that . I almost got fainted .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I could not and can ' t make out the reason why she would set her heart on a man like Dick . He plays the field with many girls .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But Sarah says she does not care , so long as he loves her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , there are some words on the fish .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know that they are auspicious fish . It's quite popular nowadays .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: For God's sake ! It's too bloody . How can people be so cruel ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not at all . I think the tattoos are so cool and chic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can't prick the fish to please the sick tastes of some bloody people .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Honey , it's not so serious . It's just an animal .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just an animal ? But it has life too . If you want a tattoo , get one . It's your choice because you want it . But has anyone asked the fish if it wanted one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , I understand , but what else could we do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for your letter .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is your waist any better ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I ' m feeling very well these days .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m glad you are getting better .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And I was glad to receive your letter .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then when will you be back again ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will be back again next Wednesday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope to see you at that time again . Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's Ron Marston like , Pauline ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's awful ! He telephoned me four times yesterday , and three times the day before yesterday . He telephoned the office yesterday morning and yesterday afternoon . My boss answered the telephone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did your boss say to him ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He said , Pauline is typing letters . She can't speak to you now ! " Then I arrived home at six o'clock yesterday evening . He telephoned again . But I didn ' t answer the phone !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did he telephone again last night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , he did . He telephoned at nine o'clock .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you say to him ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I said , This is Pauline's mother . Please don ' t telephone my daughter again !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did he telephone again ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , he didn't !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you want to try your hand at tennis ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Certainly I do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It seems you're very fond of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd be happy to do something new .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi Mark .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you planning to do today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not sure yet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to have lunch with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . When ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is 11:30 AM OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I didn't hear you . Can you say that again please ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I said , 11:30 AM .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I'm busy then . Can we meet a little later ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , how about 12:30 PM ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Where ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about Bill's Seafood Restaurant ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Where is that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's on 7th Street .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , I'll meet you there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How time flies !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bill and Betty have already grown up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can still remember our first date .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look at that big tree over there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , oh my god ! It ' s still there . We have our first date right on there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you know that I fell in love with you at the first sight then ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You seemed to be dull at that time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you agreed to go out with me at last .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ( Smile ) I can ' t believe this for it ' s been 20 years since we got married .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So do you feel happy now ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I couldn ' t have been any happier !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , we are the happiest family in the world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I heard you were on a date last night ! So , how did it go ? I want all the juicy details !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um ... well , actually , we had a fantastic time last night . He was ... amazing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , now you really have to fill me in . What ' s he like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He ' s really good looking , he ' s quite tall , around 6 ' 1 " , he ' s in his early thirties , and he ' s got the most beautiful dark brown eyes ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He sounds hot ! What does he do for a living ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know what , this is the best part . David is a junior investment banker at Fortune Bank , so he ' s got a great career path ahead of him !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hold on a sec , his name is David ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s my brother !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you feel like going to see a movie tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like that very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How does 7:30 sound ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine . See you later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll always remember my college days .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh yeah ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It was one of the best times in my life . It was tough , but I made it . I became a college graduate .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How did you feel when you graduated ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It was a round day for me . My family attend the graduation ceremony . I was so nervous . I couldn't find my cap and gown , but all worked out in the end .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you do after graduation ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was planning to attend gradate school , but then I was offered a good job doing marketing , so I changed my mind .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds like you're happy with your decision .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I sure am . So what about you ? How did you feel when you graduated ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was also a proud day for me , but I also felt like a kind of loss that day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How could it be ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: While seeing others going to work or continue their study , I didn't know what I would do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You didn't have an offer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I had one , but I didn't like the job very much . I wanted to attend graduate school , but I was afraid it would be too tough .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think you lack in the power of decision . Once you make your decision , don't be overtaken by misgivings and fear . Just go full steam ahead !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a lovely day . The sun is shinning and the sky is so blue . It's a perfect day to go to the beach and get a beautiful tan .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great idea . Unlike you , I just want to enjoy watching the sea and playing with the sand . I do not want to get a tan because I look good in pale skin .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on . Getting a tan symbolizes health and wealth in western countries .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: While the pale color symbolizes beauty and elegance in most Asia countries .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That is a really interesting fact .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will bring a big hat and apply a lot of sunscreen before setting off the beach .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just do whatever you feel like doing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( At the beach ) My bag is so heavy . Let's put the stuff under the tree .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea . It is always cooler in a shade .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't wait to play in the water . My feet are burning when I stand on the sand .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m just looking at this map of the world . I ' m preparing for a geography class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are no countries marked on the map .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , there aren ' t . this map just show the geographical features . Look at the Himalayan plateau with the highest peaks in the world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The thing that I find most surprising is that most of the world is covered with water . Compared to the oceans , most countries are tiny .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I find it incredible how millions of years of volcanic activity have created mountains thousands of metres tall .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Rivers have created deep valleys and canyons like the grand can you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The oceans and landscapes all influence our climate .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s all so interesting . I ' ll have to find more information about it on the internet . Or perhaps I should try and attend your geography class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you excited about your trip next month ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes and no . I can ' t wait to go to Europe , but at the same time I am terrified .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I have acrophobia . I have a chronic fear of flying .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh really ? I have an uncle who is also terrified of flying . It ' s not that bad though , I mean , it is pretty scary to be in this big machine flying through the air at seven hundred miles per hour . I actually have arachnophobia .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re scared of spiders ? I actually have two more phobias . Acrophobia and glossophobia .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess that explains why you are afraid of flying , but public speaking is not that bad .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? When I get on stage , my palms start to sweat , I get really nervous and I can hardly speak .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I must confess I am a bit claustrophobic . I hate being in an elevator for more than 5 seconds .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We are such weirdos right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any idea what time it is ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My bad . I didn't realize that it was so late .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you really think that that excuses your tardiness ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course not . I really did lose track of time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Didn't I tell you to call when you're running late ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , you did . I just forgot to call .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter , you should have called and let me know .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true . My bad for not calling .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If you do this again , don't even bother coming home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're going to kick me out over this ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly , maybe that'll teach you to respect my rules .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , if I'm not living here anymore , then I won't have to listen to your rules .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , Miss , what can I do for you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ordered my dish about a half an hour ago , but it hasn't arrived yet .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sorry for that , I'm going to check with the chef right now . Miss , I just checked with the kitchen , and they said your order will be coming right up next . Oh , here comes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Miss , I'm very sorry for the delay , please enjoy this . Free a glass of wine for inconvenience . Again I'm terribly sorry to make you wait so long .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They must have got in through the kitchen window .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If only we'd remember to close it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am afraid your diamond bracelet has gone , darling !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wish I'd put it in the bank .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look ! they've taken your fur coat too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know , I am sorry I ever bought it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I noticed they've taken our radio and left the television .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a pity they didn't take the tele . We need a new one . Anyway we can claim for all this from the insurance company .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wish we could , but we can't , you see , we are not insured .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Ellen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello , Helen , have you heard the news ? There ' s been a horrible accident .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , no ! What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hilda Harris husband , Henry had an accident on his way home from work .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How awful ! Was he hurt ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . He was taken to the hospital in an ambulance .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did it happen ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: His car was hit by an express train . It happened at the crossing just behind his house .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How horrible !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He ' s having an operation in the hospital now . Poor Hilda ! You can imagine how unhappy she is .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope he ' ll be all right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope so , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I would like to return these slacks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . Do you have your receipt ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Here it is . I bought them last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And why are you returning them ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I bought them to go with a blouse of mine . But they don't really match .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Oh , wait . Ma'am , I'm sorry . These slacks were on sale .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , they were thirty percent off .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry , but we don't allow returns on sale items .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know many stores have that policy . But I have returned sale items here before .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry , but we usually don't do it . It is our policy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just bought these slacks a week ago . And I am a regular customer here . Can you make an exception this time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well . Let me talk to the manager for a moment . Madam , the manager says can do it this time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . I'm a regular customer here . I am glad you can make an exception for me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please show me your receipt again .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here it is .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will have to give you store credit , Madam . If you can find something else you like in the store , you can use the credit .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Store credit is okay with me . I'm sure I will find something I like . I shop here a lot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We appreciate your business , Madam .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi ! Is that the new laptop you brought last week ? It looks very nice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it is . Thanks . I ' m just surfing on the internet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here ? In this cafe ? How can you do that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This cafe offers a wireless internet connection . That means I can get on the net for free while I ' m here . Of course , I have to buy a cup of coffee !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s great . Can you do it anywhere ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . you can only do it when the cafe offers a wireless connection . There are only about 10 or 12 places that offer it in this city .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , what programs do you have on your laptop ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' Ve got all the usual ones for word processing and then I have a few for creating and editing photographs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know you are keen on photography . It ' s very useful for you to be able to download photos from your digital camera . Then you attach the picture files to emails and send them to anyone , anywhere , at anytime !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s wonderful , isn ' t it ? Would you like to see some photos that I look recently ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you get your grades yet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . My whole GPA is screwed up now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ? What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I bombed my econ final and ended up with a 1 . 7 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ouch . You must be very disappointed .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it's my fault because I didn't study as much as I should have .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why don't you re-take the class next year ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's what I plan on doing unless I keep screwing up . How did you do this semester ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn't do that well either . I ended up with a 3 . 2 this semester . That drops my total GPA to 3 . 45 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My GPA is pretty similar to yours . I have a 3 . 1 now because of the stupid econ class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What was your GPA before this semester ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was sitting happy with a 3 . 4 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why did it go down so much ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's just say I screwed up more than my econ class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened to you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I started playing starcraft and ended up wasting a lot of time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You better stop slacking off .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're right . I'm not going to play games during school anymore .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are your weekend arrangements ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There're many things I can do on weekends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What sort of things are you interested in ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm keen on talking short trips to nearby scenic spots . More often than not , I go with some of my friends . By the way , what are your favorites ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love swimming and cycling . On Sunday morning I have swimming practice for an hour . In the afternoon , I just ride my bike around the city or along the country roads for almost two hours .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great ! I think they do you a lot of good . Where do you swim ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mostly in the city's swimming pool . But on occasion , I go to the beach with friends . Well , what do you do at leisure ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm fond of dancing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good . You really know how to enjoy yourself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What was the last movie you saw ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A Korean film called Friends , starring Sang Dong-gun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I've seen that movie , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How did you like the movie ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I thought it was pretty good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I can't say I agree .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're kidding . The story and acting were outstanding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess I expected too much from the movie , so I was a bit disappointed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess it could happen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's your favorite book ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's Gone With the Wind .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why do you like it best ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I enjoy the various characters and the plot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well . I like the Thom Birds best .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it very interesting ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . I like the writer's language , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If I have a chance , I'll enjoy the book .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to go to the bookshop with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a good idea . Let ' s go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you , Sue ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Pretty good . I ' Ve just had my new poems published .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Congratulations on your success .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And how ' s your brother ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He is fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He ' s going to be sent to Britain to study , really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . He ' s already got the passport and visa .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fantastic ! Please send him my congratulations .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . He ' s very lucky indeed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Beautiful weather , isn ' t it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it is . Are you here on business ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I ' m on a vacation to see the famous Three Gorges .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m going there for a tour , too . Is this your first trip to China ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why don ' t we go together ? I can show you around . I think you ' ll have a better time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I couldn ' t agree more .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great , let ' s go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hear you bought a new house in the northern suburbs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s right , we bought it the same day we came on the market .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of house is it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s a wonderful Spanish style .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I love the roof tiles on Spanish style houses .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it ' s a bargaining . A house like this in river side costs double the price .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great , is it a two bedroom house ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , it has three bedrooms and three beds , and has a living room with a twelve-foot ceiling . There ' s a two-car garage .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s a nice area too . It ' ll be a good investment for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeas , when will you buy a house ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not untill the end of this year , you know , just before my wedding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Right , congratulations .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Taxi .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Get on , PLS . Where do you wanna go ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Pls hurry , I am late . Can I get to the Battery Park before 4 ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right , Miss . I think we will get there if there are no delays on the way .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How exactly do you figure out the car fare ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: According to the kilometer rate , the first five kilometers are 4 dollars and every kilometer extra costs 50 cents .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here we are , Miss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . How much do I owe you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You owe me 19 dollars .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's 20 dollars . Keep the change !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks for your help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem , anytime .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me know if I can do anything for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay , thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who's that man over there talking to James ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where ? Oh , that's Henry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He's very handsome , isn't he ? What's he like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's very nice , actually , but rather eccentric .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I love eccentric people .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , but he may be too eccentric even for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ? What do you mean by that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , haven't you heard ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Heard what ? No one ever tells me anything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , apparently , he's been having an affair with his secretary .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ! How fascinating .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: According to Mary , he's divorcing his wife and there's a big fight going on about the children . I thought everyone knew .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , what can I say ? I didn't know . Oh , I meant to tell you earlier , your blouse doesn't really match your skirt . Those colors don't really suit you either .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh . Thanks . Look , I must just go and say hello to someone . I'll be right back .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like climbing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I like it very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about climbing up the Fragrant Mountain tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It is located at the east foot of Western Mountain of Beijing , in a park with the same name . There are some huge stones within the mountain which look like the censer , so it is called ' Fragrant Mountain ' .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have you visited it before ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Many times . Except climbing , there are many attractions worth visiting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Like what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It is the best season to view red leaves from the Mid-October to the first ten days of November . During the period , thousands of hectares of maples on the sloping field are so red that you would recognize them as fallen petals by mistake if looking from a further area . The bright red , pink , scarlet , and peach-puff leaves are distributed in different layout , with some green pines and cypresses dotted in between .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds marvelous .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can take a bird-eye view at the glorious picture when you arrive at the top of the mountain .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great . I will prepare some clothes and food for the climbing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Steve . Is that you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . What's going on ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not much . What a surprise to see you here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . It's been a couple of months since I saw you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What have you been up to ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just started working out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Where do you work out at ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I joined the Samsung Health Club last month .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mostly do during your workout ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I concentrate mostly on my legs , chest , arms and stomach .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I should start exercising more .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's hard work while exercising , but it is a great feeling when I get done .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have a running machine at home . I used to use it , but I already got sick of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Exercising at home is hard . The environment is not suited for exercising .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If I want to exercise , I will need to join a gym .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have a couple of guest passes . You want to check out my health club ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a good idea . Let's go over the weekend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great . I'll call you Saturday morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Aright . I'll talk to you later .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . Bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad we came here . This is really delicious !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was worried you would think it was too far to drive .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , it's true I've never driven two hours just to get lunch . But really , I think it's worth it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think if you try some more authentic Chinese food , you might understand how we students from Taiwan suffer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you mean " suffer " ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I mean , in Milwaukee there is no good Chinese food . So we miss the food in Taiwan too much . Sometimes we just have to drive down here to Chicago to find something better .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Even in the winter ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , even in the winter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And even if it takes two hours , huh ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ? I've been craving good food for three weeks now . I'm too sick of hamburgers and pizza !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , this really is delicious , I have to admit . I can understand better now why you and your friends are always whining .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't tease me ! Good food is really important to Chinese !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know . I can see that . This is what is called " dim sum , " right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , all these dishes are different " dim sum " dishes . You can't find this kind of thing except for in a few cities in America .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So when you Chinese think of Chinatown , you mostly think of food . Is that right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course . I will try to buy some things at the Asian grocery down the block too . Then I can do a little cooking in my apartment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And maybe we can go to a good Italian restaurant for dinner , after the museum . Chicago has some great Italian restaurants .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No way !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We're going up to the " new " Chinatown for dinner . I already know where we're going to go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright , alright . I am happy to try more Chinese food . Will it be dim sum again ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , dim sum is usually eaten around lunch time , or sometimes closer to breakfast . We ' ll try more Taiwanese style up at the " new " Chinatown .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Taiwanese style ? Isn't dim sum Taiwanese style ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , dim sum is more Cantonese style . But of course you can buy it in Taiwan .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wonder if you can cook things this good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm a great cook actually . You will see .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , how was your honeymoon ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was fantastic ! We had such a good time . The only problem was that because it was their high season , we spent hours queuing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Peak periods always entail hours of queuing . At least you got a nice tan though !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , Florida had great weather while we were there . You look tan , too . Did you go somewhere ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My friends and I just got back from Bali .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow ! Bali Islands have some of the best beaches in the world , don't they ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , we were lucky . My friend's father owns a resort on one of the islands , so we were able to stay for free .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you go diving while you were there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I took a few diving classes , but I didn't really like it , so I did snorkeling instead !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you take any pictures in the ocean ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've got quite a few pictures of all different kinds of fish . I'll show them to you next time I see you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have you started planning your christmas vacation yet ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We're planning on going skiing in Switzerland . Do you ski ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , but I do like snowboarding .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to go skiing with us for christmas ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll talk to my husband about it ; I'm sure he'll say yes ! He loves Switzerland !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It is Europe's spotless land of lakes and mountains ! Let me know as soon as you can so we can get a discount .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's up ? You look low .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my girlfriend . I guess she's playing the army game .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How come ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I saw her dating with her ex-boyfriend again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I understand that . But I think maybe it's not a date . You are taking the matter too much to heart .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe . But it still gets on my nerves .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , Daniel , how's it going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , Daddy , today I had really a fantastic history class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , it's so strange for you to say things like that . What had happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We've learnt the story of Zheg He Sailing to West Ocean . He is a real great navigator .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did your teacher tell you the route he took ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , he , with his fleet , came across the Indian Ocean , and arrived at the east coast of Africa .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great , do you still remember when he started his voyage ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , that is from 1405 to 1433 , which is in Ming dynasty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good , by the way , do you finish reading the book Robinson Crusoe I've bought for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not yet , you know I have a lot of homework to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You should speed up , because the story of Robinson can give you a better understanding about what you learned today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , great Daddy , after supper , I'll embark on it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's my boy ! Wait , Daniel , when is Pirates of the Caribbean on ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it about Captain Jack Sparrow , who wants to find the treasure on the sea ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly , now , tell me the time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I won't tell you , unless you promise to let me watch it with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Monica , congratulations ! Your presentation at the meeting was very successful and everyone was impressed by your speech . And it was so persuasive and I bet our clients will be convinced to invest their money in this project . You really made a big contribution to our company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , I just tried my best . I am very happy to know you like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You must have been prepared for a long time . Some statistics in this presentation are not easy to find , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , yes . Several colleagues from different departments helped me with that . They are very supportive . I consulted an economic expert last week . He was very kind to give valuable suggestions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now , the effort pays off . You have accomplished something .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come on , don ' t flatter me anymore . I took the job because I love being challenged . But I can ' t get this turned around without the support from you people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are so many flavors of ice cream to choose from !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , there must be about a hundred . Do you have a favorite ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love fruit flavored ices the best .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know , fresh fruit flavored is the best ever .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is your least favorite ice cream ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't like peppermint ice cream .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I know what you mean .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: One time , I tried garlic ice cream .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That could be interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That doesn't sound like a good choice for today though . Let's order !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you feel about this restaurant ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really liked it !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really enjoyed the food .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you enjoy the most ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I enjoyed the fish the most .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The fish was pretty special , but I loved the dessert .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The macadamia cake was out-of-this-world !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really felt that the service was exceptionally good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , the service really added to the experience .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am looking forward to returning to this restaurant .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Does it look like a good fit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's definitely your size .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is very nice . I'll take it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do you prefer to pay ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me use my credit card .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now , if you'll just sign here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No problem .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope you enjoy your purchase . Good-bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your new car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect . Couldn ' t be better !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You made a good choice , then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's just what I wanted .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No regrets ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm really pleased with it . Thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad you're so happy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's super .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , you must tell me everything about him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , he's very tall and handsome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hmm ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He has big blue eyes and long blonde hair .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , how long ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Down to his shoulders . It's beautiful , like gold .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . OK . You'd better tell me what he does .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's a very creative painter . His paintings sell well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He's quite a patient teacher , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're going to like him . Everybody says he's a nice guy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm terrible sorry . I seem to have mislaid your MP4 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry about that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very sorry that I have caused you so much trouble .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No trouble at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Won't you let me buy a new one tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , that's quite out of the question .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please accept my deep apology .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I never did like this MP4 anyway . I won't hear of it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good afternoon , Sam .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good afternoon , Tina .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you going to do tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not sure yet . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I would like to go skating . Feel like going with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is skating interesting ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think so . Fresh air , white snow . It's so comfortable .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I can't skate well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter , I can teach you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's very kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really appreciate your driving me around .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's no problem . I have time today , and I think it's important that you find a good place .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It would be hard for just me to do it . I don't know the city at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So what do you see in there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This one sounds good . Efficiency with view of the lake . Utilities and parking included . Newly remodeled kitchen . $ 470 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can you afford that much ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I guess not . But that's what I want , isn't it ? An efficiency .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , an efficiency is a small apartment . Usually one large room and a small bathroom . There is often a small kitchen too . So it's good for one person .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about this one ? Downtown efficiency . Furnished ... What does furnished mean ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That means the apartment has furniture in it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sometimes it's good , sometimes it's bad . You have to like the furniture .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Furnished . Parking included . $ 400 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's still pretty expensive .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , but it's downtown . I would like to take look at this one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright . What's the phone number ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Got it . What else do you see ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This one . Two male grad students seeking roommate . Must be quiet . Comfortable downtown apartment . Does this mean I have to share a room with them ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . It probably means they have a large apartment . Probably a living room , kitchen and three bedrooms . They need someone for the empty bedroom .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds alright .

utterances.speaker: B
