utterances.text: Yes , it might be an advantage for you . You are a foreigner , after all . If they're alright roommates , you could learn a lot from them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here's the number , 256-4367 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Got it . Let ' s call these two and see if we can make appointments to see the apartments .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds good to me . I really appreciate your help on this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't mention it , Larry . What are friends for anyway ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Lucy . What are you going to do this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have no idea yet . Do you have any suggestions ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to play tennis with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Be sure to get to the sports hall at nine o'clock on Sunday morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , will do !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a nice day !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . How about going out and enjoying the sunshine on the grass ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great , let's go !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , darling , I think I might have a little heatstroke from being in the sun all day . I was so relaxed . It felt as if I were in another world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly . You know , the sunshine and wind remind me of our honeymoon . You remember ? The island , the sound of the waves , the salty sea air and the sunshine ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it was wonderful but it's already been a year . How time flies !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why not go again to celebrate our one-year anniversary ? We can go to the same beach , stay in the same hotel and enjoy a dinner in the same restaurant .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding ? Can you afford it ? Do you think we can get a room on such short voice ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind that , I'll take care of it . Are you available next week ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I think so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . I'll make the arrangements . It will be great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wonderful ! I'll start packing our suitcases .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m going to the beauty parlor . Do you want to come too ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Let ' s go . What are you going to have done ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I want to have a foot massage and haircut .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A foot massage sounds like a great idea . They are very relaxing . I ' d also like to have a mudpack on my face . It ' s supposed to help with your complexion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea . We should also pedicures and manicures .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This could become a very expensive trip to be beauty parlour !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it ' s a good idea to pamper yourself occasionally . Don ' t you agree ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I agree . We both work hard and a little beauty treatment can relieve stress .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe we should try a thai massage too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ' s special about a thai massage ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s when the masseuse walk on your back and massage you with her feet .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds painful !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Kata ! You've got a beautiful singing voice . You hit the high notes perfectly .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for your compliment . But you are exaggerating . I think you are destined to be a singer . You have the best voice !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Maybe we can sing a song together . Would you like to sing with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I'd like to . It's my honor . Let's pick a song .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about this one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I can't sing the song .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Er ... How about this one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . But I'm not familiar . I don't know the beginning part .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind . You can follow me . I'll sing the first part .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sarah . You look terrible . What's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My grandmother just passed away .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so sorry to hear that . When did this happen ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A couple of days ago . I just go back from the funeral .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there anything I can do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No ... not really . The sad thing is that I wasn't there when she died . I really wanted to be there one last time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sure she knew you loved her . Did she pass away in the hospital ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . She died in her sleep .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry she's gone .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: At least she didn't suffer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think your grandmother would want you to think of all the good times you spent together .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . But I miss her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When my grandmother passed away , I frequently visited her in the cemetery . I always talked to her . Even though she wasn't there , I somehow knew she heard what I said .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah ? That's what I was thinking too . Thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It looks like you haven't eaten anything all day . We should get you something to eat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're right ... I should eat something . Let's go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like flowers ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , I like flowers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's your favorite flower ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like peach blossom , because I like spring .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Peach blossom is really beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . How about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like lotus .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You have a perfect taste !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But there aren't any lotus now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . It's snowing outside . Let's enjoy the plum blossoms .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's not bad . Let's go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's going to strike 12 o'clock . Let's get the firecrackers ready , Rose .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aren't firecrackers forbidden in the city ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well yes , but they are not allowed only in downtown areas . It's OK here . It would be difficult to ban customs that have thousands of years of tradition . The habit does bring kids joy and excitement so long as precautions are taken . Let's go out and set off firecrackers out there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fantastic ! The whole city is echoing with crackling sounds !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What other activities will you have tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Quite a lot . The celebration of the New Year has just started . The first day we southerners have sweet rice cakes for breakfast , and people in the North have Jiaozi . Afterward , we will make New Year calls on family relatives , husband's side on the first day and wife's side on the second .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you bring some gifts along ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's for sure . Fruit , cream cakes , medical tonics are often for parents and aged relatives , and cash enclosed in a red envelope for the kids . All this , of course , should be well prepared beforehand .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is it the same practice for all families ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not all the same nowadays I must say . Many families , especially those of newly married couples , choose to make an overseas trip to escape the routines . Rose and I had a tour to Singapore , Malaysia , Thailand and Hong Kong last year . We stayed there for two weeks until the last day of the holiday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really appreciate the way you Chinese people exchange feelings . The holiday's long enough for you to relax .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , for city dwellers , the Spring Festival is a holiday of seven days . While in the country where traditions are still heavily emphasized , the festival lasts ten days .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a hot day !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , summer is coming .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where are you going this summer vacation ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to go to Tianjin .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you want to go to the beach there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course . And what's your plan ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The same to you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you take a bus to and from work ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , everyday . And there ' s only one choice . All the other buses are going the other direction .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hmm . I have the same problem . When I leave work , it ' s always rush hour . So the buses are always crowded .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yeah , it ' s terrible . I will tell you the funniest thing I have seen in China . It ' s when so many people try to get onto one city bus , and the last guy is squeezed in so tight that the door is tightly pressed against his butt .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds terrible the way you describe it . But you know , not long ago I really suffered on the bus .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What happened ? Were you having a hard time getting on a bus ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You just can ' t imagine ! I waited for the first bus but it was too full , so I waited for the second , and it was still very crowded . Then I decided not to wait for the next one , and got on the second bus . It was so full that I had to stand on one foot ! No kidding !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hmm . Good exercise , uh ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , absolutely !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it ' s so much fun . One day , the bodies were so tightly packed that some girl ' s behind was pressed against my front . I was afraid to put my hands down for fear of accidentally groping her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You were so happy , weren ' t you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you think ? I ' m a good boy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you know how to go to the Fragrant Hills in Beijing ? I heard that they are very famous in China .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Especially in autumn , the red leaves of the maple trees make the whole mountain red .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That must be very beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it can make people feel as if they were in the land of fairies .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Have you ever been there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A couple of times .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you go there with me ? I'd like someone who is familiar with that area to go with me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . I'd be very glad to be your tour guide .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your garden is looking very beautiful this summer . The flowers are really colorful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I have roses , tulips , and daffodils . Do you like the rockery with the smaller flowers ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I do . Those are violets , aren ' t they ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , they are . This afternoon , I ' m going to prune the hedge .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The lower branches on that tree are hanging very low . Would you like me to cut them off for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you ! That would be very kind of you . I have a saw in the garden shed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When the lower branches are removed , you ' ll be able to sit under the tree .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Tomorrow , I ' ll cut the grass . Then the garden will look perfect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just make sure children don ' t play in the flower beds and destroy the flowers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There is a new restaurant opening up in town next month .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What kind of food will they be serving ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My favorite , Mexican . And I've heard that the head chef is from San Paulo .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It sounds like this is going to be authentic Mexican food .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can hardly wait !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you know the day they plan to open ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll double check the announcement .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe we can make reservations ahead of time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are married to a foreigner , aren't you ? So what's it like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , in the first year of our marriage , we had great difficulties in getting along . The things that are important to me are not important to him . We had a lot of conflicts .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , I know what you mean . The first year of any marriage is difficult for all couples , not to mention two people from different cultures .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now we have a two-year-old boy . We're very happy that he's healthy and smart .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , so he's half Chinese and half American . That's unusual . What languages does he speak , then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Right now he speaks mostly English , and he can say a few Chinese words . But he will learn in the future .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What does he look like ? Can people tell ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , people surely can . He's whiter than the Chinese kids , and his hair is a little blonde . My husband says his eyes are very Chinese though .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a great weekend that was !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My feelings exactly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really enjoy the beach in the summer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I couldn't agree with you more .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We should come here more often .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are absolutely right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'd like to come back next weekend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's exactly the way I feel .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , show me your card hand . Here's mine . I have three Kings and a pair of Aces .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How did you get that ? No need to show you my hand , I lose . This is not as much fun as the music concert we just saw .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks again for buying the tickets . That was the most exciting live concert I've ever seen . That silver electric guitar was really cool .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They're quite popular now . Wasn't her voice good ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That , My Heart Will Go On . It warms my heart . you know , JanetJackson , Shanna Twain and Celine Dion are so very different .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Janet Jackson is more pop music . Shania sings country music . Celine just seems to hit all the right notes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you heard Maria Carey ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , l have two of her Cds , l'II lend them to you if you like .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excellent . You can borrow my Janet Jackson's CD . It's her new one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope you have a good stereo .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Because you have to hear it really loud to get the full concert effect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The time has come to say goodbye .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So soon . It seems as if you just got here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel that way , too . But all good things must come to an end , as they say .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It certainly has been a pleasure seeing you again and renewing old memories .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've had a great time and thank you for your spending so much time showing me around .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was fun for me , too . It gave me a chance to get away from my routine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You'll be out to see me next year , as you promised ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yes . I should be there some time next spring .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll be expecting you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You must be pretty excited about your trip to Europe . When is it that you are leaving ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: In just three weeks , and I am excited . But there are still a few things I need to do before I go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Like what ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Like renewing my passport , going to the travel agency to buy my plane ticket and figuring out what to do with my apartment while I'm gone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are not going to give it up , are you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No way . I'll never find another apartment around here . But I don't like the idea of paying three months ' rent on an empty apartment , either .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't blame you . Perhaps you could sublet it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , but whom to ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mmm ... let me think . Oh , I know just a person . An old colleague of mine , Jim Thomas , is coming here to do some research this summer , from June to August .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's exactly when I'll be away . It sounds ideal , as long as the landlord agrees .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tell you what , I'll be calling Jim late this week anyway , so I'll mention it to him then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , thanks , Bill . Let me know what happens . That extra money will really come in handy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Lester , you are really fantastic at automobile repair .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , June . But I think I need to be certified as a mechanic before I ' m allowed to repair cars for a living .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s not a big problem . There are many small schools for adults like you who can study to be certified .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess I never thought of that before .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And you can easily get a student loan from a vocational school , or from the government .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , you ' Ve inspired me to do something !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I need to buy a computer for this semester . I was told it is cheaper to buy computers here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , you heard right . You can get an excellent deal on a new computer here . We have great discounts for students .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know much about computers . But I know I want a desktop computer with a lot of memory . And I need a printer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , first let's consider your computer . Here , for example , is a system I highly recommend--the Power Macintosh G3 . It comes with 64 megabytes of total memory .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is that a lot ? Sixty-four ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is . It should be enough for any student needs you might have . What department are you in ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: History .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , so you will mostly be using word processing , for writing papers . I recommend the Corel Word Perfect program for word processing . We can talk about software later . Let's talk about your

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thirty percent ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow . That's really good . And you think this is really a good system for a graduate student ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . It's an excellent system .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hmm . Hey , wait . This has an Apple on it . Is this an Apple computer ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it's a Macintosh . It's Apple . Macintosh and Apple are the same thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't want Macintosh . I want PC .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry , but our university computer center only sells Macintosh equipment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Are you serious ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But nobody uses Macintosh !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's not true . Most of the students and professors in the university here use Macintosh . They find it is better for writing and word-processing , and that is what students mostly do . Ma

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I'm from Taiwan .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I know that in most Asian countries Apple is not very popular . But here in America , especially in universities and publishing companies , Apple is very commonly used .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I need a computer that can handle writing in Chinese .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are several Chinese writing programs you can use with Macintosh . Chinese is no problem for Apple .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hmm . I think I should ask some of my friends for advice before I make a decision . I'm sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , don't be sorry . It's reasonable to ask your friends . But believe me , most of the students here in the university--Asian students included--most of them use Apple .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , thanks for your advice . I will probably come back later .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're very welcome . Here is my card , if you need any help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me , what's your name ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My name is Jessica . What's yours ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: John .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You speak English very well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you know what time it is ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . It's 5:10 PM .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you say ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I said it's 5:10 PM .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're welcome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Congratulations on the new house !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks ! We love it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , you guys worked hard for it . It's really beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm just not looking forward to cleaning it !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's taking you forever to do my hair .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Give me a minute .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You should've been done already .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think that you're done .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My hair looks hideous .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's so bad about it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't look good at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry about that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really hope that you didn't expect me to pay you for this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , let me talk to my manager , okay ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , I ' m going to China .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How do you get the chance ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know . I took part in the Chinese contest . I was the best and they gave me this reward . I don ' t have to pay for my trip .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Congratulations . How lucky you are !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . I ' m leaving tomorrow morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sure you ' ll enjoy the trip . China is such a beautiful country .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sure I will .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have a nice journey , Lily .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you , David .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy Birthday ! This is for you , Kate !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . Miss Zhang .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know in China we usually don't open presents until the guests leave .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I've already opened this one . Say , this is sweater , and it's just what I need to go with my new suit . Thank you ever so much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You won ' t believe who ' s been elected to do overtime on the Baker account ! Me ! I ' Ve already logged in 20 hours of overtime !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! Why so much ? I thought they were getting you an assistant .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They were supposed to , but so far nobody ' s turned up , and I ' m left on my own to do the work . This is the first break I ' Ve had all day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They ' re really running you into the ground . Why don ' t you ask for some time off ? You could take a long weekend and go away somewhere .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you say to eating out , Maggie ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , why not ? We haven't been out for dinner for quite a long time . A new French restaurant has just opened in our neighborhood . We can go there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do we need to book a table in advance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No need for that . It's not usually busy on weekdays .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What time shall we go ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not now ? I'm hungry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , who's here , Peter !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Tom ! I thought you were in Paris .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just got back . Good to see you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good to see you too !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bill , Happy Halloween !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Happy Halloween ! What creature are you going to dress up as ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will dress up as a vampire with big fangs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: May I have a look at your costume ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . Wait a moment . ( Several minutes later ) Here you are .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like your black clothes and your fangs are cool .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will bite many beautiful girls on the neck tonight . Maybe I will suck their blood .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Haha . Wish you good luck .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi Steve . This is Mike . What are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , hi . I was just watching TV .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There's nothing to watch right now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know . I was watching a re-run . I have nothing to do and I was bored .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too . Let's get together and do something .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'd like to , but I have to meet my parents in an hour for dinner . How about tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . Let's plan something tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you hear the weather forecast for tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think it is going to be the same as today . Clear and sunny .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great . We can do something outdoors then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are there any special events going on tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . I think there's a live outdoor concert by the river tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh yeah . I heard about that too . Let's go check it out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you know what time it starts ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It starts at one PM .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's meet for lunch at eleven thirty and afterwards , we can head over there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect . I'll see you in front of the apartment at eleven thirty .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are lots of new teachers in our class this semester .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , so what do you think about the teachers ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: To be honest , I like all of them , except for the math teacher . Though he must be quite young , he seems like an old person . He's so boring .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think so too . I don't like him either . Well , who do you like best ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It might be the English teacher . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me , too . She speaks very clearly and doesn't use very complicated words so that it is easy for us to understand her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She is a pretty good teacher ! With her help I think I can make great progress in English .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , I like her way of teaching . She told us not to cram for exams , and to pay more attention to communicating than memorizing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it's a good way to develop our language ability .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , our new math teacher is a good person . He just can't find an appropriate way to teach us .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you believe me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please count on my love .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll be yours through endless time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I see . And I'll always be devoted to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . I know I've nothing to offer you , but I'll never give you reason to cry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll never hurt you ; I'll never lie .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My love will grow , like a river to flow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It can't be dry , and can't die .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know whether we are in a dream .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aha , Aha ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'd like to have a look around your house ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course , please follow me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is our courtyard .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's so spacious , about 40 square metres , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , about 46 square metres .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are these corn ears hanging on the tree branch ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very beautiful and very interesting . But why do you hang them in the tree ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They don't have enough time to peel it after they harvested them , so they hung them in the tree . Then in winter , they can peel corn ears in their leisure time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very good idea . Sometimes such pictures can show the house's richness .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How is night life in Beijing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Very interesting !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you suggest then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about going to dance ? There is a very good nightclub nearby .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a great idea . Let's go ... Oh , the dance hall looks very nice and the music is wonderful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you like it . The band is called " Four and One " . They are especially good at playing rock and roll .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great ! I love to dance to fast music .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then you must be interested in disco dancing , aren't you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , disco dancing is my favorite . It ' s great fun and good exercise as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . Let's disco .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Now the band is playing a slow dance .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a waltz . Would you like to try it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , I think I'Il sit out the next dance .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right . Let me get you something to drink .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to go to a party tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds like a good idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would 7:00 be OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's fine . I'm looking forward to it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I come in ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come in , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry to trouble you , but I'd like to ask when I will get a raise .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: In 3 months or so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You said the same thing three months ago .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did I ? Well , anyway , you will get your raise when the economy starts picking up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You mean that I won't get a raise until the recession ends ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I got the message . I'm quiting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nah , don't be so fast . We like your work here , but this company is on hard times . and I can't be handing out raises for anyone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've been here for 3 years , and I haven't had a raise in all that time . If you like my work , it should be reflected in my pay , and I feel it isn't .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hear what you're saying , and I wish there were something I could do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very well , consider me gone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so hungry . Shall we go eat now , Rick ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: sure . Where do you want to go ? Are you in the mood for anything in particular ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: how about some dumplings ? I just can't get enough of them .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: dumplings again ? ! Oh , Amy , let's try something new !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: well , what do you have in mind ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: how about the Mongolian hot pot ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , it's too spicy for me . Don't you remember last time when I tasted the lamb ? It was so spicy my eyes teared up !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: maybe we can try Yuanyang pot this time . You can choose the non-spicy soup base .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: sounds great . Do they serve noodles ? I am in the mood for some tasty noodles as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes . The sliced noodles they offer are among the most authentic Shanti cuisines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: great . Let's go !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: wait a minute . Let me throw on a sweater .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why didn't you text me last night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? I sent you three or four messages !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn't get any of them . I was waiting for you to text me the address of where the party was and I never got your message .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why didn't you just call ? I hate sending SMS messages .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , because I didn't have any credit on my phone . I used it all up this month .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I thought you had an unlimited SMS plan ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I do , but if I don't have any credit in my phone , it won't let me call or send messages .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No wonder you didn't get my texts !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: John ! Wait a second ! I was just heading downstairs for a cup of coffee . You want to come ? I ' Ve got some good news !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Let me just grab my wallet . You certainly do look happy this morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am . Don ' t worry about getting your wallet . It ' s my treat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is a first ! You must have won the lottery .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Bob ! How are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine ! How are you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm fine too , thank you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've come to tell you I'm going to the concert this evening . Will you come with me ? I've two complimentary tickets .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: With the greatest pleasure . Where is the concert this evening ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It will be held at the Music Hall .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's on the program ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a piano recital . I'm fond of piano , you know .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you heard my good news ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You haven't told me anything yet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I got a promotion at work earlier this week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is that right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's the truth . I am really happy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Congratulations on your promotion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am really excited for you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm serious . You deserved this promotion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that what you really think ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Anna , that outfit looks wonderful on you ! The color goes with your trousers perfectly .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , Carla . That's quite a compliment coming from you . You always dress so tastefully .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , that dress certainly shows your good taste . It must have cost a lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , not much . I got it on sale at the mall - 60 % off .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? You're an amazing bargain hunter ! Next time there's a sale , promise you'll let me tag along with you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a promise .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! I've been cheated !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? What did you buy ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a brick ! I can't believe how stupid I was . Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ? Why did you buy a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There was a guy on the sidewalk . He had three new boxes , Panasonic video camera boxes . He said he had to get rid of them quick .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So he said he'd sell me one for twenty dollars . A four-hundred-dollar camera for twenty bucks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it's a brick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't believe how stupid you are . Why didn't you open the box ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wanted to . But he said , no , the box is still in its plastic wrap from the store . If it's opened , other people won't believe it's new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So he had the boxes wrapped in plastic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it was the kind of perfect plastic wrap that comes with new products . Look , it even had a bar-code price sticker on it ! It looked brand new .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But why would a guy be selling new video cameras for twenty dollars ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He said he had to get rid of them . They were stolen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aha ! Now I understand . You were trying to buy stolen goods on the sidewalk . So , what I think is , you deserve to get cheated !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: C'mon , don't blame me ! I thought it was a new camera . We could use it . We were even thinking about buying a camera . I don't understand how he could have such a perfect-looking box .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's no problem . He just has a friend who works in a shop that can do plastic wrap . That's easy . And probably it's the same shop he got the boxes from . Maybe his friend works in an electronics store . They sell video cameras there . Probably they had a couple video camera boxes lying around . So they get the idea of wrapping bricks to sell to fools like you . Twenty dollars a brick . That's a good profit if they can sell enough bricks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right , Sarah . I was a fool . I can't believe it . How could I fall for such a trick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Celia ! How was your trip to the United States ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was terrific . I really enjoyed it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . How long were you away ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was there for about three weeks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's a long time ! Was the weather OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , most of the time . But it snowed a lot in Chicago .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , what was the best thing about your trip ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that's difficult to say . But I guess I liked Nashville the best .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's that , a new video game ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nope ! It's the latest generation of PAD ! You won't believe what it can do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: For instance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It has a built-in camera unit that takes digital color stills . It also plays MP3 files , which I can save on media cards and then transfer to the hard drive of my computer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! Anything else ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This one comes with its own folding keyboard . It has a pre-installed handwriting recognition program . I can use the stylus to write on the screen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What if I want to use CD-ROMs or floppies ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just plug in a peripheral CD or floppy drive and you're ready to go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You really look familiar .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? My name is Gretchen Hammer . What is your name ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My name is Phillip Hammer . I think we are related . Who is your dad ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Jacob Hammer . He is originally from Holland .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's my uncle . You're my cousin ! Hi cousin !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's really a small world , isn't it ! The Hammer family isn't very big .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It really is . Do you have time to eat dinner and catch up ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I always make time for family .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love breathing fresh air in the suburb places , while sitting in the morning sunshine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't agree more , honey . We need to get away from work from time to time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , just return to nature and feel the thrills of its beauty .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We are nor alone here . So many other families !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . The sunny days of spring are ideal for outdoor gatherings .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , let's go over there and put a blanket on the lawn .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , you go back to our car and fetch the picnic stuff .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , so heavy ! What have you put in here ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nothing special . Food , drinks , and Daniel's kangaroo toys .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Toys ? Why do we need toys for a picnic ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He said he would like to be our tour director and he lined up many things to do .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , then . May it really be a day of enjoyment . Other than that , we can also teach him something about science .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Science ? What are you talking about ? Forget about your science , OK ? It's a picnic !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I mean we can inspire him for a deeper understanding of the natural world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't agree on that . Just cut it out . Give him a break and don't spoil the day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , OK . you are always right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , how are you feeling today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m pretty tired . I haven ' t been sleeping well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have enough time to get the right amount of sleep ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have enough time . I just can ' t seem to fall asleep and stay asleep .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What time do you usually go to bed ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don ' t have one time in particular . I just go to sleep whenever I feel tired .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you been under a lot of stress lately ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just lost my job , and I am unsure about being able to find another one .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever tried doing relaxation exercises before you go to bed ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I haven ' t ever tried that , but it sounds like a good idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like swimming ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Swimming is one of my most favorite sports , indoors or out-doors .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too . Swimming is a very good exercise for health . It combines water , bath , sunbath , and air bath together . It promotes the growth and haleness of muscles , bone , viscera and nerve systems .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have never thought that swimming can bring us so many benefits . I only know that swimming in great waves and deep running water can train people's spirits , and enable people to be fearless of the hardships , dangers and difficulties and become brave and staunch .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever swum in a river or a lake ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , but not always . However , I won't let it go if I have a chance .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to come by and play bridge ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , let's see . Why don't we go dancing for a change ? We haven't done that for a long time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , to tell the truth , I don't really feel like it tonight . I had a pretty hard day and I'm sort of tired .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hmm . Well , in that case , we could go to the movies .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , we always go to the movies . Can ' t we do something different ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , do you have any suggestions ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's see . How do you feel about playing bridge ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's OK with me , but we don't have any beer and things .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , shall I call Janet and ask her and Tom to come over , and I'll go to the store and buy some stuff .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Janet . It ' s me ... Oh , fine . Just fine . Say , Janet , I was wondering if you and Tom were doing anything tonight ... No ? Well . would you like to come by our place and play a few hands of bridge ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: this party rocks !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: you said it . Good beer , good music , and on top of that , there are so many hot girls here !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm with you on that . Check out that one over there . I think I'm in love !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: well , she's alright , but not really my cup of tea . What about the blond with the red dress ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , that's Janice . She's just new in town . You have a thing for blonds , eh ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yeah ! She could do anything she wants to me !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I bet . Why not go over and talk to her ? She's really nice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think so . I get so nervous talking to girls . I always put my foot in my mouth , scare her off , and end up looking like a real fool . Besides , she is way out of my league .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: come on ! Man up ! You'll never know until you try .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: okay okay , just let me have another cup of beers to get my head in the game .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: all right . But I think you ought to move soon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can see five other guys eying her up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: okay , here I go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: good luck !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mr . Lee , I was wondering if you and your wife had plans for next Friday night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I think we might be free . What did you have in mind ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've mailed a formal written invitation to your home inviting you to a dinner party at my home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds great . Is it casual ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actually , we thought it would be fun to have a formal sit-down dinner for the holidays .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds good . It will give my wife a chance to dress up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , we've invited four other couples , so it should be a good mix of people .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds wonderful . Will there be anyone there that I know ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh yes , everyone we are inviting is from our company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! I'll look forward to it . We'll make sure and check the mail for our invitation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Our company's wei-ya is tomorrow night ! It's your first Chinese New Year in Taiwan--you must be excited !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Excited ? What's there to be excited about ? It's just another company dinner , right ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You have no idea ! There's a banquet with prizes , performances ... you name it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? What kind of prizes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I heard that last year Vivian from accounting won a new car !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: A new car ! You're kidding !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , really ! And she told me the secret to winning , wear red underwear !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wear red underwear ? ! Does that really work ? Are you going to try it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course ! I'm not only going to wear red underwear , but I'm going to wear red socks and a red shirt , too !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Gee , I don't think I own any red underwear , but I can buy some !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Elvin . How are the new programmers I got for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Stay away from me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you still mad about your nose ? How is it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm serious , Zina . Back off . I have a bottle of pepper spray in my pocket .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That won't be necessary , Elvin . Look , I want to apologize for your nose . I'm sorry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why are you being so nice to me ? Don't think for a second that I trust you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When do you want to have the open house party ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about next Friday ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Friday sounds good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do you feel about hiring that clown to come and entertain the kids ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like that . Then the adults will be more free to mingle and relax .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's what I was thinking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm so excited . Finally , a yard of my own .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you feel like a king in your castle ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why didn't you tell me you had a girlfriend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I thought you knew .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But you should have told me you were in love with her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Didn't I ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know you didn't .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I'm telling you now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , but you might have told me before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't think you'd be interested .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can't be serious . How dare you not tell me you were going to marry her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I didn't think it mattered .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you men ! You're all the same .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We still have one more day to go before we return home . What will we see tomorrow ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No idea . We've enjoyed both the natural scenery and the city sights . What else is there to see ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about a factory tour ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean visit a factory ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . I heard there's a lager motor company nearby which is open to the public every weekend . We can go to see how a car is manufactured and learn more about the automobile industry .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good idea ! I've always been interested in that . How much is the entrance fee ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm not sure , but as far as I know , most factory tours are free . They are sponsored by the company providing the tour .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? What do the companies do that for ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe most of them think it as good public relations . They can promote their product and make their company better-known .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , ISEE . So factory tours are good for companies as well as visitors .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Exactly .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do we need an appointment beforehand ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll call the tourist information centre to check .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nice and warm again , isn ' t it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it ' s lovely . Think of the nasty weather we had last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you these days ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine , thank you . And you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine today , though a bit under the weather last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know how to adjust my life . Would you give me a piece of advice ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You look a bit pale , don't you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I can't sleep well every night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You should get plenty of sleep .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I drink a lot of wine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If I were you , I wouldn't drink too much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I often feel so tired .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You better do some exercise every morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I sometimes find the shadow of death in front of me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why do you worry about your future ? You're very young , and you'll make great contribution to the world . I hope you take my advice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Steven . Congratulations !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your married life ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We're happy together now . We both think that we're a well-matched couple .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's very good . It's said that marriage is the Ab of love . But the words may not be right .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The situation differs in person .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Want to join me for a midnight snack ? I need to grab something to eat .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine with me , but no more chafing dish .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's go to the food stall . There's a good one just around the corner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd love to try some snacks .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ( Later .. ) Everything looks tempting . What do you want to have ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Kebabs and roast squid .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I have a bite ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Help yourself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Super !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ! No ! Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a blackout . Now I can't see Seinfeld .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what ? I just lost one hour's worth of work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How could you do that ? Don't you save every couple minutes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I didn't save this time . Damn it ! And I'm sick of writing this paper . Now I have to write it all over again too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've had that problem too many times . So I learned to save . When I'm writing something , I save every three sentences or so . I don't want to lose anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hate computers . Sometimes I think they cause more trouble than they're worth .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are we going to do now ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I feel like going out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wonder how much of the city is down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter . I still can go out and buy a beer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe . But if there's a blackout , probably the pubs are closed . And besides , I know you have a political science exam tomorrow . I thought you had a lot of reading to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that's true . Damn ! I just lost half my paper , and now I can't even do my homework . This is a bad time for this to happen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have a flashlight in my closet . If you want to use that to read , you can .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: On balance , dress designing appeals to me most .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it's to my liking , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Say , how would you like to be a dress designer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my dream .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you do in your spare time ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have many hobbies . I like almost all kinds of sports and I also like to listen to classical music .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kinds of sports do you like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like playing basketball . Basketball is a very exciting game because it keeps you alert and I also enjoy the team spirit of basketball .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who is your favorite author ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like the novels of Dickens very much . I've read almost all of them in Chinese translation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you a music lover ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I like listening to Beethoven's works .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kinds of films do you enjoy ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like all kinds as long as they are exciting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think I'm going to go home .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ? We just got here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know , but it's 12

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Three or four o'clock ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I never stay out that late . That's too late .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But why is it too late ? It's Saturday night . You have nothing to do tomorrow . Why not stay out and drink with us ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Were you so wild when you were still in Taipei , Sharon ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I was . And I like living here . People know how to party here . In Taipei , some people know how to party . But here , everyone does .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is that they're doing on the couch ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They're smoking pot . Don't worry about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Pot ? Isn't that marijuana ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it is .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But , Sharon , that's illegal ! The police could come , and we could go to jail .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry about it . It is true that pot is illegal in America . But the laws aren't as strict as in Taiwan . If people are arrested , and they have a little pot in their possession , they don't go to jail . They just have to pay a fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn't know you had such wild friends . Do you smoke marijuana too ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I tried it a couple times . But I don't like it . I like alcohol better . Don ' t worry about them , though . If you don't want to smoke pot , you don't have to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't want to .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's alright . But you really should have another drink . People will probably start dancing soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know if I can drink more . I already had two drinks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You had two drinks at nine o'clock . C'mon , Ann , you are in an American university now ! You have to learn how to drink .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I thought a university was for studying .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It is . We study hard all week . And then , on the weekend , we party hard . That's the best way to live .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . I'll have another drink .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning . I ' m from the new york book review . Could I ask you some question about your latest book ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Take a seat ... what would you like to know ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: First , I ' Ve heard that your latest book is based on a true story .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s correct . It ' s a murder mystery based on actual murders that book place in florida several years ago . The main character-the police invesigator-is based on the man who investigated the case .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you research your books ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I always visit the places that I use as setting for stories . Readers like things to be as factually correct as possible-even in fiction ! I usually base my characters on people I have met . Most charact

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really like your books . I ' Ve just finished this one . I read it from cover to cover in a single day . Congratulation on making the bestseller list yet again !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Let met sign it for you ... there you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh ! Thank you very much . I heard that you are currently writing a collection of short stories . What are the stories about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There ' s a real mix of stories in the book . I haven ' t finished all of them yet , though . Many of them are short detective stories , but there are also horror stories and sci-fi ones . If you give me your

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks very much . I ' m sure it will sell well . I can ' t wait to read it . Here ' s my card . Thank you for you time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Francis .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , Mike . How are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not bad . It seems you are super yogurt lover . You have so many in your cart .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I prefer yogurt to all the other drinks . Have you ever tried a kind of yogurt with old milk in it ? It tastes great and very healthy too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I haven ' t noticed that before . Maybe I will try next time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why don ' t you go ahead of me ? I have more items than you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . In fact , I am in a hurry . My wife is waiting for me at the parking lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re welcome . It was good seeing you again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too . Have a great day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Charles . What's the matter ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh ! ! My car isn't working . I'm waiting for a tow-truck .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have a ride home ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , my wife is coming to get me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's good . Do you live near here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , we live in the suburbs . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I live downtown , with my parents .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have a car ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't need a car . I walk to work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're lucky !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you like waltz ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's very nice , I like it very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I invite you for the first dance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My pleasure . But I'm afraid I'm not much of a dancer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: In fact , I took up dancing quite recently , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ? But you're doing the tango wonderfully well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad you say so , you dance beautifully too . It's lucky that I got a partner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for your compliments . It's just that you are a good leader . Do you like the samba and waltz ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . And what dances do you like best ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Waltz is my favorite . I like it better than any other dances .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , the music has stopped . Thank you for the dance .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My pleasure . Let's go and have a drink .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like this kind of weather .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , a little breeze and a lovely moon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And it's calm . I like the peace .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jack , what are you doing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am reading .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can see that . But why are you reading advertisements for houses for sale ? Are you buying a house ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , not yet . But I like to see what is available .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I have a look as well ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , have a seat .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , this one looks really good . And look at the garden . So beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , nice . But I prefer this wooden house with a garden fence and a sloping roof .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , but my house has large windows and so gets lots of sun . And it has a small balcony at the top .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , you can't compare a small balcony to this large veranda . This is perfect for having a barbecue in summer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Talking about a barbecue , didn't you say you are organizing one next week ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , next Saturday . I hope you can make it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Ted , I saw this ad in the paper . You should take a look .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s for a job . It looks perfect for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let ' s see ... ' Wanted , manager for up-and-coming firm . Must have good organizational skills . Experience a plus . Please contact Betty Sue . ' Oh , I don ' t know ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , what have you got to lose ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What about my resume ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here , I'll help you type one up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks , Mary . You ' re a real pal . I'll call now to set up an interview .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a terrible house !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sick of it , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The door bell doesn't work , there's no hot water , and the building is falling apart .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's no use complaining . If we had got enough money , we couldn't put up with it , and would have moved out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: An interesting meeting , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , very . I thought the last speaker was especially good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me introduce myself , by the way . My name's Thomas Bradley .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do you do ? I'm Ted Nugent .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , what was your last name again ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's Nugent , N-U-G-E-N-T , but just call me Ted .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , I'm Tom .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Glad to meet you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And what do you do , Ted ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me ? I'm in the car business .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Salesman ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , that's right . And how about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I work for American Airlines .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ? What do you do there exactly ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm in the Personnel Department .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , there are so many lanterns to appreciate . Now , I can see why it's called the Lantern Festival . It deserves its name .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . People always enjoy the lighted lanterns and the gala performances .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are they doing over there ? People keep on gathering there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you notice the characters on the lanterns ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . But you know that I can't read any Chinese characters . What do they say ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They are puzzles . It's a tradition to solve the puzzles on the lanterns during the Lantern Festival .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very interesting . But I'm afraid we'd better do something else . Hey , look ! There is a huge lantern there . Let's get close to it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's really eye-catching . It's the biggest dragon lantern I've ever seen in all my life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Then I'm really lucky . Oh , it's spewing fireworks from its huge mouth .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Very impressive . It's made of glass which makes it even brighter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There are many Chinese characters on its body , too . What are they about ? Puzzles ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let me have a look . Oh , no . They are Chinese poems which describe this happy scene .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's your number ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm number seven . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Five .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hah hah ! You have to go before me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You think it's funny . I'm terrified .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry . It's safe .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I've never jumped off anything in my life . The highest thing I've jumped off is my bed . I'm scared .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are the one who wanted to come here , Sandy . You should enjoy it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess I'm adventuresome , but then I'm scared too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not too scared . But I've done sky diving before .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Lucas , how was your trip to Paris ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was wonderful , but I was so tired .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you go to the top of the Eiffel Tower .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , that was the first thing we did . We went all the way to the top . There were visitorsfrom all over the world taking photos there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What else did you see ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Art galleries , cathedrals , statues , fountains , palaces , bistros , there's really too much to say .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You must have had a great time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , at the beginning we were all excited and had lots of fun . However , on the third day of travelling in the city , I felt sick I think I had something bad to eat but it passed by the evening .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . you need to be careful with what you eat when you're abroad . sometimes new food might disagree with you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: On the fourth day , we went to taste the French cuisine . That was really fantastic . And no stomach problems .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That is great . Everyone says French food is wonderful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You'll have to try for yourself some day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love Chinese food .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's your favorite dish or dishes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I always order fried spring rolls when I go to Chinatown .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But a Chinese person would never order that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? But they're delicious !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alex , you don't know what to order . Let's go to a Chinese restaurant together next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds great .
