utterances.text: You're right , I'll change it . How about the last part ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Very good . But you should talk about your family , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I agree . I appreciate your helping me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , you have been promoted to president of the department .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All this is thanks to the efforts of my superiors and colleagues .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are so smart . Your efforts in the success of the plan were outstanding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just did what I should have done .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' Ve got a great personality .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for your compliments . I will try even harder to repay the company and your support .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe you will . I ' m very pleased with your work . Your promotion will contribute to the development of the company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for saying so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , that's a really nice outfit you have on .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I wasn't sure if it looked okay or not .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you look stunning . Your dress really goes well with your shoes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad that you think so . I thought it might be a bit too revealing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , not at all . It looks really classy on you . Where did you pick that up ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I got it on sale down at the department store .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When did you go there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was just there a couple of days ago . You know , you should go down there too . They have a lot of stylish clothes on sale .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I might just do that . What style of clothes do they have ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Anything you want . They have both casual and formal styles .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was hoping to get a few new ties for my collection .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a good idea .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you help me pick out a gift for my daughter ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She might like a laptop computer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that sounds like a good idea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Might I suggest a Mac ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay . How much ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , a 15 - inch Pro is $ 2,100 .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that sounds great . I'll take it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great . How would you like to pay for it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here's my VISA .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let me ring you up . Okay , sign here , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Everything I need is in this box ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It'll take her only a few minutes to get online .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for your help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So long . Thank you for shopping here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you cook ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , as you know I was in Thailand last month , and I took a cooking class ! So I prepared some of my favorite dishes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great idea ! As long as I don't get food poisoning ! So what is on the menu tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , for starters we have Tom Yam soup . It's a bit spicy , but really good !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is delicious ! The ginger and lemongrass really gives it a nice taste !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now this next dish is one of the most famous . Foreigners call it papaya salad but the proper name is Tom Sam . It is a spicy salad made from a mix of fresh vegetables including shredded unripened papaya and tomato .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is delicious ! The combination of sour and spicy is really interesting ! I could have this everyday !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , now for the last and best dish in my opinion . This is called Pad Thai . It's stir-fried noodles with eggs , fish sauce , tamarind juice , red chili pepper plus bean sprouts , shrimp and tofu and garnished with crushed peanuts and coriander . It's practically Thailand's national dish !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , this is great ! I never knew Thai food was so creative and delicious !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Want some more ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm stuffed !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel like going for a drink , it's been a long day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great idea ! Peter , I could use the drink .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about the new bar across road ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds good . The food there is fantastic , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I agree , I had lunch there last week .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: excellent ! That sounds like a plan .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your business ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Everything seems to be getting worse . I don't know what to do with it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Things are tough all over . You should never give up !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But how can I prevent a deficit ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think you should make a thorough market investigation now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , OK . I ' ll do my best .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I always consider you are such a guy who never gives up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know life is not all roses , and I believe I will pull this through .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , you can make it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy birthday , John . Many happy returns of the day !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Alice . Come in to the dining-room . I ' m going to cut the cake soon . Have some please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , making good wishes .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . I ' m pretty happy and I can go abroad .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . We hope your wish will come true .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ' s wrong with you , Mr . Polly ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ' s wrong ? I want a break from this horrible job .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then , buy a bottle of soft drink .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Would you like to buy a bottle for me in the shop ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s a problem , because my boss is in that shop now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , I will go there myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , Mr . Polly .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It doesn ' t matter . Oh , God , I have only four dollars in my wallet . Is that possible for me to buy one ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have a try .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you doing this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nothing much . I ' m going to the cinema on Friday night but that ' s all I have planned .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So you ' re free on Saturday night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to have dinner with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , that would be lovely . Shall we say seven o ' clock ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Perfect . I ' ll pick you up then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who was the best teacher that you ever had ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That would have to be Miss Baymler , my fourth grade teacher .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What was she like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She was patient , kind , fun , smart , caring , and yet strict , too . I really learned a lot from her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of things did you learn ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She taught us that you can do anything that you want to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Anything ? Do you really believe that we can do anything ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If you really want to do something and you work hard at it , I believe you can do it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You said she was strict . Did she have a lot of rules ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She had some rules that helped us to feel comfortable . For example , the students had to treat each other with respect , or they would be disciplined .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . She sounds like she really cared about her students .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . She treated us all fairly . She don ' t have any teacher ' s pets .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Doesn ' t every teacher have a teacher ' s pet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well . To be honest , I usually sucked up to teachers because I wanted them to give me good grades . However , Miss Baymler didn ' t treat me any differently . She really didn ' t have any teacher ' s pets .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you know what she is doing now ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: As a matter of fact , I do . After she taught our class , she got married and moved to another city . Then , she started writing children ' s book .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever read one of the books ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course ! Both children and adults enjoy her books .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why don ' t you recommend one to me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ok ! I ' ll bring one to you next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good morning , Gav ! Did you sleep well last night ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I slept like a baby . I fell asleep right away last night , didn't wake up once , and didn't have any nightmares !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great news ! You look much more relaxed than you did yesterday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel much better , but I'm still worried about something .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I have to drive to school for a meeting this morning , and I'm going to end up getting stuck in rush-hour traffic .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's annoying , but nothing to worry about .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: For me , traffic jams are quite stressful , because I'm pretty impatient . How can I prevent myself from getting stressed if I get stuck in a traffic jam ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just breathe deeply when you feel yourself getting upset .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , I'll try that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is there anything else bothering you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just one more thing . A school called me this morning to see if I could teach a few classes this weekend and I don't know what to do .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you have any other plans this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm supposed to work on a paper that'd due on Monday .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Try not to take on more than you can handle .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right . I probably should just work on my paper . Thanks !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why didn't you tell me you had a girlfriend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I thought you knew .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But you should tell me you were in love with her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Didn't I ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know you didn't .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I am telling you now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , but you might have told me before .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't think you would be interested .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can't be serious . How dare you not tell me you are going to marry her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sorry , I didn't think it mattered .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , you men ! You are all the same .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is my house . Let me show you around it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How beautiful the detached house is !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Follow me to the back-yard .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's marvelous ! The lawn looks like a green carpet , and the garden with so many lovely flowers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We had the grass cut and the flowers trimmed this morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No wonder it smells fragrant .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here is the swimming pool and we can swim later .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's fantastic !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you free tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I am . What's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you please go to a dancing party with me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . No problem .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: As a matter of fact , I haven't danced for a long time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But it's said that you dance wonderfully well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks for flattering me . I think you dance a lot , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . Just occasionally .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are your favourite dances ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love rumba and waltz .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about samba ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To tell the truth , I don't like it . It's too fast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then I'll see you at six . Is that all right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK . See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: See you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mr . Martin , we're on arrival .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's nice of you to see my off at the airport . Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'll miss you . I hope we'll keep in touch .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . You've given a great help to me in the past days .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's my pleasure . We hope you'll visit Beijing again .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Certainly . I'll be glad to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's almost time to get aboard .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , we should go . Thank you very much . Goodbye !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bye bye ! Have a pleasant journey !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a wonderful party ! I had a good time . How about you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I enjoyed myself , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Shall I give you a ride home ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , if it's not too much of a trouble .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's no trouble at all because your house is on the way to my place .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great . Let's go !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny , are you having fun here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course . This is really a nice party with wonderful people and lovely wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m glad you ' re enjoying it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for the invitation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s my pleasure . Would you like another glass of champagne ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , please . Thank you for everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , Mark , long time no see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Julie ! It's good to see you again . How have you been ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . I just got back from a week's vacation in Thailand .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How was it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fantastic ! I didn't want to come back .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hear the beaches in Thailand are beautiful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They are . And not only that the people are friendly , but also the food is delicious , not to mention cheap .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I do like Thai food . Did you see much of Bangkok ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not much . I've got enough city life in Beijing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know what you mean . I could use a vacation myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , wouldn't it be great if we could go to Thailand together sometime ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , it sure would .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Congratulations ! I heard that you are going to take a two-week training course in the headquarter .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I am very happy to have this opportunity to learn something new . You know information and knowledge in this field update very fast .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure it is . This is a changing world . Does the training course cover the new law and regulation issued last month ? They are very useful for us .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , according to the agenda , there will be a seminar on these issues at the very beginning of the training course .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , good for you . I hope you can get what you want from the training .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will do my best .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello . Are you a friend of Helen's ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually , a friend of a friend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My name is Phil . What's yours ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alecia .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you tried these little ditties ? They are really good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . They look delicious .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I get you some punch ? I was just going to go get myself some .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That would be great . I would love some .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How wonderful it is to be in love ! It's love at first sight ! Oh . he's my Romeo !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , Julie . How's it going ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , Mary . You've surprised me !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Who were you talking to ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Um -- I was just thinking aloud .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You look so happy . I see a twinkle in your eyes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come off it , Mary .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , you have a crush on someone , don't you ? Maybe those are wedding bells in your eyes !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You certainly do like teasing me , Mary . Well I'm in love with someone . The question is , how do I get his attention ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , that's easy . Walk up to him and kiss him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess I asked the wrong person .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: School has added several new courses to our grade this semester . I have more homework to do now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's your favorite course , Daniel ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I like science most .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Science ? That's a surprise .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Surprise ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I thought you would like PE .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I do like PE , but I am interested in science .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you interested in science ? I can't believe it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Through this course , I can learn more about the world around us clearly .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your parents would be happy if they knew that . Because you are always a naughty boy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Naughty ? I'm naughty ? I'm just clever . So I only do the things I am interested in .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hope so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe that you called me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , hi . Thanks for getting back to me quickly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why did you call me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was calling about your son .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did he do something wrong ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your son was acting up in class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He was talking and causing a disturbance during class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's really not like him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If you could just talk to him , I would greatly appreciate it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I apologize , and I'll make sure he doesn't do that again .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't worry about it , but thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can ' t believe my English teacher is making me read pride and prejudice !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ! It ' s a classic . In fact , it ' s one of my favorite novels .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But it ' s so old .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t judge a book by its cover . Do you know what it ' s about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , not at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: First of all , it ' s a romance novel , set in the early 19th century .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I didn ' t realize it was a romance novel . What ' s the main storyline ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s basically about a father who tried to marry off one of his five girls .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why does he want to do that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Since he doesn ' t have a son , he hopes that one of the girls will marry a wealthy man . That way , all of his daughters will be cared for .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Won ' t they get his inheritance ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , that ' s the problem . Though they are well-off , once he dies , his house will go to his cousin . So , when he dies , the girls will have nothing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . This sounds interesting ! Maybe my teacher isn ' t so horrible after all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So , are you going to read the novel or watch the movie ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There ' s movie ? My teacher didn ' t tell me that !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s probably because she wants you to read the book first .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It would take a lot less time ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How about this . When you finish the book . I ' ll get the movie and watch it with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok . That sounds like a deal .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ( Before Christmas Party ) Are you ready for the Christmas party tonight

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Almost . I have to get dressed . It's a formal party and I have special party make up !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Use this lipstick and it will make your lips shine !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great ! Uh , remember that there's a gift exchange , too . We all have to bring a gift .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've already got mine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( At the Party ) It's Christmas Eve ! Time to open presents !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here ! Open mine first .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow ! It's just what I wanted !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey ! Why don't I have any presents !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Stephanie ! Did you just get to school ? But you were up and about when I left the dorm this morning ! That was about an hour and a half ago . This happens all the time ! Why do you always take so long to get ready the morning ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s a skill . What can I say ? I don ' t know why , I just have a long routine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please explain because it makes no sense to me . How can a girl ' s routine be so complicated ? You get up , you shower , you get dressed , you brush your teeth , you ' re out the door . Half an hour , tops .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Jacob , you have the luxury of having a haircut that rarely needs styling . I don ' t . I have to set aside about an hour and a half to get ready in the mornings . Every day , I wake up and head straight for the shower . Every second day , I wash my hair . If it ' s a hair-washing day , I frequently need to wash my hair twice because it gets really oily . Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too . Because my hair is so long , I seldom manage to take a shower in under twenty minutes . Afterwards , I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew . I take a long time to get dressed in the morning . Every now and then I remember to choose my outfit the night before , but usually I do it in the morning . In all , getting dressed takes about half an hour , at which time my hair is now semi-dry so then I have to style my hair . From time to time I ' ll put my hair up , but oftentimes I bloody it straight . And then , because of the texture of my hair , I regularly have to flat-iron it to keep it from frizzing . That ' s another twenty minutes or so . After that , I have my daily makeup routine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: True , I hardly ever see you without your hair done and your makeup on , even when you show up to class in sweatpants . Tell me , how long does it take you to choose that outfit in the morning ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not funny .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Judy , what is everybody talking about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Haven ' t you heard ? Richard was fired by our manager .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re kidding . It can ' t be true .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Believe it or not . Everybody is talking about it in the company .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? I ' m surprised .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What would you say if I told you I was going to quit school ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' d say , think twice about it . Well , you are not going to quit school , are you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I failed my exam .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did you get ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A B plus .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's not bad .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I should have aced it . I mean I finished the paper so quickly , thinking it's a piece of cake . But when I knew my result , I was like what ? That can't be true !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen , John . I understand that you are such an excellent student and I know you must have lots of stress , but you really want to give up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I don't . I just don't know how to handle this . This is my first time , you know .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . Don't worry . Do you know what you should do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You need to blow off some steam . The world is not on your shoulder .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Forget about school and exams . Come over to my house and have fun . I have some really good DVDs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . But I really don't feel like watching movies tonight . I have to get an early start in the morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then go to bed and have a good sleep .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess that's what I need . Thanks . You're being a really good friend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course I am . Well , pleasant dreams !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks , bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you usually spend your leisure time ? I mean , do you have any special interests out of your job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course . You see , almost everyone has some kind of hobby .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , you ' re quite right and what ' s your hobby ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like taking photos out of doors .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , photography , It ' s really a good hobby .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I usually develop and print all my own photos .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You yourself have a photo studio ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , simple as it is . It does work .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re all set now ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , thank you so much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really , it was nothing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really appreciated it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was happy to help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was so kind of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don ' t mention it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You ' re a real friend in need .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Betty , would you please read this letter of application I've just written ? I'd like to have your opinion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd be glad to tell you what I think .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good ! I'm interested in your advice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If I were you , I would change the beginning . You should write about your education first because we like to judge a man by his abilities .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea , Betty . What would you think about the second part ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think it's too short . You'd better say something about your work experience .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right , I'll change it . How about the last part ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Very good . But you should talk about your family , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I agree . I appreciate your helping me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Jenny . Are still working ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Nancy . Come in please . I'm just putting away on my books .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , you are leaving , aren't you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I ' m going to take a holiday tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How nice ! I can see you are busying packing . I'm sorry to interrupt you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's all right . I'm almost finished . Do you need my help ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , could you please go over this for me ? And see if there is any mistake in it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh . All right I'll read it soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me for taking your time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's nothing Nancy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ' s the matter , Sally ? You look so unhappy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I had a bad day yesterday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I went to the library and lost my bag .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your bag ? Did you get it back ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I went back for it . But it was already gone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s too bad . I ' m sorry to hear that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Zhang lin ! Fancy meeting you here !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Lin Tao . I have't seen you for some time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's life going , Zhang Lin ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , the same as ever , thanks . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Pretty good , thanks . I'm going to see my uncle .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good bye then , and keep in touch .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good bye .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jack , what's wrong ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are you talking about ? What did I do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You told Martha that I was on a date ? What was that all about ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No ... that's not what I meant . I didn't mean that . She asked me where you were and I jokingly said that you were on a date with Sara . I thought Martha knew that you and Sara were just friends .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She started feeling suspicious after you said that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry man . I didn't know . I didn't mean to screw anything up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Martha gets jealous easily and it took a while to convince her that Sara was just a friend . Now , I have to explain to Sara that I can't hang around her because of you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look . I really didn't mean to , and next time I see Martha , I'll really tell her that you and Sara are really just friends .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't bother .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hear your daughter graduated from high school as the valedictorian .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where is she going to college ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She has been admitted to Yale with a scholarship .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? That's the icing on the cake . Congratulation again !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good evening ! I don't believe we've met before . May I introduce myself ? My name is Jack .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a pleasure to meet you . My name is Lucy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm very happy to meet you . You're from the United States , aren't you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I'm from Salt Lake City .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've been to Salt Lake City a few times . I really like your city .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad to hear that . I think it's the nicest city in the United States .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Bill . I saw you yesterday with a pretty girl .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , she is my favorite girl . I've decided to go steady with her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you sure she is the right girl ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . She is the ideal girl , the one I had dreamed of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What type of girl is she ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is the mature , stable , feminine type . I hope one day I can marry her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that's great . You're serious this time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Jenny , are you having fun here ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course . This is really a nice party with wonderful people and lovely wines .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m glad you ' re enjoying it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for the invitation .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s my pleasure . Would you like another glass of champagne ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , please . Thank you for everything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How was school today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was great . I made some friends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really , that's good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But the lessons this semester are a little bit hard .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They aren't hard . I am sure you can do it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you know who ' s just got married ? Old McDonald .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Never ! He ' s over 80 , isn ' t he ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He ' s nearly 90 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good gracious ! Are you sure ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am . What ' s more , his wife is 84 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is she really ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , she is . And guess what , he is her sixth husband .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Quite a woman , isn ' t she ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Going to the gym tonight , Mary ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , Sally . I want to do some sit-ups and perhaps get in a game of singsong .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds like fun . Would you mind some company ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd love it . Working out is more fun with a friend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll get my things and meet you there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . If you happen to see Jim and Bob on the way see if they would like a game of singsong .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What date is it today ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look at the girls in the street . They all have a bunch of flowers . Is it Valentine's Day ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yes ! I completely forgot about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you have a fight with Jack ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , but now he'll be in trouble . What's a boyfriend for ? To forget about Valentine's Day ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , dear ! You forgot it , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know , it's OK for a girl to forget these " big days " , but for a guy , to do that is unforgivable .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that your phone ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's Jack . Excuse me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! Good timing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He asked me out to a dinner tonight . How about joining us ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on ! Three's a crowd !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just go ! It's Valentine's Day !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , Charlie ! What are you reading ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , bob . I ' m reading a biography ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who ' s it about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s about Bob Dylan .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who is he ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He ' s a famous American musician .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who ' s the author ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was written by Howard Sounds .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you think about it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s great ! I ' Ve learned a lot from reading it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I read it when you ' re done ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , bob ! I ' m on chapter 12 now , so I ' m almost finished .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How many chapters does the book have ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There are 15 chapters in total .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When do you think you ' ll have finished reading it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I should be done by Friday . I ' ll give it to you in class then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . Charlie !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem . Bob .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Han Maimed , What's your plan for the weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I plan to travel around Harvard University and know more about it . To tell you the truth , I plan to apply for Harvard after graduation from high school . It ' s better to get to know it . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I get together with my Christian brothers on Saturdays .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! John , I didn ' t know you are religious . You just look like a scientific kook , like Leonard in the Big Bang Theory .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , Han Maimed , don ' t make a fuss . A lot of Americans , including many scientists , believe in religion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I ' m really surprised . I thought science and religion are not compatible , are they ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , they are compatible . Actually , the U . S . is both the most developed and the most religious country in the world .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've heard about it a little bit before , but I don ' t understand . How can people believe in God since they know God doesn't exist ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s a little complicated . You ' ll get to know it when you are acquainted with the U . S . history later on . Religion was and is a part of American people ' s life . Guess what ? Even Harvard University , which is a highly academic institution , is in a sense the product of religion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Absolutely ! It was founded by a group of Puritan immigrants from England .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why was it founded by the Puritans ? Where were the atheistic educators ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Because most of the first English immigrants who came to the United States were Puritans .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How come ? I mean why most of them were religious people ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s because in the 16th and 17th century , there was a series of religious reforms in England . Many religious separatists were persecuted and fled to other countries .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So , you mean people didn't enjoy religious freedom in England ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that's why Puritans moved to the New World , where they believed they could establish a heaven for Puritans . Later on , it was these Puritans who founded Harvard College .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why did they want to found a college ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Many Puritans had received classic style of higher education in Oxford University and Cambridge University back in England . They hoped that their descendants could receive this kind of education as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I see .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Actually Harvard was first named ' New College ' , without a formal name .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When did it begin to be called Harvard University ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: In 1639 , it was renamed after its major benefactor John Harvard . Interestingly , JohnHarvard himself was a clergyman .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It seems that Harvard was predestined to be influenced by religion .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Therefore , it ' s not exaggerate to claim that had there not been religion , there would note Harvard .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , I didn ' t know that religion had played such an important role in Harvard history .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Religion has been playing an indispensible part in Harvard history as well as the U . S .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I finally begin to get to know Harvard . It seems that my knowledge of Harvard is rather poor . I have a lot work to do before applying for Harvard .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Remember that Harvard is a part of the United States . So you have to know the U . S . history and culture if you want to have in-depth knowledge of Harvard . The two are closely related .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s right . I have a lot to learn from you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can ask me any question at any time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We came too early . There're still three hours before the performance starts .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . Sorry , I shouldn't have rushed you , but I just couldn't stay at home and wait .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind . What about taking a look around the theater ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ? I'd love to do that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here we go . There is a museum of the Beijing Opera art .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow . Look at this . So delicate and beautiful . Did ancient Chinese people really wear them ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not really . They are just opera costumes . Do you like the embroidery ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I surely do . They must have had advanced machines in ancient China to do that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , no , no . They are all handmade , girl . You know , the ancient Chinese women were supposed to be good at needlework .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Unbelievable ! I could never do that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very few can . That's why these clothes only appear in the museum .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen ! Some people are singing outside . Is it the opera ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , yes . I heard there was an opera fans club . They are probably practicing now . Wanna have a look ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , let's do it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Follow me . Make sure not to interrupt them .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course not . We don't do that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my new pendant . Do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that Hello Kitty ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , in a monkey suit . It's adorable !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is it real gold ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . Two-toned , white and yellow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How was the movie last night ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't really like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mary said that she was really pleased with the photography .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I found it very disappointing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She liked the acting , too , because that's what she wanted to see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wasn't happy with it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nothing is to your satisfaction .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did you first meet Jack each other ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That is a heavy raining afternoon . I was standing under the eaves of a shop to evade the heavy rain . It's getting dark .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was trembling in the wind when he ran to me with an umbrella in his hand and asked , ' Where is your home ? '

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then he sent you to your home ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a romantic meeting . I can say that a hero saves a beauty .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He joked later that I was so poor that he had a kind of impulse to protect an ant .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He is so humorous .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's wrong , Dave ? You look down today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't pass the English exam . How to learn English well ? Can you give me some suggestions ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , English is a " paper tiger " . Its natural enemy is adequate practice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have done a lot of reading comprehension exercises , and I also spend much time in memorizing English words .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I suggest you read English texts aloud every day , and try to speak more . That will be beneficial to cultivate your sense of the language .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I'll have a try . Maybe I will get high marks next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mr . Wilson , here's a present for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , you are so nice . What a lovely scarf .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hope you will like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course , I like it very much . Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi honey ! You ' ll never guess what ! My friends Julie and Alex are getting married !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow that ' s great news ! They ' re a great couple !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know ! Anyways I just talked to Alex ' s best man and he is organizing the bachelor party It ' s gonna be so much fun ! All the groomsmen are thinking up all the wacky and crazy things we are going to do that night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You aren ' t going to a strip club , are you ? I don ' t want you getting a lap dance from some stripper with the excuse that it ' s your friends party .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Aw come on ! It ' s just some innocent fun ! You know how these things are ! We are gonna play drinking games , get him some gag gifts and just have a good time . Nothing too over the top .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I don ' t know .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on ! If one of your friends was getting married I wouldn ' t mind you going to her bachelorette party !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good , because my friend Wendy is getting married and I ' m organizing her party !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your knowledge of English is really surprising .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's nothing to speak of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , seriously . I'm impressed .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I appreciate the compliment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I heard that you went to the concert the day before ? How did you like it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was terrific . The concert was really a hit . The symphony orchestra was so good that I was completely absorbed in their performance .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who was the conductor ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , speaking of the conductor , he is indeed a genius . He did a perfect job . His name is Menuhin , a descendent of Russian American immigrants .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I learned that he is also a legendary violinist .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely right . He gave a performance of Felix Mendelssohn's violin concerto . That caused a sensation . The audience were stunned by his pure tone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Obviously you did enjoy the concert .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have to talk to you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What , Hilary ? I ' m really in a hurry !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know , Blake . But you ' Ve been avoiding me all morning , and we have got to talk about this deal with the Mc Kinsey Food Company .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' Ve been busy , Hilary . We can set up a meeting to talk about the deal , but I still feel the same way . I don ' t think it ' s worth it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You didn't ring me last night . You said you would .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sorry to have made you disappointed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's all right . But why were you so rude to me at lunch .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Was I ? Sorry , I didn'y mean to be . I do apologize .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And why are you yarning now ? Are you bored ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Forgive me darling . I'm very tired .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Morning , Mary . I haven't seen you in a long time . What's up ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I took up a new hobby .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So you don't travel a lot now ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , Frank . I'm much more interested in collecting stamps now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's certainly a popular hobby . I know a lot of people love stamps .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It certainly is . It's so much fun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe collecting stamps has something similar to traveling right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely . Through all kinds of stamps I am able to learn about the world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , every stamp has a story to tell .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're right . And I also meet many new friends while collecting stamps .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sometimes we even spend hours discussing our collections .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's a lot to share when you have a common interest .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , it's really amazing . I got to go now . I'm meeting with some other collectors .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok , good luck . See you

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: See you , Frank .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Say , Jim , how about going for a few beers after dinner ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know that is tempting but is really not good for our fitness .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you mean ? It will help us to relax .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you really think so ? I don't . It will just make us fat and act silly . Remember last time ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess you are right . But what shall we do ? I don't feel like sitting at home .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I suggest a walk over to the gym where we can play singsong and meet some of our friends .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a good idea . I hear Mary and Sally often go there to play pingpong . Perhaps we can make a foursome with them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds great to me ! If they are willing , we could ask them to go dancing with us . That is excellent exercise and fun , too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good . Let ' s go now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: are you working overtime again ? Over the last two weeks , you have worked overtime every day without a break ! Your company is draining the life out of you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know , but I don't have a choice , my boss has complete control over our work schedules . I haven't made it out of the office before 9 PM a single day this week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I hope they're paying you the big bucks for all this work ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , not exactly , I'm working for minimum wage . And they don't give extra pay for overtime . Overtime is our own time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ? ! Isn't there a law against that , I think there is some legislation that requires employers to give their employees a fair rate of wages . You should know your rights ! If you are putting in so many hours , they should give you some kind of compensation .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They do give bonuses at the end of the year for the employees with highest productivity numbers , but frankly , it's not much of an incentive . They give us a bonus of ten dollars .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's just wrong ! why don't you just quit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I would , but I'm afraid I would't be able to find another job . I don't have very many job marketable skills , there aren't so many jobs that I'm qualified for .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it sounds like any job will be better than the one you have now !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you heard of the Love Bug ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you mean the ' I love you ' virus that attacks computers through e-mail ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . It is one of the most harmful computer viruses in the world . People say it will break out again om Valentines ' Day this year .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is terrible . Why do hackers play such a dirty trick ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hackers are smart , and they want people to know about it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So they create viruses to tell people they are smart ? That's really sick .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your new car ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect ! Couldn't be better .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You made a good choice , then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's just what I want .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No regrets .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am really pleased with it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am glad you are happy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's super .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , why didn ' t you clean the room ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m not in the mood .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why are you feeling depressed ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was told my girlfriend was speaking ill of me . That ' s a real let-down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don ' t think she will do such a thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she did and made me disappointed .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , cheer up . A girlfriend is not everything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But she means a lot to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then forgive her mistake .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: what a nice uniform !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: thanks ; do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: not really . I was being sarcastic . Does it come with the job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes , everyone on the sales floor has to wear one . They're supposed to make us look more professional .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: they're not actually that bad . They could be worse . What do you think about it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't mind it , actually . I don't have to worry about what I'm going to wear every day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: so are you enjoying your new job ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: it's much better than my old one . My new boss is great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: how do you like working in sales ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like the fact that I get to work with people . It makes the day go by much faster .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that's good . Have you met Jane yet ? She's the intern in the international travel department .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yeah , I've met her . She's a genius saleswoman !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know ! She could sell fridges to Eskimos !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: how do you know her ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: she's my cousin .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: why didn't you tell me about that before ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I didn't think it was that interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: well , now that I know that , maybe we should all go out for dinner sometime .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that's a good idea . Let's discuss after work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , Gucci . I didn't know it would be a charity show . You can see there are many collecting boxes at the entrance .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I forgot to tell you this . The show is to collect money for children in need . And all the money from ticket selling will go to the Red Cross .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's really a good thing . Let's do our part .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good idea .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Who will sing in the show ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A lot of stars , including Andy , Justin , Mendy ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Mendy ? Are you sure ? I love her songs !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too . She is so young and talented . She is not only a singer but also a great composer herself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . Though she was so popular , I heard she managed to maintain a low profile .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She is a real star . Not a onetime thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I also heard some people didn't like her music . I don't understand why . She is so amazing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I suppose people have different tastes on music . Moreover , here stuff is really strong and creative . It takes time for people to accept new things .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are right . Anyway , things will be different as the days go on . She can get it . I have faith in her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure . That makes a good fan . Do you know what songs she is gonna sing tonight ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here is the programme . Check it out yourself !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy Mother's Day , Mom !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks ! These are beautiful . You shouldn't have !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course I should have ! You certainly deserve them ! You put up with all of us .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I forgot what I put up with . In that case , I do deserve these flowers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good evening , sir . What can I do for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bourbon , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How would you like your Bourbon , straight or on the rock ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: With iced water , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here you are , sir . Bourbon with iced water .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Now how much do I owe you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The bourbon is 15 dollars plus 10 % service charge . So the total is 16 . 5 dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That is OK . Here is 20 dollars and you can keep the change .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks a lot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When is your vacation going to start ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll be leaving on the fifth of August for the vacation

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that's only a few days from now ! How many weeks are you going to be taking ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm taking two weeks now . but I want to save the other week and take it sometime during the winter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where are you going now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To the beach

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you made your hotel reservation yet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I don't need to do that . I'll be staying with friends

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're lucky . It's hard to find a place to stay at the beach in August

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just think , in a few days , I'll be swimming and lying in the sun and just taking it easy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a lovely day , isn't it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , the weather sure is nice today .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I love it when the weather is like this . Why don't we sit down outside and have our lunch ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds like a good idea . The sky is clear , the sun is shining and there's a nice cool breeze , so it is not too hot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really miss the change of seasons like we have in Colorado ; but I must admit , this sure is a nice spring day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey , this spot in the shade looks really comfortable .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay . Hey , is that a dark cloud over there ? Do you think it will rain after all ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think so . I say the weather report last night , and it said the weather should be fine all day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If the weather stays nice perhaps we can go to the beach this weekend . It ' s been a while since I've not really gotten some sun .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: John , do you mind helping me prepare for the picnic ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Have you checked the weather report ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . It says it will be sunny all day . No sign of rain at all .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like some toast and chicken wings .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay . Please take some fruit salad and crackers for me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Done . Oh , don't forget to take napkins , disposable plates , cups and picnic blanket .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great . We can also take the dragon kite with us . After the picnic , we can fly it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cool , we can take shuttlecock and badminton racket .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , it sounds good .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you recommend a resort to me ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What about the Yellowstone National Park ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever been there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . The scenery is so breathtaking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is especially impressive ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There are thousands of hot springs and fountains . The park is known for them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there a waterfall ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . The well-known Yellowstone Waterfall is formed when the Yellowstone Lake falls down into the Yellowstone Canyon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What an attractive place ! How can I get there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You can take No . 2 bus .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Joanne , let ' s not make this divorce any more acrimonious than it already is , okay ? Let ' s just get down to business and start dividing this stuff up fairly , so we can go our separate ways , alright ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine with me . I just want to get this over with . It ' s important we make a clean break . I should have signed a pre-nup .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What was that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Nothing ! Anyway , you ' re right , there ' s no reason this has to be nasty . My lawyer tells me you ' Ve accepted our alimony proposal and the division of property , as well as the custody agreement-I keep the cat and you get the dog . So that ' s done ... finally .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let ' s not go there , Joanne ! Ok , so let ' s start with the record collection , I ' ll take the albums I contributed and you can have your cheesy disco albums back .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fine , but I ' m keeping the antique gramophone as my grandfather gave it to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I believe that was a wedding present to both of us , Joanne . And you hardly ever use it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He ' s my grandfather , and he never really liked you anyway !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Whatever ! Alright , I ' ll concede the silly gramophone , if you ' ll agree that I get the silver tea set .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How typical , when are you ever going to use a silver tea set ? Fine ! I don ' t want to drag this out any longer than necessary . What ' s next ? What about these old photographs ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Which ones ? Let me have a look . Wow , look at that ! That brings back memories ... That ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Our trip to Italy ! I remember that day . We were going to visit the Trev fountain , and we got caught in the rain ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ... and you looked so adorable with your hair all wet . I had to take a picture of you standing there in that little alley , smiling and laughing in the rain ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , we really did have fun back then , didn ' t we ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , Joanne , are we making a big mistake ? I know our relationship has been on the rocks for sometime but are you sure we can ' t reconcile and try again ? I still love you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh Jeff ! I love you too ! I ' m so glad we didn ' t have to decide who keeps the motorcycle .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The motorcycle ? But that ' s mine !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , Kathy . Have you had lunch ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not yet . And I ' m really hungry now .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m starving , too . There is a new Chinese restaurant close by . Do you want to go there for lunch ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s my treat this time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . I could eat a cow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Isn ' t this great ? I always wanted to own a farm , live out in the country , grow my own food !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is very beautiful . Though I have to confess , I don ' t know the first thing about farming !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s fine ! Don ' t worry about it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What was that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Relax , it was just a goat !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s just the cows that are grazing over there . We can milk them later .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What was that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Honey , seriously , It ' s just a sheep . Relax ! Relax , that was just the horses and donkeys that are in the stable .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know what ? I don ' t think I can hack it here out in the countryside . I ' m going back to the city !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What are your plans for this weekend ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to hire a bike . I think it would be a good idea to do some cycling on Sunday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If the weather's fine .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am sure it will be . It's been good so far this weekend .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know a good place to hire bikes if you want .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . That would be really helpful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But remember , be careful when you ride a bike . The traffic in Beijing can be dangerous .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Freeze ! Police ! Put your hands over your head !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What did I do ? I haven't done anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're under arrest for concealing illegal drugs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you mean ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are suspected of hiding illegal drugs . So we are taking you into custody .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't do anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We've found some heroin at your house .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , I didn't . I'm innocent . Those aren't mine . Whatever you found is someone else's stuff . You can't prove anything . I wasn't there when you went in , and you can't prove it's my stuff .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That may be , but you're still under arrest . And you'd better stop talking .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't need your help , jerk .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Whatever you say .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ' s the matter , dear ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Something awful happened . We went to the Portobello Road , and someone stole my handbag .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , dear . Did you lose a lot of money ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . Only a few pounds . But my passport was in the bag . That ' what I ' m really worry about .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You must tell the embassy about it . And I think they ' ll issue you with a new one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' d better go tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No . But you mustn ' t leave it too long . Did you report it the police ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . I couldn ' t find a policeman .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well . You must report that it ' s been stolen . And give the police description of your bag . You ' d better go to the local police station tomorrow morning .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . I ' ll do it tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And Lisa .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't be too upset . It ' s not the end of the world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , if you're not busy this weekend , would you like to go see a movie ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds good . What should we see ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about that European movie ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean the one starring John Travolta ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , that's the one I've heard the special effects and the plot are outstanding .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds like an interesting film . Let's meet at five o'clock on Saturday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay , see you then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You look really nice today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I just got this outfit the other day .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really , where did you get it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I got it from Macy's .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's really nice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks again . You look nice today , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . I just got these shoes today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? What kind of shoes are they ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: These are called All Star Chuck Taylors .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really like those . How much did they cost ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They were about forty dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think I'm going to go buy myself a pair .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's such a nice day outside . Let ' s take a walk into town and do some window-shopping .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know I hate shopping more than anything else in this world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know . But we could get some exercise in , and we could get some errands run , too . Window-shopping won ' t cost you anything .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What kind of errands do we need to run ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , we could go to the newsagent's to pick up the Sunday paper , go to the butcher's to pick up a chicken for a roast dinner , and to the chemist's to pick up your prescription from the doctor .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll only go if we can stop at the office-license to pick up something to drink for tonight .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine , we'll do that on the way home , so we don ' t have to carry it the whole time .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sounds good . You have to promise not go into any of the stores in the mall though . I know how you like to try things on in the fitting rooms , especially if the stores have special offers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I promise . We're only going for a walk to get some exercise and to get some things done that we haven ' t had time for .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok , let's go then !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any money ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: For our errands , and maybe a little extra for something from a vendor on the street .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You said you were only going to window shop !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I agreed to not go into the mall , but I can still look at things in the market !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I should have known ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like to stretch your legs ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why not ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's get a soft drink .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do we have enough time ?
