utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good idea . I will think it over .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't stand the stupid guy any longer . It's unbelievable .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my dear lady , take it easy . You should forgive a green hand like him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He does everything so mindlessly that he is going to drive me crazy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I suggest you talk with him and teach him how to deal with the problems .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've told him how to do that several times , but he's never listened to me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe you should communicate with him just like a friend , not a boss .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I always have difficulty in getting along with the staff .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just take them for your good friends and have a talk with them as we do . Make sure you won't lose your temper !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , so bad . I'm afraid I'll change the image of myself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , it's unnecessary . Just respect the staff and their own opinions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But sometimes they offer some useless proposals , it's awfully useless .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , no one is perfect .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's right . I should speak to them in a polite way .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We have the equal partnership in team .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks very much and you're very eloquent .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for saying that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That was really a nightmare !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Honey , what's up ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was stuck between 15th and 16th floors in the elevator .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , really ? I know that telephone signal must have been shielded in the elevator shaft , so what did you do then ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I pressed the emergency button ! And then I stayed in the elevator waiting for the rescue .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you panic at the time ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A little bit , but I know that the elevator isn't enclosed . at least I wouldn't be smothered there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Was there anyone else with you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course , there are 6 other people in the elevator ; they were so scared that someone even started crying .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So you mean that you were the only brave one there ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . I have to call the property management .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For what ? Complaining about what happened in the elevator ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . They should check the elevator regularly . I have to give them something to remember about , and they should also equip fire extinguishers in the building .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That was just an accident . you are worried too much about it . I think the property management will check the elevator and improve their service from now on .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know what you mean , but I'd better remind them again , and also remind them to repair the button in the elevator for the disabled people . That has brought the disabled people lots of inconvenience .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great . The bed is exactly what I have been looking for !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You have good taste . It's made of red wood .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I like red wood . How much do you charge for it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: 300 dollars .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's sheer robbery !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Believe me , it's worth the price .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's more than I can afford . Can I make an offer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How much are you willing to pay ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Shall we make it 250 dollars ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . That price would hardly cover the cost .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about 260 dollars ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: 275 dollars is the lowest price I can offer .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a deal .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You ' re home late today , David . How was school ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not bad . There ' s a new English teacher .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , what ' s she like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is beautiful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is she old or young ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is quite young and her hair is blond .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is she strict ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really . Her eyes are blue .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can she speak Chinese ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not much . She is very tall and slim .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: David , stop dreaming . It ' s time to do your homework .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you got your invitation yet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My invitation ? No , I haven't . My invitation to what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The house warming party .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Whose house warming party is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tom and Bill Smith . They are both working now you know ? And they've bought a new house .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , they have ? I didn't know . I haven't seen Tom lately .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's out in the suburbs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Have you seen the house ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I have . I went out with them last weekend .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it nice ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it is . There are three bedrooms , a living room , a dining room , and a big kitchen . There's also a garden .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , that does sound nice . Have they moved in yet ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They are moving today . Tom's taken the day off . He's rented a truck , and they should have all their furniture in the house tonight .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When are they going to have the party ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Next Saturday night . You should get your invitation today or tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wow , that would be something to look forward to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: alright , tell me what you think .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: don't you think it ' s a bit bright ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: yeah , maybe you ' re right . How about this outfit ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that dress looks lovely on you , but it ' s not very practical , is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: no , I don't have an plans to go to a formal dance any time soon , but I love the way it looks . I just had to try it on ! What do you think about this ? It ' s casual , yet sophisticated .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like the jeans , but you need something to go with the top . It ' s too plain on its own .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: how about this scarf , these earrings , and an anklet ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that might be going overboard a bit . How about just that scarf with a bracelet ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that ' s a good idea . You have a lot of good fashion sense .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: thanks . You ' d be ok on your own . There are loads of fashion victims out there , and you are not one of them . Have you tried it on yet ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: yep . Here it is . What do you think ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that looks great . Just one more thing---you need some high heels with those jeans . Do you want a pair with a plain pattern or ones with a leopard print on them ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: the leopard print sounds fabulous . Are they a name brand ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: no , they ' re a Prada knock-off for 1/10 of the price of the real thing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that ' s even better than the real thing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: if I were you , I ' d buy that now while it ' s on sale . If you spend more than $ 100 , you get a $ 50 voucher for more clothes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it ' s too bad I did all that shopping yesterday !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , Blake ! Are you still listening to Mozart ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . Do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's great . and I ' Ve heard that listening to Mozart can make you more intelligent .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I've never heard that before . I just like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is classical music your favorite ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . What about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I Like pop music best . Classical music is a bit too heavy for me . I can't get fully relaxed in it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Pop music doesn't have any depth for me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , that's why I can enjoy myself in it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you always like pop music .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think so , since I was in primary school . How long have you been interested in classical music .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't like it at all until I started to learn violin when I was eight . From then on . classical music has been an important part of my life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh , I didn't know you can play the violin . Do you still play .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sometimes , but these days I'm often too busy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , ma ' am , can I help you find something ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , actually I ' m looking to buy a camera .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We ' Ve got a wide selection do you know if you ' d like a point-and-shoot , or something a little fancier ? Are you shopping for yourself or for someone else ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Actually I ' m buying a camera for my husband .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah , well then I ' d recommend a nice entry-level digital SLR .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah ? Can I take a look at the Sirs you carry ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure thing , follow me . This here is the .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The Canon Eos . Yeah it ' s ok , but I ' m looking for something that performs better in low light , has a better display panel , and longer battery life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , ah , um the Nikon D60 is a nice option .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , but what kit lens does this camera come with ? I don ' t want some bulky telephoto lens .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , well this one has the , uh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Looks to me like an 18-55 mm lens . pretty standard , that will do . Not like my husband will be stalking celebrities or anything !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So , ahem , can I interest you in any acc ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Accessories ? Do you carry polarizing filters ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Polarizing filter um we should ! I ' m sorry , ma ' am . It looks like we ' re sold out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No you ' re not ! There are some right here !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , well , would you look at that ! Polarizing filters .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for your help , Ralph !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No problem , ma ' am .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi ! I see you are having fun with your new computer and internet connection .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There ' s so much I want to do . I ' Ve just finished sending lots of emails to friends and family all over the world . I just ran a search for music to download .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can give you the name of a few useful website to visit .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . That would be very helpful . I ' Ve discovered that it can take a long time to find exactly what you want . There ' s too much information on the net .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When you sent your emails , did you attach any files to them ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I did . There ' s an anti-virus programme with my email account that scans all attachments , so I ' m sure I haven ' t sent anything nasty to anyone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When you use the internet , be careful not to give out your email address very often . If you do , you might get a lot of spam-unwanted email form companies trying to sell you things .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s good advice . I should also be careful about giving out confidential information about myself , such as my password and credit car number .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s right . Another thing to remember when you are surfing is that you can add a web page to your list of favourites . Your computer will remember the page and you can return there quickly next time

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How do I do that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Take this web page for example . Press the keys control and d together . Click on favourites at the top of the screen . There you are . It has been added to you favourites list . If you click it , you will

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s useful to know . Thanks . I ' ll just log off and shout down my computer and we can go for a coffee .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ! No ! Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a blackout . Now I can't see Seinfeld .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what ? I just lost one hour's worth of work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How could you do that ? Don't you save every couple minutes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I didn't save this time . Damn it ! And I'm sick of writing this paper . Now I have to write it all over again too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've had that problem too many times . So I learned to save . When I'm writing something , I save every three sentences or so . I don't want to lose anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hate computers . Sometimes I think they cause more trouble than they're worth .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are we going to do now ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I feel like going out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wonder how much of the city is down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter . I still can go out and buy a beer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe . But if there's a blackout , probably the pubs are closed . And besides , I know you have a political science exam tomorrow . I thought you had a lot of reading to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that's true . Damn ! I just lost half my paper , and now I can't even do my homework . This is a bad time for this to happen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have a flashlight in my closet . If you want to use that to read , you can .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . I think I will try . Where are you going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like your idea of getting a beer . I think I'll go out myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe we can trade . Why don't you stay here and read for my exam , and I'll go drink beer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , it just won't work . If I read for your exam , you won't know the answers tomorrow . I will .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So ? You can go to the class for me . Just write my name on the exam book and take the exam . Why not ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How many students are in the class ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: About fourteen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So it won't work , old buddy . They'll see that I'm not you . Sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Damn !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Next please ! Hello sir , may I see your passport please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , here you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you be checking any bags today .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I ' d like to check three pieces .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' m sorry , sir . Airline policy allows only two pieces of checked luggage , at twenty kilograms each , plus one piece of carry-on luggage . I will have to charge you extra for the additional suitcase .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Why ! I am taking an intercontinental flight ! I ' m flying sixteen thousand CMS ! How am I supposed to only take two , twenty kilo bags ? That ' absurd !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am sorry , sir , there ' s nothing I can do . You cannot board the flight with that large bag either . Carry - on bags must fit in the over-head compartment or under your seat . That bag is clearly too big .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now I see . You charge next to nothing for an international ticket , but when it comes to charging for any other small thing , you charge an arm and a leg ! So tell me , miss , how much will I have to pay for all of this .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let ' s see ... six hundred and twenty-five US dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s more than my round-trip ticket !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Morning , Peter . Nice suit ! A new one ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , yes . My wife bought it for me yesterday . Hmm , you look nice in that yellow dress . Yellow suits you really well .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe . Several people have suggested that I get more yellow clothes . They say the color suits me because I have a fair complexion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's right . You know , pink , green and black could also be good for you . Actually , I think that all colors are okay for a person with your complexion . It's just that different colors can give people different impressions . For example , black could make you look mature , while pink could make you look young and energetic .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for your compliments . It sounds like you're a clothing expert .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , compared with my wife , I'm just a beginner .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They don't really think you took it , do they ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know . I just know I've never been asked so many questions in my life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How many of them were there ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Three-but there was one of them who kept asking really stupid questions .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Like what ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , he wanted to know what time I got up this morning and if I bad a bath or a shower you know , things like that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What on earth has that got to do with some money disappearing ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've no idea . Oh yes , and the most ridiculous thing . He asked me what I had for breakfast this morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh well , that's it . They obviously think you're a desperate criminal and you have to steal to eat . I should think you'll get thirty years .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hmm . Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you watch the final last night ? My favorite singer won !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I love him too . He not only sings well but also shows perseverance when he encounters difficulties in the contest .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , he got booted after his initial performance in the audition , but he did not give up . He then tried at another two auditions .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He had barely survived the third audition and finally got a chance to advance in the contest . Fortunately , in the third audition , he has won popularity among the audience . And that's when I started to notice him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Before he made the top three , I was so nervous . I just fear that he might be knocked out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , there're so many excellent candidates out there . Who knows which one will make it to the final ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely . That's why when he entered the final , I was so excited .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He really did a great job in the finale , especially in the PK round . He performed so well that the majority of the audience cast their votes for him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And the host announced that he won it all !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning , sir . Can I see your boarding pass , please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here you are .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me , sir . This is your passport .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Ugh ... Is there any difference ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . As a matter of fact , you can't board the plane without boarding pass .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Gee . I must have left it in my hotel room .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry sir . I can't let you pass .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But when does the plane take off ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ugh , in about thirty minutes , sir .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my God ! What do I do now ? Bone head , bone head , bone head ( He smashes his head with his hand . ) .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Calm down , sir . You are creating a commotion .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ( The speaker in the airport says , ' Mr . Benjamin , we now have a boarding pass by the name of Benjamin at Lost and Found . ' ) Is that me ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Could be .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , thank God . Thank you , I'll be right back .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ( Benjamin starts to run and then he seems to remember something and returns . ) Ugh , excuse me , where is the Lost and Found ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's down in the lobby . Turn left at exit B .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you , thank you , thanks again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning . I ' m from the New York book review . Could I ask you some questions about your latest book ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . Take a seat ... what would you like to know ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: First , I ' Ve heard that your latest book is based on a true story .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s correct . It ' s a murder mystery based on actual murders that book place in Florida several years ago . The main character-the police invesigator-is based on the man who investigated the case .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you research your books ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I always visit the places that I use as setting for stories . Readers like things to be as factually correct as possible-even in fiction ! I usually base my characters on people I have met . Most character are a mixture of the characters of two or more people .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really like your books . I ' Ve just finished this one . I read it from cover to cover in a single day . Congratulation on making the bestseller list yet again !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Let met sign it for you ... there you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh ! Thank you very much . I heard that you are currently writing a collection of short stories . What are the stories about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There ' s a real mix of stories in the book . I haven ' t finished all of them yet , though . Many of them are short detective stories , but there are also horror stories and sci-fi ones . If you give me your business card , I ' ll make sure you get an advance copy to review .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks very much . I ' m sure it will sell well . I can ' t wait to read it . Here ' s my card . Thank you for you time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is everything to your satisfaction ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , the steak was recommended , but it is not very fresh .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh ! Sorry to hear that . This is quite unusual as we have steak from the market every day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So what ? It is not fresh and I'm not happy about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry , sir . Do you wish to try something else ? That would be on the house , of course .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good afternoon , miss , can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I ' d like to buy this dress , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s certainly a pretty dress . I can ring you up at the register over here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you be paying by cash , check , or credit card ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want to use a credit card . Do you take Discover ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , no . We only take MasterCard or Visa .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' ll put it on my Visa card , then .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very well , ma ' am . Oh , there seems to be a problem , it says it ' s rejected .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There must be something wrong with the system . Try my MasterCard .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright . Thank you . Yes , it seems to be working fine . Your total is $ 199 . 00 , sign here , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here you go , and here ' s your receipt . Have a nice day .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks . You have a good one , too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why do you want to take the police to court ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They arrested me without probable cause .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They did ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They had no reason for arresting me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I thought they let you go .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , the next morning .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They made you spend the night at the station ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , they did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What was their reason for arresting you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I matched the description of a bank robber they were looking for .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want justice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Mr . Mass , here is a gift for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh . Thanks a million .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a souvenir I bought for you from Rome .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How beautiful ! I love it at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad you like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's very kind of you . I really don't know how I can thank you enough .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't mention it . Just a little thing I did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why don't you sit down and relax , darling ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't want to .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , come over and talk to me then .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Certainly not .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I turn on the TV then ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Turn on the TV for what ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So that we can sit down together and listen to some music .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen to the music ? And who will cook dinner , will you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I will , but let's go to the disco after dinner .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To a disco ? Oh , no . You know I hate it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please help yourself to whatever you like , don't be shy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , thank you . I've already been helping myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This dish taste terrific . Would you like to try a little ? It is a little hot , but very good .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like hot food , especially Sichuan cuisine .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like another beer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll have another cup of beer insist . I know I don't like to drink alone , especially there are someone sitting there next to me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on , it's the weekend . Let's taste and enjoy this meal . Cheers !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bottom's up , and you're right . This meal is incredible . I wish I had known this restaurant before . Thanks for bringing me here . I know I'll be back agile soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We finally get a chance to meet .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you for meeting me here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's no problem .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I need to speak with you about your daughter .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there something wrong ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I enjoy having your daughter in my class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm glad to hear it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is a great addition to my class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You don't have anything bad to say about her ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: She is always behaving herself , and she's so smart .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am so happy that she's doing okay .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm more than happy having her in my class .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Everything is now . I'm kind of sick of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Each ring has 3 small diamonds inside the band .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oooh ! One for each of the zeros in 2000 ! Wow !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Stop making fun of me .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So find a guy to marry and you can get one !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't need a guy to buy a wedding ring !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , I see . You're going to wear one and pretend you're married to try to attract guys .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When will I get a raise ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: In three months or so ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You said the same thing three months ago .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did I ? Well . Anyway , you'll get your raise when the economy starts picking up .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You mean I won't get a raise until recession ends ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I got the message . I am quitting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , BCD Company , can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello , may I speak to Mrs Smith ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is Mrs Smith , may I have your name ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is Sun , and I interviewed with you yesterday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Mr . Sun .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am calling to thank you for giving me the interview for the Sales Manager position yesterday .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are welcome , Mr . Sun .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I really enjoyed meeting with you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You certainly made a good impression on me , as well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am very interested in this position .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'll be making the decision by the end of this week and we'll contact you as soon as possible .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , thank you for your time and consideration again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are welcome .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So can you fix it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sorry sir . This computer is not broken or damaged . It ' s simply just too old ! That ' s why your programs and applications are running slow . There really isn ' t much I can do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ? I bought this computer just three years ago !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , but technology is ever changing and technology is becoming obsolete faster and faster !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , I know where this is going . How much will it cost me to get a new computer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , this desktop over here is our latest model . It has a four gigahertz processor with sixteen gigabytes in RAM and a hard disk with one terabyte . Of course , it includes a mouse , keyboard and desk speakers .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have no idea what you are talking about . I just want to know if it ' s good and if I will be able to play solitaire without the computer crashing or freezing all the time !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This PC is top of the line and I guarantee it will never freeze ! If it does , we ' ll give you your money back !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it ' s so great to be here ! I ' m so excited to help you and my daughter with your new home !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: we ' re glad that you ' re here . Would you like a tour of the house ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that ' d be great , but could I have a cup of tea first ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: sure , I ' ll just go put the kettle on . Why don ' t you have a seat on the sofa and I ' ll go take care of things in the kitchen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that would be lovely , thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: do you take milk or sugar with your tea ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' ll take a little milk , but no sugar , please . Make sure you let the tea steep a few minutes before you take the tea bag out of the cup .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ok . What do you think about our living room ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: well , I do like the mantelpiece and the coffee table , but I don ' t really care for curtains . Did you get them at a yard sale ? They look ancient .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: my parents gave them to us as a house warming gift .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: oh dear . Well , I suppose they will do for now . do you ever dust in here ? It seems a bit dusty in here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: your daughter usually does the dusting , and I do the vacuuming .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Well , I can help with the chores while I ' m here . You two could probably use my help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: that ' s very nice of you to offer . Here ' s your tea . Be careful , it ' s still quite hot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your knowledge of English is really surprising .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , it's nothing to speak of .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , seriously . I am impressed .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . I appreciate the compliment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you going to vote this Tuesday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I am , and I am so excited .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you figured out who you ' re going to vote for ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love my candidate .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why is that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My candidate is probably the most intelligent .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I also agree with all his policies .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s great !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know he ' s going to be the next President .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hopefully , he will be .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can ' t wait to vote .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any shoes like these ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What size ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Size five .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What colour ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Black .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m sorry . We don't haven any .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But my sister bought this pair last month .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did she buy them here ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , she bought them in the U . S .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We had some shoes like those a month ago , but we don't have any now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you get a pair for me please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I ' m afraid that I can ' t . They were in fashion last year and the year before last . But they ' re not in fashion this year . These shoes are in fashion now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: They look very uncomfortable .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They are very uncomfortable . But women always wear uncomfortable shoes !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Our company is going to do some cutbacks soon .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? Where did you hear that ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I met with the supervisor just this morning . I don't know , but I am a little worried . Who do you think will get sacked ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm not sure ... well , first , it couldn't be George . He is such a kiss-ass . He'd wash the boss's dog if he asked .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , it's not going to be George . I don't think it's Andy either . He is involved with the boss's sister in-law . And you know how whipped our boss is .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true . What about Lisa ? I bet there's nobody who could do a worse job than her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Lisa ? No way . I've heard a rumor that she and the boss were having an affair . You know rumors can't come out from nowhere .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , okay . Then there is still Michael . But he's the boss ' pet after having the best sales record for three months in a row . It definitely won't be Michael .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , that would be crazy . But then who will it be ? Oh dear , it must be me . I should have known it ! Why else would he have talked to me alone about the downsizing . What should I do ? I've got a family to support .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , it could be me too . But I am not too worried . This place is suffocating me with this boss being such a hard-ass and colleagues who barely know how to get dressed in the morning . It would almost be a blessing to be fired from this place .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow ! They've got everything here . All the world's famous brands . Aunt Cindy , what is your favorite brand ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love all the fashionable things . But my favorite brand is Chanel .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that's a very expensive brand , but with good reason .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . Each style is specially designed by world's top designers . So they can always make you look amazing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Come here . The high heels here look really attractive . But I wonder whether it's comfortable to wear any of them ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really , especially at the beginning , if you wear high heels all day long , your feet would hurt . But , no big deal . Women can always get used to that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not a simple thing to be beautiful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . But everyone loves to be beautiful . Hey , do you think this pair of sunglasses matches the handbag well ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah , very tasteful . And with them , you look even more fashionable . Oh , there are so many French perfumers . Oops , perfumes for guys ? So strange !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come on . Fashion is not only for women . Men also share the equal right to chase fashion . It's the new fashion for men to wear perfumes , which is called cologne .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , really , that's really something new . I'm afraid not everyone can accept it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It takes time for that . But people's consuming attitudes are changing quickly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's true . Well , it's obvious that fashion is not a cheap thing . So , do you spend all your money on it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No . Fashion is just part of my life , which improves its quality . But also , I'm good at financing . I have a credit card , but I never overdraft .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How is it that you are my mom's sis ? You two are so different . She always picks up bargains and spends more than she earns . You do so much better than her .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have to say that's just the result of difference of our consumptive habits .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Happy birthday , Jim !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you , Lisa .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here is a present for you . I hope you like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , great ! I love it ! You know I've been expecting this for a long time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm very glad to hear that .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Come here , let me introduce some friends to you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened ? Why didn't he win ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Didn't you hear ? He was disqualified .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How did that happen ? He's so talented ! I thought he had a great chance of winning a gold medal !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If he didn't have any drug problems , he would have won .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What ? What kind of drugs was he using ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He was taking steroids to make him stronger and faster .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I thought that all athletes were supposed to be regularly tested for drugs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They are . The only reason they didn't disqualify him until after the race is because the results from the text only came back afterwards .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's so disappointing . I don't know why top athletes would feel the need to take drugs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think it's right , but I can understand why they might . Imagine how much pressure there would be to win for your country !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Regardless of how much pressure you're under , there's never a good reason to take drugs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I agree . Hopefully with the new regulations , fewer athletes will try to cheat with drugs .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let's hope so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sis , why did you ask me to come to this bargain market ? It's so crowded , and you can't find anything that you really want .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You just don't get it . Looking for bargains can be really interesting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you serious ? How can that be ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bargaining is a game , or even a battle . You feel like a winner when you get a good price .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on . You know , you can never really win . The salesperson never loses . They make their living out of it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's true . But I just love it . Come here !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , this silk carpet is really beautiful . Look at the pattern , and how delicate it is !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You do have great taste . That's the most expensive stuff here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? Oh , this one . I like the cloisonn vase .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding me ? I bought a same one last week . It's surprising that there is something we both like . Well , what do you think of these ceramic cups ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on . They look so cheap . Something else , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What about this picture ? I think Benjamin would like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't underestimate his taste . I don't think he'd like it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't be so sure . He loves the vase I bought here last week .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah . Well , anyway , it's up to you . But I can tell that you come here often .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Absolutely . That's why I can always get a good price .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey George , how is your chicken ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My chicken tastes all right , but it is pretty dry . How is your fish ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My fish is pretty dry too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's almost as if this food has been sitting a little too long . It doesn't seem fresh .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , it seems that way to me also .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How are your vegetables ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My vegetables are very soggy .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Mine are the same way . It seems like they've been overcooked .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't usually complain , but I think that we should mention this to the waiter .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I agree . Maybe they can bring us some better food .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you want your hair cut ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want it the way Peckham wears it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who is Peckham ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding me ? Even the girls know Peckham . Whatever , I have a picture of him here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are a big fan of him ! He has strong legs .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , he is a soccer star .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , wake up . It's done . How do you like it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , my God . It's disaster . It makes my head look like a soccer ball .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But it's the same hairstyle .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It looks like the hairstyle of Kahn who stands beside him in the picture .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh . I made a mistake . I thought the guy on the right was Peckham .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He plays outside right but it doesn't mean he has to stand on the right .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sorry , but do not worry . I think I can fix it . Just cut a little more off the temple .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do it , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , hi , Jessica , are you going to see this movie too ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd love to , the movies are smash hit .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then let's go in .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't . I'm waiting for Paul , but he's late .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll say the movie's starting in the minute .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know . I wonder what's keeping him .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Looks like he won't show up . He's done this before , hasn't he ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , a number of times .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's he trying to pull anyway .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know . But this is definitely the last straw .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe you should start seeing someone else .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You said it . Ok , let's go in , Sandy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello . I am calling about the apartment you advertised .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , what kind of apartment are you interested in ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am interested in one-bedroom . Do you have any available ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I have one . When you need it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sometime around next week . What can you tell me about this apartment ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , It's a one-bedroom apartment . The monthly rent at 650 dollars and a 300 dollars security deposit . You pay electricity only . Gas and water is included . Both the heat and stove are gas . Let me see , what else ... Oh , you'll be assigned a sheltered parking space at no extra charge . And that's probably it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sounds good . May I come over tomorrow to take a look ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure . What time would you like to come ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How about 10 am ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good , May I have your name , please ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My name is Blanca .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks for calling , Blanca . I'll see you tomorrow .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look , Jim . That man just fell down over there .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We'd better see if he is ok .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sir , sir , are you all right , sir ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He is not answering . You'd better check his pulse and breathing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , no . He is not breathing and there ' s no pulse . Call 911 .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello ? Yes , someone has passed out at Dongle Ave . and 2nd street . He isn't breathing and doesn't have a pulse . Yes , my friend is performing CPR . Ok , thank you . They are sending an ambulance . Here , let me help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You bet it is . And we got four thousand for our car space ! Awesome !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's play some music ! I feel like dancing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's just what was running through my mind . Moonlight and dancing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ahh ! Now that's more like it . Atmosphere !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come on baby , let's dance !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oops ! It's the landlord . I guess the tables have turned now . We're the noisy neighbors . Turn it down !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , I come to pick up my laundry . This is the invoice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here you are . We've ironed them for you already . Please check and see if there is any damage .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid that a button is missing .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm terribly sorry . You know we are so busy today and we forget to sew the button back on . Please wait a moment . It will be ready soon .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , please .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Would you like to have a look ? Is it to your satisfaction ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , oh my God , there is another problem , I'm afraid . There is still a stain on the shirt .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It doesn't seem like that . Sorry , sir , we've tried everything , but we're not able to get it off the shirt . It was from the sugar I think .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's been several days now , I am not sure .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , the sugar was burnt during the dry-cleaning process . And there you go .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , that's so bad . I know little about that . Is there a remedy for it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am awfully sorry . Please tell us about the stains before the dry-cleaning next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK , I will .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is a membership card . You can get a 20 percent discount next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks a lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hope to see you again . We will provide the best service .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I enjoy the folk song and dance show very much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you appreciate our folk music . But a live performance is much more interesting .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't wait anymore . When does the performance start ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The show starts at 7 and is over at around 10 o'clock p . m .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ( After the show ) It's an excellent musical . The acting was very expressive and the songs and dancing were superb .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm glad you enjoyed it . It's had long run , but the house has always been full .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you think of the leading actors ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Personally I liked the main character . He was true to type .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are a better judge . I don't know the play well enough .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , I'm back ! Hmm ... your hair is pretty damaged , and you've got split ends .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? What can I do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , the trim should fix the split ends , but you might need a deep conditioning treatment .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm , OK . Whatever you think will help .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm also going to add some layers to frame your face .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can you use the thinning shears on top , too ? My hair is really thick .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No problem !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hi , I'm back ! Hmm ... your hair is pretty damaged , and you've got split ends .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really ? What can I do ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , the trim should fix the split ends , but you might need a deep conditioning treatment .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm , OK . Whatever you think will help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm also going to add some layers to frame your face .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you use the thinning shears on top , too ? My hair is really thick .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey , look out !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What happened ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You've just scratched my car . Oh , God , a paint was scratched off .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where ? my car ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , mine !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank goodness !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I've just had it repainted .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's terrible .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am sorry to say this , sir , but you should've been more careful .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I apologize for that . But the space is too small .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What about the damage to my car ? What are you gonna do about that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can we solve this later ? I am calling the insurance company .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . I gotta call mine too .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Excuse me , What time does the next bus for Boston leave ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It leaves at 8

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Are there any seat available ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just a moment please . Yes . You can have a seat .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good . How much is it when we take it ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It thirty-eight dollars .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right . Here ' s forty dollars .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here ' s your ticket and change .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Which gate should I go to for the bus ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Go to gate No . 2 please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don ' t mention it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you OK ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm fine . I'm just so touched by the sad story .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So I can say now that you must have enjoyed the opera . Which scene is your favorite ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I love them all . But if I had to name one as the best , I would say it's the ending .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's it about ? You know , I couldn't help falling asleep .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did you ? I didn't notice that . But still you should know it , for you have seen it with Laura before .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I guess I've done the same thing last time I was here with her , too . I mean falling asleep . For me , this one is not that attractive .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I doubt if you like operas at all .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . I like Carmen very much . But I don't mind if you want to tell me about this one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK , then . The man was old and he was visiting his wife's grave , with a rose in his hand . When he got there , he saw someone already put a rose on her grave .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very impressive . And I do like the leading actress who has an amazing voice .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Me , too . There was always a good round of applause every time she sings .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , the applause ! That was what kept waking me up during the show .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And it's been such a faultless performance with the perfect lighting , and music . Just amazing !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No doubt , it's not a simple thing to put on a ' phantom show ' .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Exactly .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ! No ! Damn it !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a blackout . Now I can't see Seinfeld .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what ? I just lost one hour's worth of work .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? How could you do that ? Don't you save every couple minutes ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , I didn't save this time . Damn it ! And I'm sick of writing this paper . Now I have to write it all over again too .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've had that problem too many times . So I learned to save . When I'm writing something , I save every three sentences or so . I don't want to lose anything .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I hate computers . Sometimes I think they cause more trouble than they're worth .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are we going to do now ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know . I feel like going out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I wonder how much of the city is down .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It doesn't matter . I still can go out and buy a beer .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe . But if there's a blackout , probably the pubs are closed . And besides , I know you have a political science exam tomorrow . I thought you had a lot of reading to do .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , that's true . Damn ! I just lost half my paper , and now I can't even do my homework . This is a bad time for this to happen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have a flashlight in my closet . If you want to use that to read , you can .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . I think I will try . Where are you going ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like your idea of getting a beer . I think I'll go out myself .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Maybe we can trade . Why don't you stay here and read for my exam , and I'll go drink beer ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , it just won't work . If I read for your exam , you won't know the answers tomorrow . I will .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So ? You can go to the class for me . Just write my name on the exam book and take the exam . Why not ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How many students are in the class ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: About fourteen .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So it won't work , old buddy . They'll see that I'm not you . Sorry .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Damn !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , Pratt . How was your interview yesterday ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello , Finn . I did a wonderful job and I was employed . How about you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am sorry to tell you that I have lost the opportunity .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why ? You are so excellent . I think you are the most suitable person for the job .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I know I am excellent , but I pay no attention to the etiquette you ' Ve told me .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What ? Then what did you do ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When I entered the room , I forgot to close the door . Later , I couldn ' t help smoking , you know I am a heavy-smoker . What ' s more , I forgot to polish my shoes . There is some dirt on it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You are so careless . You know they are the basic rules you should follow before you attend an interview . Do remember not to smoke any more , otherwise , you can ' t find a job .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes , I know . And next time I must make good preparations .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good luck next time .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Tim ' s smiles are interesting .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , they are shy and gentle but very powerful .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are right . They sweep Nancy off her feet . And now she fell head over heels in love with him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How wonderful it would be if I had such smiles !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Take a seat inside and see what you think . So you will take the Porsche then , sir ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , and I want to buy the insurance too . I think it's necessary .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're smart to buy it . At 45 dollars for three days , it is a good deal .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Can I return the car in San Francisco ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: San Francisco ? No , sir . We only have this office here . You will have to return it here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really ? I heard in America you can return rental cars in different cities .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , sir . That's only with the very big companies . I'm sorry , but this car must be returned to this lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , I guess I will have to drive back down then . Hmm . I didn't think of that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you still want the car , sir ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . It will be fun . Driving back down the coast . My girlfriend will like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a beautiful drive .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where are the keys ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Just a moment , sir . We have to finish filling out the forms .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , can I help you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No , thanks . I'm just looking .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right . If you need any help , just let me know . My name is Greg .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , I'll let you know if I need anything . Hm , this mattress is very firm . Jack will probably like it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you find something you like ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , this mattress is very good . It's pretty firm . The mattress I ' m now sleeping on is saggy .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You are right . This is very good brand . It doesn't sag easily and we offer a lifetime warranty , so you don't have to worry about its quality .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Does it come with a frame ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Unfortunately , it doesn't . However we can give you a 10 % discount on the frame . We also offer a very good financing plan . There is no payment no interest until next June .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's an attractive plan . I'll think about it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for coming tonight , Mrs . Webber . As a teacher , it's great seeing the kid's parents assist our parent-teacher conference night .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course ! I am very interested to know how my child is doing and also get some insight from you as to how he can improve .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well Allen is a great student . He is a hard worker and very well behaved , however he does struggle a bit with math .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess he gets that from me , I never did well in math when I was a kid . What can I do at home to compliment what he is learning in the classroom .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , it's important that you sit with him and review his homework assignments and help him with math . I would also recommend he stay after school twice a week for tutoring sessions . It will really help a lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks a lot ! I will definitely do that . Is there anything else ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Um ... yes . Here is a notice from our financial department , seems your child's Tumion is overdue .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh yes , I ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah ! It hurts . Don't touch it .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What part hurts ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The shoulder .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well , maybe you broke it . But what I'm worried about is this cut .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not a cut . It's a gash ! It's bigger than a cut ! Ah ! I need a doctor .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: C'mon . Just don't move .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm bleeding too much .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We don't have a decent First Aid Kit , do we ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes . My bike has one under the seat . Get it , quick !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There's some tape , iodine , and cloth bandages . I don't think the cloth bandages can stop the bleeding . What we need is a tourniquet .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wrap a few loops of the bandages around my upper arm , then twist . That will work as a tourniquet . After that , you can cut more of the bandages to cover the wound .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good plan . Let me put some iodine on the cut .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No , forget that ! Do the tourniquet first . I'm losing too much blood .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright , alright . How did you cut this so bad ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ran it against that fence pole as I crashed . What do you think ? Damn , it hurts !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We'll have to get you to a hospital . I can ride you on the back of my bike .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm lucky I wasn't killed . I must have been going around forty-five miles an hour . There was too much gravel on that corner . I slid out .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , I almost slid too . Alright . This tourniquet is tight . How does it feel ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Make it tighter . I want the blood stopped . Then wrap some bandages around the cut . Then we can go . Ouch ! I hope I can walk .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Alright , I'm twisting it around . You tell me when to stop .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There . Stop !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi , John , this is Mary , your tenant up in Lincoln Park .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , hi , Mary , what can I do for you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I was wondering when trash collection day was .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s on Tuesdays and Fridays .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You could save a couple of dollars by taking it to the dump yourself , though .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh , o . k . Where ' s that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It ' s at the corner of that street .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks . Who do I call for trash collection ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just leave the stuff by the curb . The company ' ll send a guy out next month to give you the bill .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right . Thanks a lot .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No problem .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Who are those guys ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Kobe Bryant and Shaquille O ' Neal , they are the Los Angeles Lakers ' star players .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Wait a second . He shoots , he scores !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: All right !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Here comes Jordan , though .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wow , Michael Jordan ' s slam-dunks are beautiful things to watch .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah . He ' s older , so he doesn ' t slam as much as he did when he was younger , but when he does , it ' s still amazing .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Which team do you think will win ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The Lakers . Jordan is the only good player Washington has .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you think they two will get married ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , you can count on it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think so . Yes , they get along so well .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I like him . He's good for her .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're right . He sure is .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you enjoy your meal ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , we really enjoyed it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: May I interest you in some dessert ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , that sounds great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , we have chocolate mousse cake , homemade fresh strawberry shortcake , and a spicy rum apple crisp for our specials .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The apple crisp sounds great .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Since there are four of you , would you like to split a second dessert ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Good suggestion . Could you please bring us a chocolate mousse cake and four dessert forks , please ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you like coffee or tea with your dessert ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Let's have four coffees , please .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: OK . I will be right back with your desserts and drinks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you ! We have really enjoyed our meal here .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is there anything I can do for you ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Would you please show me that mural ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Certainly . Here you are .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It looks so beautiful . How much is it ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Four hundred yuan .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's a bit more than I wanted to pay . Can you cut the price down a bit ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry . Ours is a fixed price shop and I can assure you this is the best price you can get for a mural like this .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Maybe you are right . OK , I'll take it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I'll have it wrapped for you .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Here is four hundred yuan .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you . Please come again .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you sit down , Mr . White ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . It's very kind of you to invite me to such a beautiful place .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I propose a toast to your pleasant tour in China .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you very much .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This food is a Wax specialty . Please help yourself .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you . Oh , it tastes nice .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Come again ? What are you talking about ? Aren't we on the same team now ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Guess again , Dave . I have no intention of leaving invoking . Never did .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you mean ? You didn't ? Oh , no ... No !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's right , Dave . I tricked you into giving a confession . And I've recorded every word of it .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But how ? So you knew all along I was with WebTracker ? How did you know ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I saw your green post-it notes . Nobody else has them .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It ' s so great to be here ! I ' m so excited to help you and my daughter with your new home !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We ' re glad that you ' re here . Would you like a tour of the house ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' d be great , but could I have a cup of tea first ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure , I ' ll just go put the kettle on . Why don ' t you have a seat on the sofa and I ' ll go take care of things in the kitchen .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That would be lovely , thanks .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Do you take milk or sugar with your tea ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I ' ll take a little milk , but no sugar , please . Make sure you let the tea steep a few minutes before you take the tea bag out of the cup .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Ok . What do you think about our living room ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well , I do like the mantelpiece and the coffee table , but I don ' t really care for curtains . Did you get them at a yard sale ? They look ancient .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My parents gave them to us as a house warming gift .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh dear . Well , I suppose they will do for now . do you ever dust in here ? It seems a bit dusty in here .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your daughter usually does the dusting , and I do the vacuuming .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see . Well , I can help with the chores while I ' m here . You two could probably use my help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s very nice of you to offer . Here ' s your tea . Be careful , it ' s still quite hot .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please come in , Steven .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right , Mr . Green .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have a seat over there . How are things going out in the office ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Pretty well . Everyone is working hard .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But , our business has been going down sharply the couple of months and we have to reduce some staff .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You mean I'm among the people who have to go ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid so .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Did I do something wrong ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're the sales manager , but our sales didn't go up .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But you know I've been working very hard . And I have a family to support .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel sorry , but that's the decision of the directorate .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey . Why did you take that money ? You are such a cheater ! I should send you to jail !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am not cheating . When you pass go , you collect $ 200 , Everyone knows that !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well you can ' t just take the money . You have to ask the bank for money . And I ' m the banker .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Banker ?

utterances.speaker: A
