utterances.text: sure , where would you like to go ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: perhaps we could go to the library festival that's going on at the local bookshop .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey Sandra , what's wrong ? You look furious !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've had it with Tim ! I think I'm going to quit !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But Sandra ... you love your job ! You spent months trying to get this position . It's perfect for you !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah ... I know . But I'm sick and tired of all the office power struggles !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What kind of power struggles are you talking about ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Basically , I think Tim is threatened by me . I'm doing a better job than he is so he's trying to sabotage my career !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So he talks about you behind your back ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes . He's all nice and friendly to my face . But the second I turn around he stabs me in the back !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I had a worker like that once . She was always taking credit for my ideas .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I should keep a better record of my correspondence with the clients so if necessary I can prove it was my effort .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: My co-worker had a whole bunch of bad office habits . She liked to name-drop ... we would be in a meeting and she would say , yesterday I was chatting with Tom . She meant Tom Solomon ... our CEO .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you hear who won the election ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can ' t believe that Obama won .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I couldn ' t be happier to know that he ' s our new President .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know ! He just made history !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You voted for him , right ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I did . Did you ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I voted for him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I am so happy that he is our new President !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So am I .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope that he brings change to America .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have faith in him .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I have faith in our new President .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What a nice day !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes . How about going out and enjoying the sunshine on the grass ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: great , let's go !

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: hey , darling , I think I might have a little heatstroke from being in the sun all day . I was so relaxed . It felt as if I were in another world .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: exactly . You know , the sunshine and wind remind me of our honeymoon . You remember ? The island , the sound of the waves , the salty sea air and the sunshine ...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yes , it was wonderful but it's already been a year . How time flies !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: why not go again to celebrate out one-year anniversary ? We can go to the same beach , stay in the same hotel and enjoy a dinner in the same restaurant .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: are you kidding ? Can you afford it ? Do you think we can get a room on such short notice ?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: never mind that , I'll take care of it . Are you available next week ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: yeah , I think so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: ok . I'll make the arrangements . It will be great .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: wonderful ! I'll start packing our suitcases .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Steve , thanks for looking after Johnny .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It was a pleasure , Mrs . Robinson .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And this kitchen is so clean . Did you help Johnny with that ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I helped break ... I mean WASH ... all the dishes !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's great . And the garbage , too ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah , uh , it's outside . Listen , I really have to be going now .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks for your help !

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry , ladies . Mr . Smith's viewing is over . It ended an hour ago .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But we just drove across town . Can't we just go in to see him one last ...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid not . But at tomorrow's funeral , the family requested an open casket service .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is all too fast . He's my best friend , and now he's gone .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry . I know it must have come as a great shock .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The viewing was for saying goodbye , and I didn't even get that .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very glad to know something about you , then what are you going to do when you finish .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh , I ' ll go to shanghai to practice there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That ' s a good idea . It must be easy to find a job in shanghai .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think so , you know there is a great deal of opportunity for business there .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And English is very useful in your job .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think it will be very useful in many ways . Beside , shanghai is an important trade center , not only in China , but also in the world , English is useful in almost all walks of life .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You will be a very promising one .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That ' s my wish .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello , is Marie Ward there , please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll see if she is in .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ok .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm afraid she's out .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you give her a message , please ?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes , of course .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Please tell her to give Colin a call when she gets back . She has my number .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you for your help .

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's my pleasure .
